The &#8220;Clinical Trial Termination &#13;&#10;Fee&#8221; means an amount equal to (i) Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000) if the Clinical &#13;&#10;Trial Termination Option is exercised in accordance with this Section on or before January 31, &#13;&#10;2017, (ii) Seven Hundred Thousand Dollars ($700,000) if the Clinical Trial Termination Option &#13;&#10;is exercised in accordance with this Section between February 1, 2017 and February 28, 2017, &#13;&#10;and (iii) Nine Hundred Thousand Dollars ($900,000) if the Clinical Trial Termination Option is &#13;&#10;exercised in accordance with this Section between March 1, 2017 and the Clinical Trial &#13;&#10;Termination Outside Date. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3.1.3 If Tenant exercises the Clinical Trial Termination Option in accordance &#13;&#10;with this Section on or before the Clinical Trial Termination Outside Date, then this Lease shall &#13;&#10;terminate on the date which is three (3) business days after the date Tenant so exercises the &#13;&#10;Clinical Trial Termination Option (such date, the &#8220;Clinical Trial Termination Date&#8221;), and this &#13;&#10;Lease shall thereafter be of no further force or effect, except for those provisions that, by their &#13;&#10;express terms, survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Lease. Tenant shall surrender &#13;&#10;the Premises to Landlord on the Clinical Trial Termination Date in accordance with all of the &#13;&#10;terms and conditions of this Lease. If Tenant does not so surrender the Premises in accordance &#13;&#10;with all of the terms and conditions of this Lease on or before the Clinical Trial Termination &#13;&#10;Date, then Tenant, pursuant to Section 27.2, shall become a tenant at sufferance with respect to &#13;&#10;the Premises until the actual date that Tenant surrenders the Premises to Landlord in accordance &#13;&#10;with the terms and conditions of this Lease and rent for the Premises shall commence to accrue &#13;&#10;on a per diem basis as of the Clinical Trial Termination Date at the rate set forth in Section 27.2, &#13;&#10;calculated as if the rent for the prior month were Three Hundred Two Thousand Nine Hundred &#13;&#10;Seventy-Nine and 20/100 Dollars ($302,979.20). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3.1.4 Notwithstanding anything in this Section to the contrary, Tenant shall not &#13;&#10;be permitted to exercise the Clinical Trial Termination Option during such period of time that &#13;&#10;Tenant is in Default under any provision of this Lease. Any attempted exercise of the Clinical &#13;&#10;Trial Termination Option during a period of time in which Tenant is so in Default shall be void &#13;&#10;and of no force or effect. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3.1.5 Landlord will keep all non-public information disclosed to Landlord in &#13;&#10;connection with the Clinical Trial and the Clinical Endpoints confidential in accordance with &#13;&#10;Article 38 of this Lease, and will not disclose such information, except in the circumstances &#13;&#10;permitted under Article 38. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3.2 Acquisition Termination Option. Upon completion of the Pre-Delivery Landlord Work (a) Landlord shall deliver the &#13;&#10;Premises to Tenant for Tenant&#8217;s construction of the Tenant Improvements (as defined below), &#13;&#10;and (b) Tenant shall have full access to the Premises to construct the Tenant Improvements &#13;&#10;(subject to the terms, conditions and provisions of this Lease and the Work Letter). Landlord &#13;&#10;and Tenant will cooperate with one another as required to allow (i) Landlord to complete the &#13;&#10;Post-Delivery Landlord Work (as defined in Exhibit D) in accordance with Landlord&#8217;s plans and &#13;&#10;schedule for the completion of such work (and Tenant will ensure that Tenant&#8217;s construction of &#13;&#10;the Tenant Improvements does not interfere with the completion of the Post-Delivery Landlord &#13;&#10;Work) and (ii) Tenant to construct the Tenant Improvements (and Landlord will ensure that &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s construction of the Post-Delivery Landlord Work does not interfere with the &#13;&#10;completion of the Tenant Improvements). In the event of a conflict in accordance with the &#13;&#10;foregoing which cannot be resolved through agreement of the parties, Landlord&#8217;s completion of &#13;&#10;the Post-Delivery Landlord Work will have priority. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4.2. The &#8220;Term Commencement Date&#8221; shall be the earlier of (a) the Estimated Term &#13;&#10;Commencement Date and (b) the first day Tenant commences business operations in any portion &#13;&#10;of the Premises; provided, however, if Landlord fails to complete the Pre-Delivery Landlord &#13;&#10;Work by February 28, 2017 (the &#8220;Pre-Delivery Landlord Work Target Date&#8221;) (which Pre- &#13;&#10;Delivery Landlord Work Target Date will be extended on a day-for-day basis by the number of &#13;&#10;days of delay caused by Force Majeure or delays caused by Tenant or any Tenant Party (as &#13;&#10;defined in Section 21.1)), then the Estimated Term Commencement Date shall be extended on a &#13;&#10;day-for-day basis for each day thereafter that the Pre-Delivery Landlord Work is not complete. &#13;&#10;If Landlord fails to complete the Pre-Delivery Landlord Work by May 1, 2017 (the &#8220;Pre- &#13;&#10;Delivery Landlord Work Outside Date&#8221;) (which Pre-Delivery Landlord Work Outside Date will &#13;&#10;be extended on a day-for-day basis by the number of days of delay caused by Force Majeure or &#13;&#10;delays caused by Tenant or any Tenant Party (as defined in Section 21.1)), then Tenant shall be &#13;&#10;entitled to receive one (1) day of Rent abatement for each day thereafter that the Pre-Delivery &#13;&#10;Landlord Work is not complete, and such abatement shall be applied toward Tenant&#8217;s first &#13;&#10;required payment(s) of Rent during the Term. The &#13;&#10;Base TI Allowance, together with the Additional TI Allowance (if properly requested by Tenant &#13;&#10;pursuant to this Article), shall be referred to herein as the &quot;TI Allowance. The TI Allowance &#13;&#10;may be applied to the costs of (a) construction, (b) project review by Landlord (which fee shall &#13;&#10;equal one-half of one percent (0.5%) of the TI Allowance), (c) commissioning of mechanical, &#13;&#10;electrical and plumbing systems by a licensed, qualified commissioning agent hired by Tenant, &#13;&#10;and reasonably approved by Landlord, (d) space planning, architect, engineering and other &#13;&#10;related services performed by third parties unaffiliated with Tenant and up to three and one-half &#13;&#10;percent (3.5%) of the TI Allowance may be used for the cost of a third party project management &#13;&#10;consultant retained by Tenant, (e) building permits and other taxes, fees, charges and levies by &#13;&#10;Governmental Authorities (as defined below) for permits or for inspections of the Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements, and (f) costs and expenses for labor, material, equipment and fixtures. In no &#13;&#10;event shall the TI Allowance be used for (v) the cost of work that is consistent with the &#13;&#10;Approved Plans (as defined in the Work Letter) or otherwise approved in writing by Landlord, &#13;&#10;(w) payments to Tenant or any affiliates of Tenant, (x) the purchase of any furniture, personal &#13;&#10;property or other non-building system equipment (provided, however, that Tenant shall be &#13;&#10;permitted to apply up to One Million Two Hundred Forty-Five Thousand One Hundred Twenty &#13;&#10;and 00/100 Dollars ($1,245,120) of the TI Allowance toward Tenant&#8217;s cost to move into the &#13;&#10;Premises, to fabricate and install Tenant&#8217;s Signage, and to purchase furniture, fixtures and &#13;&#10;equipment, telecommunications and data cabling, security and audio visual systems to be used in &#13;&#10;the Premises), (y) costs resulting from any default by Tenant of its obligations under this Lease &#13;&#10;or (z) costs that are recoverable by Tenant from a third party (e.g., insurers, warrantors, or &#13;&#10;tortfeasors). Tenant will be permitted to reuse any of the existing fifteen (15) fume hoods &#13;&#10;currently being stored on the ground floor of the Building; provided that such fume hoods are &#13;&#10;accepted by Tenant in their &#8220;as is&#8221; condition and Landlord makes no representation or warranty &#13;&#10;as to the condition of such fume hoods or their fitness for Tenant&#8217;s intended use. Tenant will &#13;&#10;repair and maintain the fume hoods which Tenant elects to use throughout the Term in &#13;&#10;accordance with industry standard repair and maintenance standards, provided that Tenant will &#13;&#10;have the right to either replace or remove any fume hoods that Tenant has elected to use which &#13;&#10;reach the end of their serviceable life during the Term of the Lease. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

Landlord and Tenant shall mutually agree upon the selection of the engineers, &#13;&#10;general contractor and major subcontractors; provided that Tenant will have the right to select &#13;&#10;the general contractor pursuant to a competitive bid process using general contractors mutually &#13;&#10;approved by Landlord and Tenant. Tenant shall enter into a design contract with McFarlane &#13;&#10;Architects to act as the architect for the Tenant Improvements (and shall provide a copy of such &#13;&#10;design contract to Landlord) within two (2) business days after the Execution Date. Landlord &#13;&#10;may refuse to approve any architects, consultants, contractors, subcontractors or material &#13;&#10;suppliers that Landlord reasonably believes could cause labor disharmony or may not have &#13;&#10;sufficient experience, in Landlord&#8217;s reasonable opinion, to perform work in an occupied Class &#13;&#10;&#8220;A&#8221; laboratory research building and in lab areas. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4.8. 	10 &#13;&#10;writing or becomes void or lapses due to time. Prior to the TI Funding Date, Tenant will pay all &#13;&#10;costs associated with the Tenant Improvements as and when such amounts become due, and will &#13;&#10;ensure that all such costs are paid timely and in a manner which eliminates any risk of a lien &#13;&#10;being filed against the Building; provided that Tenant will not be permitted to commence any &#13;&#10;demolition or construction in the Premises prior to the date upon which the Clinical Trial &#13;&#10;Termination Option is waived by Tenant in writing or becomes void or lapses due to time. In the &#13;&#10;event that Tenant exercises the Clinical Trial Termination Option, Landlord shall have no &#13;&#10;obligation to fund any portion of the TI Allowance or to otherwise reimburse Tenant for any &#13;&#10;costs incurred by Tenant in connection with the Tenant Improvements, this Lease or the &#13;&#10;Premises. In the event that Tenant does not exercise the Clinical Trial Termination Option and &#13;&#10;the Clinical Trial Termination Option lapses or becomes void, all costs incurred by Tenant in &#13;&#10;connection with the Tenant Improvements shall (to the extent such costs would otherwise be &#13;&#10;chargeable against the TI Allowance pursuant to this Lease) be subject to reimbursement from &#13;&#10;the TI Allowance in accordance with the terms of the Work Letter. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;5. Condition of Premises. Except as provided below, Tenant acknowledges that neither &#13;&#10;Landlord nor any agent of Landlord has made any representation or warranty with respect to the &#13;&#10;condition of the Premises, the Building or the Project, or with respect to the suitability of the &#13;&#10;Premises, the Building or the Project for the conduct of Tenant&#8217;s business. Except as provided &#13;&#10;below, Tenant acknowledges that (a) it is fully familiar with the condition of the Premises and &#13;&#10;agrees to take the same in its condition &#8220;as is&#8221; as of the date that Landlord delivers the Premises &#13;&#10;to Tenant for Tenant&#8217;s construction of the Tenant Improvements in accordance with Section 4.1, &#13;&#10;and (b) Landlord shall have no obligation to alter, repair or otherwise prepare the Premises for &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s occupancy or to pay for or construct any improvements to the Premises, except with &#13;&#10;respect to the performance, at Landlord&#8217;s sole cost and expense, of the Landlord Work and &#13;&#10;payment of the Base TI Allowance and, if properly requested by Tenant pursuant to the terms of &#13;&#10;the Lease, the Additional TI Allowance. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Lease, &#13;&#10;Landlord shall deliver the Premises to Tenant with (y) the Pre-Delivery Landlord Work and (z) &#13;&#10;the existing heating, ventilating and air-conditioning, electrical, plumbing and fire/life safety &#13;&#10;systems serving the Building core (but not the distribution of such systems throughout the &#13;&#10;Premises, which will be performed as part of the Tenant Improvements), the existing galvanized &#13;&#10;supply air and exhaust air duct risers, the existing roof structure, roof membrane, Building &#13;&#10;elevators and the Generator (as defined in Section 16.8) (all of the foregoing listed in this &#13;&#10;Subsection 5(z) shall be referred to herein as, the &#8220;Existing Systems&#8221;) in good working &#13;&#10;condition and in compliance with all Applicable Laws (including, without limitation, the ADA &#13;&#10;inclusive of path of travel requirements to the extent required in order to obtain a final sign off &#13;&#10;on the permits for the Pre-Delivery Landlord Work) (the &#8220;Delivery Requirement&#8221;). Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;taking of possession of the Premises shall, except as otherwise agreed to in writing by Landlord &#13;&#10;and Tenant, conclusively establish that the Premises, the Building and the Project were at such &#13;&#10;time in good, sanitary and satisfactory condition and repair and that the Delivery Requirement &#13;&#10;was satisfied; provided that, if Landlord fails to satisfy the Delivery Requirement (a &#8220;Delivery &#13;&#10;Shortfall&#8221;), then Tenant may, as its sole and exclusive remedy, deliver notice to Landlord &#13;&#10;detailing the nature of such failure (a &#8220;Shortfall Notice&#8221;); provided, further, that any Shortfall &#13;&#10;Notice must be received by Landlord no later than the date (the &#8220;Shortfall Notice Deadline&#8221;) that &#13;&#10;is thirty (30) days after the Term Commencement Date. In the event that Landlord receives a &#13;&#10;Shortfall Notice on or before the Shortfall Notice Deadline, Landlord shall, at Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	11 &#13;&#10;expense, promptly remedy the Delivery Shortfall. Landlord shall not have any obligations or &#13;&#10;liabilities in connection with (aa) a failure to satisfy the Delivery Requirement except to the &#13;&#10;extent such failure is identified by Tenant in a Shortfall Notice delivered to Landlord on or &#13;&#10;before the Shortfall Notice Deadline, or (bb) any failure of the Pre-Delivery Landlord Work or &#13;&#10;the Existing Systems to be in good working condition or in compliance with Applicable Laws &#13;&#10;due to any event, circumstance or other factor arising or occurring after Landlord&#8217;s delivery of &#13;&#10;the Premises to Tenant (including, without limitation, (i) any act or omission of Tenant, Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;contractors or subcontractors, or any of their respective employees, agents or invitees, (ii) the &#13;&#10;construction of the Tenant Improvements or (iii) Tenant&#8217;s failure to properly repair or maintain &#13;&#10;the Premises as required by this Lease), and no Delivery Shortfall shall be deemed to have &#13;&#10;occurred as a result thereof. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6. Rentable Area. &#13;&#10;6.1. The term &#8220;Rentable Area&#8221; shall reflect such areas as reasonably calculated by &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s architect, as the same may be reasonably adjusted from time to time by Landlord in &#13;&#10;consultation with Landlord&#8217;s architect to reflect changes to the Premises, the Building or the &#13;&#10;Project, as applicable. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6.2. The Rentable Area of the Building is generally determined by making separate &#13;&#10;calculations of Rentable Area applicable to each floor within the Building and totaling the &#13;&#10;Rentable Area of all floors within the Building. The Rentable Area of a floor is computed by &#13;&#10;measuring to the outside finished surface of the permanent outer Building walls. The full area &#13;&#10;calculated as previously set forth is included as Rentable Area, without deduction for columns &#13;&#10;and projections or vertical penetrations, including stairs, elevator shafts, flues, pipe shafts, &#13;&#10;vertical ducts and the like, as well as such items&#8217; enclosing walls. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6.3. The term &#8220;Rentable Area,&#8221; when applied to the Premises, is that area equal to the &#13;&#10;usable area of the Premises, plus an equitable allocation of Rentable Area within each Building &#13;&#10;that is not then utilized or expected to be utilized as usable area, including that portion of the &#13;&#10;Building devoted to corridors, equipment rooms, restrooms, elevator lobby, atrium and &#13;&#10;mailroom. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6.4. &#13;&#10;the Project. &#13;&#10;The Rentable Area of the Project is the total Rentable Area of all buildings within &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6.5. Review of allocations of Rentable Areas as between tenants of the Building and &#13;&#10;the Project shall be made as frequently as Landlord deems appropriate, including in order to &#13;&#10;facilitate an equitable apportionment of Operating Expenses (as defined below); provided, &#13;&#10;however, that notwithstanding Landlord&#8217;s right to review such allocations of Rentable Areas, &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s Base Rent and Tenant&#8217;s Pro Rata Shares shall not be subject to increase other than in &#13;&#10;connection with an actual physical modification of the Building or Project. If such review is by &#13;&#10;a licensed architect and allocations are certified by such licensed architect as being correct, then &#13;&#10;Tenant shall be bound by such certifications. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	12 &#13;&#10;7. Rent. &#13;&#10;7.1. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Tenant shall pay to Landlord as Base Rent for the Premises, commencing on the &#13;&#10;Term Commencement Date, the sums set forth in Section 2.3, subject to the rental adjustments &#13;&#10;provided in Article 8 hereof. Base Rent shall be paid in equal monthly installments as set forth &#13;&#10;in Section 2.3, subject to the rental adjustments provided in Article 8 hereof, each in advance on &#13;&#10;the first day of each and every calendar month during the Term. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;7.2. In addition to Base Rent, Tenant shall pay to Landlord as additional rent &#13;&#10;(&#8220;Additional Rent&#8221;) at times hereinafter specified in this Lease (a) Tenant&#8217;s Adjusted Share (as &#13;&#10;defined below) of Operating Expenses (as defined below), (b) the Property Management Fee (as &#13;&#10;defined below), (c) [Intentionally omitted] and (d) any other amounts that Tenant assumes or &#13;&#10;agrees to pay under the provisions of this Lease that are owed to Landlord, including any and all &#13;&#10;other sums that may become due by reason of any default of Tenant or failure on Tenant&#8217;s part to &#13;&#10;comply with the agreements, terms, covenants and conditions of this Lease to be performed by &#13;&#10;Tenant, after notice and the lapse of any applicable cure periods. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;7.3. Base Rent and Additional Rent shall together be denominated &#8220;Rent.&#8221; Rent shall &#13;&#10;be paid to Landlord, without abatement, deduction or offset, in lawful money of the United &#13;&#10;States of America (i) to the address set forth in Section 2.8, (ii) via direct deposit (ACH) to a &#13;&#10;bank account designated by Landlord, or (iii) or to such other person or at such other place as &#13;&#10;Landlord may from time designate in writing. In the event the Term commences or ends on a &#13;&#10;day other than the first day of a calendar month, then the Rent for such fraction of a month shall &#13;&#10;be prorated for such period on the basis of the number of days in the month and shall be paid at &#13;&#10;the then-current rate for such fractional month. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;7.4. Except as otherwise provided in this Lease, Tenant&#8217;s obligation to pay Rent shall &#13;&#10;not be discharged or otherwise affected by (a) any Applicable Laws now or hereafter applicable &#13;&#10;to the Premises, (b) any other restriction on Tenant&#8217;s use, (c) except as expressly provided &#13;&#10;herein, any casualty or taking or (d) any other occurrence; and Tenant waives all rights now or &#13;&#10;hereafter existing to terminate or cancel this Lease or quit or surrender the Premises or any part &#13;&#10;thereof, or to assert any defense in the nature of constructive eviction to any action seeking to &#13;&#10;recover rent. Tenant&#8217;s obligation to pay Rent with respect to any period or obligations arising, &#13;&#10;existing or pertaining to the period prior to the date of the expiration or earlier termination of the &#13;&#10;Term or this Lease shall survive any such expiration or earlier termination; provided, however, &#13;&#10;that nothing in this sentence shall in any way affect Tenant&#8217;s obligations with respect to any &#13;&#10;other period. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;8. Rent Adjustments. Base Rent shall be subject to an annual upward adjustment of three &#13;&#10;percent (3%) of the then-current Base Rent. The first such adjustment shall become effective &#13;&#10;commencing on the first (1st) annual anniversary of the Term Commencement Date, and &#13;&#10;subsequent adjustments shall become effective on every successive annual anniversary for so &#13;&#10;long as this Lease continues in effect. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9. Operating Expenses. &#13;&#10;9.1. As used herein, the term &#8220;Operating Expenses&#8221; shall include: &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

taxes on this transaction or any document to which Tenant is a party creating or &#13;&#10;transferring an interest in the Premises; and any expenses, including the reasonable cost of &#13;&#10;attorneys or experts, reasonably incurred by Landlord in seeking reduction by the taxing &#13;&#10;authority of the applicable taxes, less tax refunds obtained as a result of an application for review &#13;&#10;thereof; <FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;the business of Landlord generally (as opposed to costs relating to the operation of the Project); &#13;&#10;and costs relating to charitable and political contributions). To the extent that Tenant uses more &#13;&#10;than Tenant&#8217;s Pro Rata Share of any item of Operating Expenses, Tenant shall pay Landlord for &#13;&#10;such excess in addition to Tenant&#8217;s obligation to pay Tenant&#8217;s Pro Rata Share of Operating &#13;&#10;Expenses (such excess, together with Tenant&#8217;s Pro Rata Share, &#8220;Tenant&#8217;s Adjusted Share&#8221;). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9.2. Tenant shall pay to Landlord on the first day of each calendar month of the Term, &#13;&#10;as Additional Rent, (a) the Property Management Fee (as defined below), (b) [Intentionally &#13;&#10;omitted] and (c) Landlord&#8217;s estimate of Tenant&#8217;s Adjusted Share of Operating Expenses with &#13;&#10;respect to the Building and the Project, as applicable, for such month. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(w) The &#8220;Property Management Fee&#8221; shall equal three percent (3%) of Base &#13;&#10;Rent due from Tenant. Tenant shall pay the Property Management Fee in accordance with &#13;&#10;Section 9.2 with respect to the entire Term, including any extensions thereof or any holdover &#13;&#10;periods, regardless of whether Tenant is obligated to pay Base Rent, Operating Expenses or any &#13;&#10;other Rent with respect to any such period or portion thereof. For the first eight (8) months of the &#13;&#10;Term, the Property Management Fee shall be calculated as if Tenant were paying Three Hundred &#13;&#10;Two Thousand Nine Hundred Seventy-Nine and 20/100 Dollars ($302,979.20) per month for &#13;&#10;Base Rent. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(x) [Intentionally omitted] &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(y) Within ninety (90) days after the conclusion of each calendar year (or such &#13;&#10;longer period as may be reasonably required by Landlord), Landlord shall furnish to Tenant a &#13;&#10;statement showing in reasonable detail the actual Operating Expenses, Tenant&#8217;s Adjusted Share &#13;&#10;of Operating Expenses, and the cost of providing utilities to the Premises for the previous &#13;&#10;calendar year (&#8220;Landlord&#8217;s Statement&#8221;). Any additional sum due from Tenant to Landlord shall &#13;&#10;be due and payable within thirty (30) days after receipt of an invoice therefor. If the amounts &#13;&#10;paid by Tenant pursuant to this Section exceed Tenant&#8217;s Adjusted Share of Operating Expenses &#13;&#10;for the previous calendar year, then Landlord shall credit the difference against the Rent next due &#13;&#10;and owing from Tenant; provided that, if the Lease term has expired, Landlord shall accompany &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s Statement with payment for the amount of such difference. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(z) Any amount due under this Section for any period that is less than a full &#13;&#10;month shall be prorated for such fractional month on the basis of the number of days in the &#13;&#10;month. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9.3. Landlord may, from time to time, modify Landlord&#8217;s calculation and allocation &#13;&#10;procedures for Operating Expenses, so long as such modifications produce Dollar results &#13;&#10;substantially consistent with Landlord&#8217;s then-current practice at the Project. Landlord or an &#13;&#10;affiliate(s) of Landlord currently own other property(ies) adjacent to the Project or its &#13;&#10;neighboring properties (collectively, &#8220;Neighboring Properties&#8221;). In connection with Landlord &#13;&#10;performing services for the Project pursuant to this Lease, similar services may be performed by &#13;&#10;the same vendor(s) for Neighboring Properties. In such a case, Landlord shall reasonably &#13;&#10;allocate to each Building and the Project the costs for such services based upon the ratio that the &#13;&#10;square footage of the Building or the Project (as applicable) bears to the total square footage of &#13;&#10;all of the Neighboring Properties or buildings within the Neighboring Properties for which the &#13;&#10;16 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage79"></A>

	&nbsp;

<!-- SLIDE 0020 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN020.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 20" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;services are performed, unless the scope of the services performed for any building or property &#13;&#10;(including the Building and the Project) is disproportionately more or less than for others, in &#13;&#10;which case Landlord shall equitably allocate the costs based on the scope of the services being &#13;&#10;performed for each building or property (including the Building and the Project). Since the &#13;&#10;Project consists of multiple buildings, certain Operating Expenses may pertain to a particular &#13;&#10;building(s) and other Operating Expenses to the Project as a whole. Landlord reserves the right &#13;&#10;in its reasonable discretion to allocate any such costs applicable to any particular building within &#13;&#10;the Project to such building, and other such costs applicable to the Project to each building in the &#13;&#10;Project (including the Building), with the tenants in each building being responsible for paying &#13;&#10;their respective proportionate shares of their buildings to the extent required under their leases. &#13;&#10;Landlord shall allocate such costs to the buildings (including the Building) in a reasonable, non- &#13;&#10;discriminatory manner, and such allocation shall be binding on Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9.4. Landlord&#39;s annual statement shall be final and binding upon Tenant unless Tenant, &#13;&#10;within six (6) months after Tenant&#39;s receipt thereof, shall contest any item therein by giving &#13;&#10;written notice to Landlord; provided that Tenant shall in all events pay the amount specified in &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s annual statement, pending the results of the Independent Review and determination of &#13;&#10;the Accountant(s), as applicable and as each such term is defined below. If, during such six (6) &#13;&#10;month period, Tenant reasonably and in good faith questions or contests the correctness of &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s statement of Tenant&#39;s Share of Operating Expenses, Landlord shall provide Tenant &#13;&#10;with reasonable access to Landlord&#39;s books and records to the extent relevant to determination of &#13;&#10;Operating Expenses, and such information that is reasonably responsive to Tenant&#39;s written &#13;&#10;inquiries. In the event that, after Tenant&#39;s review of such information, Landlord and Tenant &#13;&#10;cannot agree upon the amount of Tenant&#39;s Share of Operating Expenses, then Tenant shall have &#13;&#10;the right to have an independent public accounting firm hired by Tenant on an hourly basis and &#13;&#10;not on a contingent-fee basis (at Tenant&#39;s sole cost and expense) and approved by Landlord &#13;&#10;(which approval Landlord shall not unreasonably withhold or delay) audit and review such of &#13;&#10;Landlord&#39;s books and records for the year in question as directly relate to the determination of &#13;&#10;Operating Expenses for such year (the &quot;Independent Review&quot;), but not books and records of &#13;&#10;entities other than Landlord. Landlord shall make such books and records available at the &#13;&#10;location where Landlord maintains them in the ordinary course of its business. Landlord need &#13;&#10;not provide copies of any books or records. Tenant shall commence the Independent Review &#13;&#10;within fifteen (15) days after the date Landlord has given Tenant access to Landlord&#39;s books and &#13;&#10;records for the Independent Review. Tenant shall complete the Independent Review and notify &#13;&#10;Landlord in writing of Tenant&#39;s specific objections to Landlord&#39;s calculation of Operating &#13;&#10;Expenses (including Tenant&#39;s accounting firm&#39;s written statement of the basis, nature and amount &#13;&#10;of each proposed adjustment) no later than sixty (60) days after Landlord has first given Tenant &#13;&#10;access to Landlord&#39;s books and records for the Independent Review. Landlord shall review the &#13;&#10;results of any such Independent Review. The parties shall endeavor to agree promptly and &#13;&#10;reasonably upon Operating Expenses taking into account the results of such Independent &#13;&#10;Review. If, as of sixty (60) days after Tenant has submitted the Independent Review to &#13;&#10;Landlord, the parties have not agreed on the appropriate adjustments to Operating Expenses, &#13;&#10;then the parties shall engage a mutually agreeable independent third party accountant with at &#13;&#10;least ten (10) years&#39; experience in commercial real estate accounting in the San Diego area (the &#13;&#10;&quot;Accountant&quot;). If the parties cannot agree on the Accountant, each shall within ten (10) days &#13;&#10;after such impasse appoint an Accountant (different from the accountant and accounting firm &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;that conducted the Independent Review) and, within ten (10) days after the appointment of both &#13;&#10;such Accountants, those two Accountants shall select a third (which cannot be the accountant &#13;&#10;and accounting firm that conducted the Independent Review). If either party fails to timely &#13;&#10;appoint an Accountant, then the Accountant the other party appoints shall be the sole &#13;&#10;Accountant. Within ten (10) days after appointment of the Accountant(s), Landlord and Tenant &#13;&#10;shall each simultaneously give the Accountants (with a copy to the other party) its determination &#13;&#10;of Operating Expenses, with such supporting data or information as each submitting party &#13;&#10;determines appropriate. Within ten (10) days after such submissions, the Accountants shall by &#13;&#10;majority vote select either Landlord&#39;s or Tenant&#39;s determination of Operating Expenses. The &#13;&#10;Accountants may not select or designate any other determination of Operating Expenses. The &#13;&#10;determination of the Accountant(s) shall bind the parties. If the parties agree or the &#13;&#10;Accountant(s) determine that the Operating Expenses actually paid by Tenant for the calendar &#13;&#10;year in question exceeded Tenant&#39;s obligations for such calendar year, then Landlord shall, at &#13;&#10;Tenant&#39;s option, either (a) credit the excess to the next succeeding installments of estimated &#13;&#10;Additional Rent or (b) pay the excess to Tenant within thirty (30) days after delivery of such &#13;&#10;results. If the parties agree or the Accountant(s) determine that Tenant&#39;s payments of Operating &#13;&#10;Expenses for such calendar year were less than Tenant&#39;s obligation for the calendar year, then &#13;&#10;Tenant shall pay the deficiency to Landlord within thirty (30) days after delivery of such results. &#13;&#10;If the Independent Review reveals or the Accountant(s) determine that the Operating Expenses &#13;&#10;billed to Tenant by Landlord and paid by Tenant to Landlord for the applicable calendar year in &#13;&#10;question exceeded by more than five percent (5%) what Tenant should have been billed during &#13;&#10;such calendar year, then Landlord shall pay the reasonable cost of the Independent Review and &#13;&#10;the reasonable cost of the Accountant(s). In all other cases Tenant shall pay the cost of the &#13;&#10;Independent Review and the Accountant(s). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9.5. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Lease, the aggregate Controllable &#13;&#10;Operating Expenses (as defined below) shall not increase by more than five percent (5%) in any &#13;&#10;calendar year over the amount of Controllable Operating Expenses actually charged to Tenant &#13;&#10;for the immediately preceding calendar year (the &#8220;Cap&#8221;), beginning with the 2019 calendar &#13;&#10;year&#8217;s Operating Expenses (i.e., comparing 2018 to 2019 (on a prorated basis, if necessary)). &#13;&#10;For the avoidance of doubt, the Cap shall apply to each year of the Term beginning with the &#13;&#10;calendar year 2019, so that Controllable Operating Expenses for calendar year 2019 shall not &#13;&#10;exceed one hundred five percent (105%) of Controllable Operating Expenses actually charged &#13;&#10;for calendar year 2018 (on a prorated basis, if necessary), Controllable Operating Expenses for &#13;&#10;calendar year 2020 shall not exceed one hundred five percent (105%) of Controllable Operating &#13;&#10;Expenses actually charged for 2019, etc. &#8220;Controllable Operating Expenses&#8221; means all Operating &#13;&#10;Expenses except property taxes and assessments, capital expenditures that are reasonably &#13;&#10;required, costs for repairs and maintenance (excluding preventative maintenance), utility &#13;&#10;charges, insurance charges, costs of services provided under a union contract, payments under &#13;&#10;covenants, conditions and restrictions or to an owners&#8217; association and costs associated with &#13;&#10;repairs due to casualty, vandalism or other cause outside of Landlord&#8217;s reasonable control. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9.6. Tenant shall not be responsible for Operating Expenses with respect to any time &#13;&#10;period prior to the Term Commencement Date; provided, however, that if Tenant substantially &#13;&#10;completes the Tenant Improvements and occupies the Premises for the conduct of its business &#13;&#10;prior to the Term Commencement Date, Tenant shall be responsible for Operating Expenses &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	19 &#13;&#10;from such earlier date of possession (the Term Commencement Date or such earlier date, as &#13;&#10;applicable, the &#8220;Expense Trigger Date&#8221;); and provided, further, that Landlord may annualize &#13;&#10;certain Operating Expenses incurred prior to the Expense Trigger Date over the course of the &#13;&#10;budgeted year during which the Expense Trigger Date occurs, and Tenant shall be responsible &#13;&#10;for the annualized portion of such Operating Expenses corresponding to the number of days &#13;&#10;during such year, commencing with the Expense Trigger Date, for which Tenant is otherwise &#13;&#10;liable for Operating Expenses pursuant to this Lease. Tenant&#8217;s responsibility for Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;Adjusted Share of Operating Expenses shall continue to the latest of (a) the date of termination &#13;&#10;of the Lease, (b) the date Tenant has fully vacated the Premises and (c) if termination of the &#13;&#10;Lease is due to a default by Tenant, the date that is the later of (i) the scheduled expiration date &#13;&#10;of this Lease (as of the date of such default) and (ii) the rental commencement of a replacement &#13;&#10;tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9.7. Operating Expenses for the calendar year in which Tenant&#8217;s obligation to share &#13;&#10;therein commences and for the calendar year in which such obligation ceases shall be prorated &#13;&#10;based on the actual number of days applicable to Tenant&#8217;s obligation during such calendar year. &#13;&#10;Expenses such as taxes, assessments and insurance premiums that are incurred for an extended &#13;&#10;time period shall be prorated based upon the time periods to which they apply so that the &#13;&#10;amounts attributed to the Premises relate in a reasonable manner to the time period wherein &#13;&#10;Tenant has an obligation to share in Operating Expenses. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9.8. Within thirty (30) days after the end of each calendar month, Tenant may submit &#13;&#10;to Landlord an invoice, or, in the event an invoice is not available, an itemized list, of all costs &#13;&#10;and expenses that (a) Tenant has incurred (either internally or by employing third parties) during &#13;&#10;the prior month and (b) for which Tenant reasonably believes it is entitled to reimbursements &#13;&#10;from Landlord pursuant to the terms of this Lease or that Tenant reasonably believes is the &#13;&#10;responsibility of Landlord pursuant to this Lease or the Work Letter. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9.9. In the event that the Project is less than fully occupied during a calendar year, &#13;&#10;Tenant acknowledges that Landlord may extrapolate Operating Expenses that vary depending on &#13;&#10;the occupancy of the Project, as applicable, to equal Landlord&#8217;s reasonable estimate of what such &#13;&#10;Operating Expenses would have been had the Project, as applicable, been ninety-five percent &#13;&#10;(95%) occupied during such calendar year; provided, however, that Landlord shall not recover &#13;&#10;more than one hundred percent (100%) of Operating Expenses. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;10. Taxes on Tenant&#8217;s Property. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;10.1. Tenant shall be solely responsible for the payment of any and all taxes levied &#13;&#10;upon (a) personal property and trade fixtures located at the Premises and (b) any gross or net &#13;&#10;receipts of or sales by Tenant, and shall pay the same prior to delinquency. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;10.2. If any such taxes on Tenant&#8217;s personal property or trade fixtures are levied against &#13;&#10;Landlord or Landlord&#8217;s property or, if the assessed valuation of the Building, the Property or the &#13;&#10;Project is increased by inclusion therein of a value attributable to Tenant&#8217;s personal property or &#13;&#10;trade fixtures, and if Landlord, after written notice to Tenant, pays the taxes based upon any such &#13;&#10;increase in the assessed value of the Building, the Property or the Project, then Tenant shall, &#13;&#10;upon demand, repay to Landlord the taxes so paid by Landlord. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	20 &#13;&#10;10.3. If any improvements in or alterations to the Premises, whether owned by &#13;&#10;Landlord or Tenant and whether or not affixed to the real property so as to become a part &#13;&#10;thereof, are assessed for real property tax purposes at a valuation higher than the valuation at &#13;&#10;which improvements conforming to Landlord&#8217;s building standards (the &#8220;Building Standard&#8221;) in &#13;&#10;other spaces in the Building are assessed, then the real property taxes and assessments levied &#13;&#10;against Landlord or the Building, the Property or the Project by reason of such excess assessed &#13;&#10;valuation shall be deemed to be taxes levied against personal property of Tenant and shall be &#13;&#10;governed by the provisions of Section 10.2. Any such excess assessed valuation due to &#13;&#10;improvements in or alterations to space in the Project leased by other tenants at the Project shall &#13;&#10;not be included in Operating Expenses. If the records of the applicable governmental assessor&#8217;s &#13;&#10;office are available and sufficiently detailed to serve as a basis for determining whether such &#13;&#10;Tenant improvements or alterations are assessed at a higher valuation than the Building &#13;&#10;Standard, then such records shall be binding on both Landlord and Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;11. Security Deposit. &#13;&#10;11.1. Tenant shall deposit with Landlord on or before the Execution Date, the sum of &#13;&#10;Three Hundred Two Thousand Nine Hundred Seventy-Nine and 20/100 Dollars ($302,979.20) &#13;&#10;toward the Security Deposit set forth in Section 2.6. Within five (5) business days after the &#13;&#10;earlier of (i) the Clinical Trial Termination Outside Date or (ii) the date Tenant waives the &#13;&#10;Clinical Trial Termination Option, Tenant will deposit the remaining Six Hundred Five &#13;&#10;Thousand Nine Hundred Fifty-Eight and 40/100 Dollars ($605,958.40) (which, together with the &#13;&#10;initial payment above, shall be collectively referred to as the &#8220;Security Deposit&#8221;). The Security &#13;&#10;Deposit shall be held by Landlord as security for the faithful performance by Tenant of all of the &#13;&#10;terms, covenants and conditions of this Lease to be kept and performed by Tenant during the &#13;&#10;period commencing on the Execution Date and ending upon the expiration or termination of &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s obligations under this Lease. If Tenant Defaults (as defined below) with respect to any &#13;&#10;provision of this Lease, including any provision relating to the payment of Rent, then Landlord &#13;&#10;may (but shall not be required to) use, apply or retain all or any part of the Security Deposit for &#13;&#10;the payment of any Rent or any other sum in default, or to compensate Landlord for any other &#13;&#10;loss or damage that Landlord may suffer by reason of Tenant&#8217;s default. If any portion of the &#13;&#10;Security Deposit is so used or applied, then Tenant shall, within ten (10) days following demand &#13;&#10;therefor, restore the Security Deposit to the amount then required hereunder, and Tenant&#8217;s failure &#13;&#10;to do so shall be a material breach of this Lease. The provisions of this Article shall survive the &#13;&#10;expiration or earlier termination of this Lease. TENANT HEREBY WAIVES THE &#13;&#10;REQUIREMENTS OF SECTION 1950.7 OF THE CALIFORNIA CIVIL CODE, AS THE &#13;&#10;SAME MAY BE AMENDED FROM TIME TO TIME. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;11.2. In the event of bankruptcy or other debtor-creditor proceedings against Tenant, &#13;&#10;the Security Deposit shall be deemed to be applied first to the payment of Rent and other charges &#13;&#10;due Landlord for all periods prior to the filing of such proceedings. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;11.3. Landlord may deliver to any purchaser of Landlord&#8217;s interest in the Premises the &#13;&#10;funds deposited hereunder by Tenant, and thereupon Landlord shall be discharged from any &#13;&#10;further liability with respect to such deposit. This provision shall also apply to any subsequent &#13;&#10;transfers. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	21 &#13;&#10;11.4. If Tenant shall fully and faithfully perform every provision of this Lease to be &#13;&#10;performed by it, then the Security Deposit, or any balance thereof, shall be returned to Tenant &#13;&#10;(or, at Landlord&#8217;s option, to the last assignee of Tenant&#8217;s interest hereunder) within thirty (30) &#13;&#10;days after the expiration or earlier termination of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;11.5. If the Security Deposit shall be in cash, Landlord shall hold the Security Deposit &#13;&#10;in an account at a banking organization selected by Landlord; provided, however, that Landlord &#13;&#10;shall not be required to maintain a separate account for the Security Deposit, but may &#13;&#10;intermingle it with other funds of Landlord. Landlord shall be entitled to all interest and/or &#13;&#10;dividends, if any, accruing on the Security Deposit. Landlord shall not be required to credit &#13;&#10;Tenant with any interest for any period during which Landlord does not receive interest on the &#13;&#10;Security Deposit. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;11.6. The Security Deposit may be in the form of cash, a letter of credit or any other &#13;&#10;security instrument acceptable to Landlord in its sole discretion. Tenant may at any time, except &#13;&#10;when Tenant is in Default (as defined below), deliver a letter of credit (the &#8220;L/C Security&#8221;) as the &#13;&#10;entire Security Deposit, as follows: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) If Tenant elects to deliver L/C Security, then Tenant shall provide &#13;&#10;Landlord, and maintain in full force and effect throughout the Term and until the date that is six &#13;&#10;(6) months after the then-current Term Expiration Date, a letter of credit in the form of Exhibit E &#13;&#10;issued by an issuer reasonably satisfactory to Landlord, in the amount of the Security Deposit, &#13;&#10;with an initial term of at least one year. Landlord may require the L/C Security to be re-issued &#13;&#10;by a different issuer at any time during the Term if Landlord reasonably believes that the issuing &#13;&#10;bank of the L/C Security is or may soon become insolvent; provided, however, Landlord shall &#13;&#10;return the existing L/C Security to the existing issuer immediately upon receipt of the substitute &#13;&#10;L/C Security. If any issuer of the L/C Security shall become insolvent or placed into FDIC &#13;&#10;receivership, then Tenant shall immediately deliver to Landlord (without the requirement of &#13;&#10;notice from Landlord) substitute L/C Security issued by an issuer reasonably satisfactory to &#13;&#10;Landlord, and otherwise conforming to the requirements set forth in this Article. As used herein &#13;&#10;with respect to the issuer of the L/C Security, &#8220;insolvent&#8221; shall mean the determination of &#13;&#10;insolvency as made by such issuer&#8217;s primary bank regulator (i.e., the state bank supervisor for &#13;&#10;state chartered banks; the OCC or OTS, respectively, for federally chartered banks or thrifts; or &#13;&#10;the Federal Reserve for its member banks). If, at the Term Expiration Date, any Rent remains &#13;&#10;uncalculated or unpaid, then (i) Landlord shall with reasonable diligence complete any necessary &#13;&#10;calculations, (ii) Tenant shall extend the expiry date of such L/C Security from time to time as &#13;&#10;Landlord reasonably requires and (iii) in such extended period, Landlord shall not unreasonably &#13;&#10;refuse to consent to an appropriate reduction of the L/C Security. Tenant shall reimburse &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s actual third-party legal costs in handling any dispute or draw request relating to &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s L/C Security, if any. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) If Tenant delivers to Landlord satisfactory L/C Security in place of the &#13;&#10;entire Security Deposit, Landlord shall remit to Tenant any cash Security Deposit Landlord &#13;&#10;previously held. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) Landlord may draw upon the L/C Security, and hold and apply the &#13;&#10;proceeds in the same manner and for the same purposes as the Security Deposit, if (i) an uncured &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;Default (as defined below) exists, (ii) as of the date that is forty-five (45) days before any L/C &#13;&#10;Security expires (even if such scheduled expiry date is after the Term Expiration Date) Tenant &#13;&#10;has not delivered to Landlord an amendment or replacement for such L/C Security, reasonably &#13;&#10;satisfactory to Landlord, extending the expiry date to the earlier of (1) six (6) months after the &#13;&#10;then-current Term Expiration Date or (2) the date that is one year after the then-current expiry &#13;&#10;date of the L/C Security, (iii) the L/C Security provides for automatic renewals, Landlord asks &#13;&#10;the issuer to confirm the current L/C Security expiry date, and the issuer fails to do so within ten &#13;&#10;(10) business days, (iv) Tenant fails to pay (when and as Landlord reasonably requires) any bank &#13;&#10;charges for Landlord&#8217;s transfer of the L/C Security or (v) the issuer of the L/C Security ceases, &#13;&#10;or announces that it will cease, to maintain an office in the city where Landlord may present &#13;&#10;drafts under the L/C Security (and fails to permit drawing upon the L/C Security by overnight &#13;&#10;courier or facsimile). This Section does not limit any other provisions of this Lease allowing &#13;&#10;Landlord to draw the L/C Security under specified circumstances. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) Tenant shall not seek to enjoin, prevent, or otherwise interfere with &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s draw under L/C Security, even if it violates this Lease. Tenant acknowledges that the &#13;&#10;only effect of a wrongful draw would be to substitute a cash Security Deposit for L/C Security, &#13;&#10;causing Tenant no legally recognizable damage. Landlord shall hold the proceeds of any draw in &#13;&#10;the same manner and for the same purposes as a cash Security Deposit. In the event of a &#13;&#10;wrongful draw, the parties shall cooperate to allow Tenant to post replacement L/C Security &#13;&#10;simultaneously with the return to Tenant of the wrongfully drawn sums, and Landlord shall upon &#13;&#10;request confirm in writing to the issuer of the L/C Security that Landlord&#8217;s draw was erroneous. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) If Landlord transfers its interest in the Premises, then Tenant shall at &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s expense, within five (5) business days after receiving a request from Landlord, deliver &#13;&#10;(and, if the issuer requires, Landlord shall consent to) an amendment to the L/C Security naming &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s grantee as substitute beneficiary. If the required Security Deposit changes while L/C &#13;&#10;Security is in force, then Tenant shall deliver (and, if the issuer requires, Landlord shall consent &#13;&#10;to) a corresponding amendment to the L/C Security. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;11.7 Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Section 11, in the &#13;&#10;event that Tenant, at the expiration of the twenty-fourth (24th) month of the initial Term, is not &#13;&#10;in Default of any of its obligations under this Lease, and has not been in Default of any of its &#13;&#10;obligations under this Lease at any time during the previous twelve (12) month period, Landlord &#13;&#10;shall reduce the amount of the Security Deposit by Three Hundred Two Thousand Nine &#13;&#10;Hundred Seventy-Nine and 20/100 Dollars ($302,979.20) and Landlord shall, at Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;option either apply such amount against Tenant&#39;s monthly Base Rent obligation for the twenty- &#13;&#10;fifth (25h) month of the initial Term or refund such amount to Tenant within thirty (30) days. &#13;&#10;Further, in the event that Tenant, at the expiration of the sixtieth (60th) month of the initial &#13;&#10;Term, is not in default of any of its obligations under this Lease, and has not been in default of &#13;&#10;any of its obligations under this Lease at any time during the previous twelve (12) month &#13;&#10;period, Landlord shall further reduce the amount of the Security Deposit by Three Hundred &#13;&#10;Two Thousand Nine Hundred Seventy-Nine and 20/100 Dollars ($302,979.20) and Landlord &#13;&#10;shall, at Tenant&#8217;s option either apply such amount against Tenant&#39;s monthly Base Rent &#13;&#10;obligation for the sixty-first (61st) month of the initial Term or refund such amount to Tenant &#13;&#10;within thirty (30) days. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;22 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10;12. Use. &#13;&#10;12.1. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Tenant shall use the Premises for the Permitted Use, and shall not use the &#13;&#10;Premises, or permit or suffer the Premises to be used, for any other purpose without Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;prior written consent, which consent Landlord may withhold in its sole and absolute discretion. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;12.2. Tenant shall not use or occupy the Premises in violation of Applicable Laws; &#13;&#10;zoning ordinances; or the certificate of occupancy (or its substantial equivalent) issued for the &#13;&#10;Building or the Project, and shall, upon ten (10) days&#8217; written notice from Landlord, discontinue &#13;&#10;any use of the Premises that is, or is declared or claimed by any Governmental Authority having &#13;&#10;jurisdiction to be a violation of any of the above. Tenant shall comply with any direction of any &#13;&#10;Governmental Authority having jurisdiction that shall, by reason of the nature of Tenant&#8217;s use or &#13;&#10;occupancy of the Premises, impose any duty upon Tenant or Landlord with respect to the &#13;&#10;Premises or with respect to the use or occupation thereof, and shall indemnify, defend (at the &#13;&#10;option of and with counsel reasonably acceptable to the indemnified party(ies)), save, reimburse &#13;&#10;and hold harmless (collectively, &#8220;Indemnify,&#8221; &#8220;Indemnity&#8221; or &#8220;Indemnification,&#8221; as the case may &#13;&#10;require) the Landlord and its affiliates, employees, agents and contractors; and any lender, &#13;&#10;mortgagee, ground lessor or beneficiary (each, a &#8220;Lender&#8221; and, collectively with Landlord and &#13;&#10;its affiliates, employees, agents and contractors, the &#8220;Landlord Indemnitees&#8221;) harmless from and &#13;&#10;against any and all demands, claims, liabilities, losses, costs, expenses, actions, causes of action, &#13;&#10;damages, suits or judgments, and all reasonable expenses (including reasonable attorneys&#8217; fees, &#13;&#10;charges and disbursements, regardless of whether the applicable demand, claim, action, cause of &#13;&#10;action or suit is voluntarily withdrawn or dismissed) incurred in investigating or resisting the &#13;&#10;same (collectively, &#8220;Claims&#8221;) of any kind or nature that arise before, during or after the Term as &#13;&#10;a result of Tenant&#8217;s breach of this Section. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;12.3. Tenant shall not do or permit to be done anything that will invalidate or increase &#13;&#10;the cost of any fire, environmental, extended coverage or any other insurance policy covering the &#13;&#10;Building or the Project, and shall comply with all rules, orders, regulations and requirements of &#13;&#10;the insurers of the Building and the Project, and Tenant shall promptly, upon demand, reimburse &#13;&#10;Landlord for any additional premium charged for such policy by reason of Tenant&#8217;s failure to &#13;&#10;comply with the provisions of this Article. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;12.4. Tenant shall keep all doors opening onto public corridors closed, except when in &#13;&#10;use for ingress and egress. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;12.5. No additional locks or bolts of any kind shall be placed upon any of the doors or &#13;&#10;windows by Tenant, nor shall any changes be made to existing locks or the mechanisms thereof &#13;&#10;(including card readers) without Landlord&#8217;s prior written consent. Tenant shall, upon &#13;&#10;termination of this Lease, return to Landlord all keys or other opening mechanisms to offices and &#13;&#10;restrooms either furnished to or otherwise procured by Tenant. In the event any key so furnished &#13;&#10;to Tenant is lost, Tenant shall pay to Landlord the cost of replacing the same or of changing the &#13;&#10;lock or locks opened by such lost key if Landlord shall deem it necessary to make such change. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;12.6. No awnings or other projections shall be attached to any outside wall of the &#13;&#10;Building. No curtains, blinds, shades or screens shall be attached to or hung in, or used in &#13;&#10;connection with, any window or door of the Premises other than Landlord&#8217;s standard window &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

The directory &#13;&#10;tablet shall be provided exclusively for the display of the name and location of tenants only. &#13;&#10;Tenant shall not place anything on the exterior of the corridor walls or corridor doors other than &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s standard lettering. Upon Tenant&#8217;s request, Landlord may install any Tenant Signage, &#13;&#10;and Tenant shall pay all costs associated with such installation within thirty (30) days after &#13;&#10;receipt of an invoice. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;12.8. 	&#13;&#10;13.2. This Lease is subject to any recorded covenants, conditions or restrictions on the &#13;&#10;Project or Property, as the same may be amended, amended and restated, supplemented or &#13;&#10;otherwise modified from time to time (the &#8220;CC&amp;Rs&#8221;). Tenant shall, at its sole cost and expense, &#13;&#10;comply with the CC&amp;Rs. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;13.3. Tenant shall have a non-exclusive, irrevocable license to use Tenant&#8217;s Pro Rata &#13;&#10;Share of parking facilities serving the Project, which shall not be less than three (3) parking &#13;&#10;spaces per 1,000 usable square feet of the Premises, in common on an unreserved basis with &#13;&#10;other tenants of the Project during the Term at no additional cost. Tenant shall have the right to &#13;&#10;designate up to twelve (12) spaces in the parking facility serving the Building at a location &#13;&#10;reasonably approved by Landlord to be marked as reserved for visitors, carpools or loading. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;13.4. Tenant agrees not to unreasonably overburden the parking facilities and agrees to &#13;&#10;cooperate with Landlord and other tenants in the use of the parking facilities. Nothing in this &#13;&#10;Section, however, is intended to create an affirmative duty on Landlord&#8217;s part to monitor &#13;&#10;parking. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;14. Project Control by Landlord. &#13;&#10;14.1. Landlord reserves full control over the Building and the Project to the extent not &#13;&#10;inconsistent with Tenant&#8217;s enjoyment of the Premises as provided by this Lease. This &#13;&#10;reservation includes Landlord&#8217;s right to subdivide the Project; convert the Building and other &#13;&#10;buildings within the Project to condominium units; change the size of the Project by selling all or &#13;&#10;a portion of the Project or adding real property and any improvements thereon to the Project; &#13;&#10;grant easements and licenses to third parties; maintain or establish ownership of the Building &#13;&#10;separate from fee title to the Property; make additions to or reconstruct portions of the Building &#13;&#10;and the Project; install, use, maintain, repair, replace and relocate for service to the Premises and &#13;&#10;other parts of the Building or the Project pipes, ducts, conduits, wires and appurtenant fixtures, &#13;&#10;wherever located in the Premises, the Building or elsewhere at the Project; and alter or relocate &#13;&#10;any other Common Area or facility, including private drives, lobbies, entrances and landscaping; &#13;&#10;provided, however, that such rights shall be exercised in a way that does not materially adversely &#13;&#10;affect Tenant&#8217;s rights or obligations under the Lease, including the Permitted Use and Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;access to the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;14.2. Landlord shall have the right to access areas of the Premises necessary for &#13;&#10;utilities, services, safety and operation of the Building. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;14.3. Tenant shall, at Landlord&#8217;s request, promptly execute such further documents as &#13;&#10;may be reasonably appropriate to assist Landlord in the performance of its obligations &#13;&#10;hereunder; provided that Tenant need not execute any document that creates additional liability &#13;&#10;for Tenant or that deprives Tenant of the quiet enjoyment and use of the Premises as provided for &#13;&#10;in this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;14.4. 	27 &#13;&#10;Tenant-designated individual at the Premises; but provided that no time restrictions shall apply &#13;&#10;or advance notice be required if an emergency necessitates immediate entry), enter the Premises &#13;&#10;to (u) inspect the same and to determine whether Tenant is in compliance with its obligations &#13;&#10;hereunder, (v) supply any service Landlord is required to provide hereunder, (w) alter, improve &#13;&#10;or repair any portion of the Building other than the Premises for which access to the Premises is &#13;&#10;reasonably necessary, (x) post notices of nonresponsibility, (y) access the telephone equipment, &#13;&#10;electrical substation and fire risers and (z) show the Premises to prospective tenants during the &#13;&#10;final year of the Term and current and prospective purchasers and lenders at any time. In &#13;&#10;connection with any such alteration, improvement or repair as described in Subsection 14.4(w), &#13;&#10;Landlord may erect in the Premises or elsewhere in the Project scaffolding and other structures &#13;&#10;reasonably required for the alteration, improvement or repair work to be performed. In no event &#13;&#10;shall Tenant&#8217;s Rent abate as a result of Landlord&#8217;s activities pursuant to this Section; provided, &#13;&#10;however, that all such activities shall be conducted in such a manner so as to cause as little &#13;&#10;interference to Tenant as is reasonably possible. Landlord shall at all times retain a key with &#13;&#10;which to unlock all of the doors in the Premises. If an emergency necessitates immediate access &#13;&#10;to the Premises, Landlord may use whatever force is necessary to enter the Premises, and any &#13;&#10;such entry to the Premises shall not constitute a forcible or unlawful entry to the Premises, a &#13;&#10;detainer of the Premises, or an eviction of Tenant from the Premises or any portion thereof. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;15. Quiet Enjoyment . Landlord covenants that Tenant, upon paying the Rent and &#13;&#10;performing its obligations contained in this Lease, may peacefully and quietly have, hold and &#13;&#10;enjoy the Premises, free from any claim by Landlord or persons claiming under Landlord, but &#13;&#10;subject to all of the terms and provisions hereof, provisions of Applicable Laws and rights of &#13;&#10;record to which this Lease is or may become subordinate. This covenant is in lieu of any other &#13;&#10;quiet enjoyment covenant, either express or implied. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16. Utilities and Services. &#13;&#10;16.1. Tenant shall pay for all water (including the cost to service, repair and replace &#13;&#10;reverse osmosis, de-ionized and other treated water), gas, heat, light, power, telephone, internet &#13;&#10;service, cable television, other telecommunications and other utilities supplied to the Premises, &#13;&#10;together with any fees, surcharges and taxes thereon. If any such utility is not separately metered &#13;&#10;to Tenant, Tenant shall pay Tenant&#8217;s Adjusted Share of all charges of such utility jointly metered &#13;&#10;with other premises as Additional Rent or, in the alternative, Landlord may, at its option, &#13;&#10;monitor the usage of such utilities by Tenant and charge Tenant with the cost of such usage, &#13;&#10;which cost shall be paid by Tenant as Additional Rent. Landlord may base its bills for utilities &#13;&#10;on reasonable estimates; provided that Landlord adjusts such billings promptly thereafter or as &#13;&#10;part of the next Landlord&#8217;s Statement to reflect the actual cost of providing utilities to the &#13;&#10;Premises. To the extent that Tenant uses more than Tenant&#8217;s Pro Rata Share of any utilities, then &#13;&#10;Tenant shall pay Landlord for Tenant&#8217;s Adjusted Share of such utilities to reflect such excess. In &#13;&#10;the event that the Project is less than fully occupied during a calendar year, Tenant acknowledges &#13;&#10;that Landlord may extrapolate utility usage that varies depending on the occupancy of the Project &#13;&#10;(as applicable) to equal Landlord&#8217;s reasonable estimate of what such utility usage would have &#13;&#10;been had the Project, as applicable, been ninety-five percent (95%) occupied during such &#13;&#10;calendar year; provided, however, that Landlord shall not recover more than one hundred percent &#13;&#10;(100%) of the cost of such utilities. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	28 &#13;&#10;16.2. Landlord shall not be liable for, nor shall any eviction of Tenant result from, the &#13;&#10;failure to furnish any utility or service, whether or not such failure is caused by accidents; &#13;&#10;breakage; casualties (to the extent not caused by the party claiming Force Majeure); Severe &#13;&#10;Weather Conditions (as defined below); physical natural disasters (but excluding weather &#13;&#10;conditions that are not Severe Weather Conditions); strikes, lockouts or other labor disturbances &#13;&#10;or labor disputes (other than labor disturbances and labor disputes resulting solely from the acts &#13;&#10;or omissions of the party claiming Force Majeure); acts of terrorism; riots or civil disturbances; &#13;&#10;wars or insurrections; shortages of materials (which shortages are not unique to the party &#13;&#10;claiming Force Majeure); government regulations, moratoria or other governmental actions, &#13;&#10;inactions or delays; failures to grant consent or delays in granting consent by any Lender whose &#13;&#10;consent is required under any applicable Loan Document; failures by third parties to deliver gas, &#13;&#10;oil or another suitable fuel supply, or inability of the party claiming Force Majeure, by exercise &#13;&#10;of reasonable diligence, to obtain gas, oil or another suitable fuel; or other causes beyond the &#13;&#10;reasonable control of the party claiming that Force Majeure has occurred (collectively, &#8220;Force &#13;&#10;Majeure&#8221;). In the event of such failure, Tenant shall not be entitled to termination of this Lease &#13;&#10;or any abatement or reduction of Rent, nor shall Tenant be relieved from the operation of any &#13;&#10;covenant or agreement of this Lease. &#8220;Severe Weather Conditions&#8221; means weather conditions &#13;&#10;that are materially worse than those that reasonably would be anticipated for the Property at the &#13;&#10;applicable time based on historic meteorological records. Notwithstanding anything to the &#13;&#10;contrary in this Lease, if, for more than ten (10) consecutive business days following written &#13;&#10;notice to Landlord and as a direct result of Landlord&#8217;s gross negligence or willful misconduct &#13;&#10;(and except to the extent that such failure is caused by any other factor, including any action or &#13;&#10;inaction of a Tenant Party (as defined below)), the provision of HVAC (as defined below) or &#13;&#10;other utilities to all or a material portion of the Premises that Landlord must provide pursuant to &#13;&#10;this Lease is interrupted (a &#8220;Material Services Failure&#8221;), then Tenant&#8217;s Base Rent and Operating &#13;&#10;Expenses (or, to the extent that less than all of the Premises are affected, a proportionate amount &#13;&#10;(based on the Rentable Area of the Premises that is rendered unusable) of Base Rent and &#13;&#10;Operating Expenses) shall thereafter be abated until the Premises are again usable by Tenant for &#13;&#10;the Permitted Use; provided, however, that, if Landlord is diligently pursuing the restoration of &#13;&#10;such HVAC and other utilities and Landlord provides substitute HVAC and other utilities &#13;&#10;reasonably suitable for Tenant&#8217;s continued use and occupancy of the Premises for the Permitted &#13;&#10;Use (e.g., supplying potable water or portable air conditioning equipment), then neither Base &#13;&#10;Rent nor Operating Expenses shall be abated. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event that &#13;&#10;Landlord fails to remedy a Material Services Failure within thirty (30) days after Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;receipt of notice of a Material Services Failure (or, if such repair or maintenance cannot &#13;&#10;reasonably be completed within such period, within the period of time reasonably required (so &#13;&#10;long as Landlord begins such repair or maintenance within such period and diligently prosecutes &#13;&#10;the same to completion)), Tenant shall have the right to remedy such Material Services Failure &#13;&#10;subject to the terms, conditions and provisions of Section 18.5 below. During any Material &#13;&#10;Services Failure, Tenant will cooperate with Landlord to arrange for the provision of any &#13;&#10;interrupted utility services on an interim basis via temporary measures until final corrective &#13;&#10;measures can be accomplished, and Tenant will permit Landlord the necessary access to the &#13;&#10;Premises to remedy such Material Service Failure. In the event of any interruption of HVAC or &#13;&#10;other utilities that Landlord must provide pursuant to this Lease, regardless of the cause, &#13;&#10;Landlord shall diligently pursue the restoration of such HVAC and other utilities. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, but subject to Article 24 (which shall &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	29 &#13;&#10;govern in the event of a casualty), the provisions of this Section shall be Tenant&#8217;s sole recourse &#13;&#10;and remedy in the event of an interruption of HVAC or other utilities to the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16.3. Tenant shall pay for, prior to delinquency of payment therefor, any utilities and &#13;&#10;services that may be furnished to the Premises during or, if Tenant occupies the Premises after &#13;&#10;the expiration or earlier termination of the Term, after the Term, beyond those utilities provided &#13;&#10;by Landlord, including telephone, internet service, cable television and other &#13;&#10;telecommunications, together with any fees, surcharges and taxes thereon. Upon Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;demand, utilities and services provided to the Premises that are separately metered shall be paid &#13;&#10;by Tenant directly to the supplier of such utilities or services. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16.4. Tenant shall not, without Landlord&#8217;s prior written consent, use any device in the &#13;&#10;Premises (including data processing machines) that will in any way (a) increase the amount of &#13;&#10;ventilation, air exchange, gas, steam, electricity or water required or consumed in the Premises &#13;&#10;based upon Tenant&#8217;s Pro Rata Share of the Project beyond the existing capacity of the Project &#13;&#10;usually furnished or supplied for the Permitted Use or (b) exceed Tenant&#8217;s Pro Rata Share of the &#13;&#10;Project&#8217;s capacity to provide such utilities or services. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16.5. If Tenant shall require utilities or services in excess of those usually furnished or &#13;&#10;supplied for tenants in similar spaces in the Building or the Project by reason of Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;equipment or extended hours of business operations, then Tenant shall first procure Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;consent for the use thereof, which consent Landlord may condition upon the availability of such &#13;&#10;excess utilities or services, and Tenant shall pay as Additional Rent an amount equal to the cost &#13;&#10;of providing such excess utilities and services. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16.6. Landlord shall provide water in Common Area for lavatory and landscaping &#13;&#10;purposes only, which water shall be from the local municipal or similar source; provided, &#13;&#10;however, that if Landlord determines that Tenant requires, uses or consumes water provided to &#13;&#10;the Common Area for any purpose other than ordinary lavatory purposes, Landlord may install a &#13;&#10;water meter (&#8220;Tenant Water Meter&#8221;) and thereby measure Tenant&#8217;s water consumption for all &#13;&#10;purposes. Tenant shall pay Landlord for the costs of any Tenant Water Meter and the &#13;&#10;installation and maintenance thereof during the Term. If Landlord installs a Tenant Water &#13;&#10;Meter, Tenant shall pay for water consumed, as shown on such meter, as and when bills are &#13;&#10;rendered. If Tenant fails to timely make such payments, Landlord may pay such charges and &#13;&#10;collect the same from Tenant. Any such costs or expenses incurred or payments made by &#13;&#10;Landlord for any of the reasons or purposes stated in this Section shall be deemed to be &#13;&#10;Additional Rent payable by Tenant and collectible by Landlord as such. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16.7. Landlord reserves the right to stop service of the elevator, plumbing, ventilation, &#13;&#10;air conditioning and utility systems, upon not less than two (2) business days&#8217; prior notice to &#13;&#10;Tenant, when Landlord deems necessary or desirable, due to accident, emergency or the need to &#13;&#10;make repairs, alterations or improvements, until such repairs, alterations or improvements shall &#13;&#10;have been completed, and Landlord shall further have no responsibility or liability for failure to &#13;&#10;supply elevator facilities, plumbing, ventilation, air conditioning or utility service when &#13;&#10;prevented from doing so by Force Majeure or, to the extent permitted by Applicable Laws, &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s negligence (except as provided in Section 16.2). Notwithstanding the foregoing, in &#13;&#10;cases of emergency or due to accident, Landlord shall not be required to provide notice to &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
