	30 &#13;&#10;Tenant. Without limiting the foregoing, it is expressly understood and agreed that any covenants &#13;&#10;on Landlord&#8217;s part to furnish any service pursuant to any of the terms, covenants, conditions, &#13;&#10;provisions or agreements of this Lease, or to perform any act or thing for the benefit of Tenant, &#13;&#10;shall not be deemed breached if Landlord is unable to furnish or perform the same by virtue of &#13;&#10;Force Majeure or, to the extent permitted by Applicable Laws, Landlord&#8217;s negligence (subject to &#13;&#10;Section 16.2). Notwithstanding the foregoing, Landlord shall use commercially reasonable &#13;&#10;efforts to schedule any maintenance and/or repair activities that are the responsibility of &#13;&#10;Landlord under this Lease during times that will minimize interference with Tenant and its &#13;&#10;business activities conducted from the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16.8. Tenant shall have the right to connect the existing back-up generator serving the &#13;&#10;Building (the &#8220;Generator&#8221;) to the Premises&#8217; emergency electrical panel. Tenant acknowledges &#13;&#10;and agrees that Landlord has made no representation or warranty (express or implied) regarding &#13;&#10;the condition of the Generator or the suitability of the Generator for Tenant&#39;s use, including any &#13;&#10;warranty of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose. The Generator shall be the sole &#13;&#10;responsibility of Tenant and Landlord shall have no obligations with respect thereto. Tenant &#13;&#10;shall, at its sole cost and expense, maintain and keep the Generator in good condition and repair, &#13;&#10;in compliance with all Applicable Laws (including, without limitation, any required permits) and &#13;&#10;shall otherwise be solely responsible for any repair, maintenance and/or replacement costs with &#13;&#10;respect to the Generator. Tenant shall keep in full force and effect during the Term (and &#13;&#10;occupancy by Tenant, if any, after termination of this Lease) a preventative maintenance contract &#13;&#10;for inspections and maintenance for the Generator (using a qualified, licensed, bonded service &#13;&#10;provider reasonably approved by Landlord) at commercially reasonable intervals that comply &#13;&#10;with industry standard practices and Applicable Laws. If requested in writing by Landlord, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall provide to Landlord copies of any Generator maintenance contracts and any &#13;&#10;Generator maintenance reports on a quarterly basis. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in &#13;&#10;this Lease, Landlord shall have no liability, and Tenant shall have no right or remedy, on account &#13;&#10;of any interruption or impairment with respect to the Generator or failure of the Generator to &#13;&#10;operate in an emergency situation. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16.9. Tenant shall (a) maintain and operate the heating, ventilating and air conditioning &#13;&#10;systems (including, without limitation, the exhaust fume hoods) exclusively serving the Premises &#13;&#10;used for the Permitted Use only (&#8220;HVAC&#8221;) and (b) furnish HVAC as reasonably required for &#13;&#10;reasonably comfortable occupancy of the Premises twenty-four (24) hours a day, every day &#13;&#10;during the Term. Tenant shall keep in full force and effect during the Term (and occupancy by &#13;&#10;Tenant, if any, after termination of this Lease) a preventative maintenance contract for &#13;&#10;inspections and maintenance using a qualified, licensed, bonded service provider reasonably &#13;&#10;approved by Landlord at commercially reasonable intervals that comply with industry standard &#13;&#10;practices and Applicable Laws. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Section, &#13;&#10;Landlord shall have no liability, and Tenant shall have no right or remedy, on account of any &#13;&#10;interruption or impairment in HVAC services. If requested in writing by Landlord, Tenant shall &#13;&#10;provide to Landlord copies of HVAC maintenance contracts and HVAC maintenance reports on &#13;&#10;a quarterly basis. In the event Landlord determines that Tenant is not properly maintaining the &#13;&#10;HVAC, Landlord may take over the responsibilities in (a) and (b) above. Any reasonable costs &#13;&#10;or expenses incurred, or payments made by Landlord as a result of Tenant failing to properly &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	31 &#13;&#10;maintain the HVAC, shall be deemed to be Additional Rent payable by Tenant and collectible by &#13;&#10;Landlord as such. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16.10. For any utilities serving the Premises for which Tenant is billed directly by such &#13;&#10;utility provider, Tenant agrees to furnish to Landlord (a) any invoices or statements for such &#13;&#10;utilities within thirty (30) days after Landlord&#8217;s request therefor, (b) within thirty (30) days after &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s request, any other utility usage information reasonably requested by Landlord, and &#13;&#10;(c) within thirty (30) days after each calendar year during the Term, authorization to allow &#13;&#10;Landlord to access Tenant&#8217;s usage information necessary for Landlord to comply with &#13;&#10;Applicable Law; and Tenant shall comply with any other energy usage or consumption &#13;&#10;requirements required by Applicable Laws. Tenant shall retain records of utility usage at the &#13;&#10;Premises, including invoices and statements from the utility provider, for at least thirty-six (36) &#13;&#10;months, or such longer period of time as may be required by Applicable Law. Tenant &#13;&#10;acknowledges that any utility information for the Premises, the Building and the Project may be &#13;&#10;shared with third parties, including Landlord&#8217;s consultants and Governmental Authorities. In the &#13;&#10;event that Tenant fails to comply with this Section, Tenant hereby authorizes Landlord to collect &#13;&#10;utility usage information directly from the applicable utility providers. In addition to the &#13;&#10;foregoing, Tenant shall comply with all Applicable Laws related to the disclosure and tracking &#13;&#10;of energy consumption at the Premises. The provisions of this Section shall survive the &#13;&#10;expiration or earlier termination of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17. Alterations. &#13;&#10;17.1. Except for Cosmetic Alterations (as defined below), Tenant shall make no &#13;&#10;alterations, additions or improvements (other than the Tenant Improvements) in or to the &#13;&#10;Premises or engage in any construction, demolition, reconstruction, renovation or other work &#13;&#10;(whether major or minor) of any kind in, at or serving the Premises (&#8220;Alterations&#8221;) without &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s prior written approval, which approval may be subject to the consent of one or more &#13;&#10;Lenders, if required under any applicable Loan Document, but which approval Landlord shall &#13;&#10;not otherwise unreasonably withhold, condition or delay; provided, however, that, in the event &#13;&#10;any proposed Alteration affects (a) any structural portions of the Building, including exterior &#13;&#10;walls, the roof, the foundation or slab, foundation or slab systems (including barriers and subslab &#13;&#10;systems) or the core of the Building, (b) the exterior of the Building or (c) any Building systems, &#13;&#10;including elevator, plumbing, HVAC, electrical, security, life safety and power, then Landlord &#13;&#10;may withhold its approval in its sole and absolute discretion. Tenant shall, in making any &#13;&#10;Alterations, use only those architects, contractors, suppliers and mechanics of which Landlord &#13;&#10;has given prior written approval, which approval shall be in Landlord&#8217;s sole and absolute &#13;&#10;discretion. In seeking Landlord&#8217;s approval, Tenant shall provide Landlord, at least sixty (60) &#13;&#10;days in advance of the desired commencement date of any proposed construction, with plans, &#13;&#10;specifications, bid proposals, certified stamped engineering drawings and calculations by &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s engineer of record or architect of record (including connections to the Building&#8217;s &#13;&#10;structural system, modifications to the Building&#8217;s envelope, non-structural penetrations in slabs &#13;&#10;or walls, and modifications or tie-ins to life safety systems), work contracts, requests for &#13;&#10;laydown areas and such other information concerning the nature and cost of the Alterations as &#13;&#10;Landlord may reasonably request, provided that Tenant shall not commence any such Alterations &#13;&#10;that require Landlord&#8217;s consent unless and until Tenant has received the written approval of &#13;&#10;Landlord and any and all Lenders whose consent is required under any applicable Loan &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	32 &#13;&#10;Document. In no event shall Tenant use or Landlord be required to approve any architects, &#13;&#10;consultants, contractors, subcontractors or material suppliers that Landlord reasonably believes &#13;&#10;could cause labor disharmony or may not have sufficient experience, in Landlord&#8217;s reasonable &#13;&#10;opinion, to perform work in an occupied Class &#8220;A&#8221; laboratory research building and in lab areas. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding the foregoing, Tenant may make strictly cosmetic changes to the Premises that &#13;&#10;do not require any permits or more than three (3) total contractors and subcontractors (&#8220;Cosmetic &#13;&#10;Alterations&#8221;) without Landlord&#8217;s consent; provided that (y) the cost of any Cosmetic Alterations &#13;&#10;does not exceed Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000) annually, (z) such Cosmetic &#13;&#10;Alterations are not reasonably expected to have any material adverse effect on the Project and do &#13;&#10;not (i) require any structural or other substantial modifications to the Premises, (ii) require any &#13;&#10;changes to or adversely affect the Building systems, (iii) affect any portion of the Building or &#13;&#10;Project that is exterior to the Premises, or (iv) trigger any requirement under Applicable Laws &#13;&#10;that would require Landlord to make any alteration or improvement to the Premises, the Building &#13;&#10;or the Project. Tenant shall not be required to give Landlord prior written notice of any &#13;&#10;Cosmetic Alterations, unless such Cosmetic Alterations will generate noise or other disruption &#13;&#10;outside of the Building. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.2. Tenant shall not construct or permit to be constructed partitions or other &#13;&#10;obstructions that might interfere with free access to mechanical installation or service facilities &#13;&#10;of the Building or with other tenants&#8217; components located within the Building (in the event &#13;&#10;Tenant does not lease the entire Building), or interfere with the moving of Landlord&#8217;s equipment &#13;&#10;to or from the enclosures containing such installations or facilities. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.3. Tenant shall accomplish any work performed on the Premises or the Building in &#13;&#10;such a manner as to permit any life safety systems to remain fully operable at all times. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.4. Any work performed on the Premises, the Building or the Project by Tenant or &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s contractors which could generate noise or other disruption outside of the Building shall &#13;&#10;be done at such times and in such manner as Landlord may from time to time designate. Tenant &#13;&#10;covenants and agrees that all work done by Tenant or Tenant&#8217;s contractors shall be performed in &#13;&#10;full compliance with Applicable Laws. Within thirty (30) days after completion of any &#13;&#10;Alterations, Tenant shall provide Landlord with complete &#8220;as built&#8221; drawing print sets and &#13;&#10;electronic CADD files on disc (or files in such other current format in common use as Landlord &#13;&#10;reasonably approves or requires) showing any changes in the Premises, as well as a &#13;&#10;commissioning report prepared by a licensed, qualified commissioning agent hired by Tenant &#13;&#10;and approved by Landlord for all new or affected mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems. &#13;&#10;Any such &#8220;as built&#8221; plans shall show the applicable Alterations as an overlay on the Building as- &#13;&#10;built plans; provided that Landlord provides the Building &#8220;as built&#8221; plans to Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.5. Before commencing any Alterations or Tenant Improvements (other than &#13;&#10;Cosmetic Alterations), Tenant shall (a) give Landlord at least sixty (60) days&#8217; prior written &#13;&#10;notice of the proposed commencement of such work and the names and addresses of the persons &#13;&#10;supply labor or materials therefor so that Landlord may enter the Premises to post and keep &#13;&#10;posted thereon and therein notices or to take any further action that Landlord may reasonably &#13;&#10;deem proper for the protection of Landlord&#8217;s interest in the Project and (b) shall, if required by &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

The &#13;&#10;provisions of this Section shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.7. For the avoidance of doubt, the items listed on &#13;&#10;Exhibit H attached hereto (which Exhibit H may be updated by Tenant from and after the Term &#13;&#10;Commencement Date, subject to Landlord&#8217;s written consent) constitute Tenant&#8217;s property and &#13;&#10;shall be removed by Tenant upon the expiration or earlier termination of the Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.8. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Article to the contrary, in no event &#13;&#10;shall Tenant remove any improvement from the Premises in which any Lender has a security &#13;&#10;interest or as to which Landlord contributed payment, including the Tenant Improvements, &#13;&#10;without Landlord&#8217;s prior written consent, which consent Landlord may withhold in its sole and &#13;&#10;absolute discretion. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.9. If Tenant shall fail to remove any of its property from the Premises prior to the &#13;&#10;expiration or earlier termination of this Lease, then Landlord may, at its option, remove the same &#13;&#10;in any manner that Landlord shall choose and store such effects without liability to Tenant for &#13;&#10;loss thereof or damage thereto, and Tenant shall pay Landlord, upon demand, any costs and &#13;&#10;expenses incurred due to such removal and storage or Landlord may, at its sole option and &#13;&#10;without notice to Tenant, sell such property or any portion thereof at private sale and without &#13;&#10;legal process for such price as Landlord may obtain and apply the proceeds of such sale against &#13;&#10;any (a) amounts due by Tenant to Landlord under this Lease and (b) any expenses incident to the &#13;&#10;removal, storage and sale of such personal property. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.10. Tenant shall pay to Landlord an amount equal to two percent (2%) of the cost to &#13;&#10;Tenant of all Alterations (excluding Cosmetic Alterations) to cover Landlord&#8217;s overhead and &#13;&#10;expenses for plan review, engineering review, coordination, scheduling and supervision thereof &#13;&#10;or obtaining any required Lender consent. For purposes of payment of such sum, Tenant shall &#13;&#10;submit to Landlord copies of all bills, invoices and statements covering the costs of such &#13;&#10;charges, accompanied by payment to Landlord of the fee set forth in this Section. Tenant shall &#13;&#10;reimburse Landlord for any extra expenses incurred by Landlord by reason of faulty work done &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10;by Tenant or its contractors, or by reason of delays caused by such work, or by reason of &#13;&#10;inadequate clean-up. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.11. Within sixty (60) days after final completion of the Tenant Improvements or any &#13;&#10;Alterations performed by Tenant with respect to the Premises, Tenant shall submit to Landlord &#13;&#10;documentation showing the amounts expended by Tenant with respect to such Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements and Alterations, together with supporting documentation reasonably acceptable to &#13;&#10;Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.12. Tenant shall take, and shall cause its contractors to take, commercially reasonable &#13;&#10;steps to protect the Premises during the performance of any Alterations or Tenant Improvements, &#13;&#10;including covering or temporarily removing any window coverings so as to guard against dust, &#13;&#10;debris or damage. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17.13. Tenant shall require its contractors and subcontractors performing work on the &#13;&#10;Premises to name Landlord and its affiliates and Lenders as additional insureds on their &#13;&#10;respective insurance policies. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18. Repairs and Maintenance. &#13;&#10;18.1. Landlord&#8217;s Repair and Maintenance. Landlord shall repair and maintain in good &#13;&#10;condition the structural and exterior portions of the Building and the Common Area of the &#13;&#10;Project, including roofing and covering materials; foundations (excluding any architectural slabs, &#13;&#10;but including any structural slabs); and exterior walls. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18.2. Tenant&#8217;s Repair and Maintenance. Except for services of Landlord, if any, &#13;&#10;required by Section 18.1, Tenant shall at Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense maintain and keep the &#13;&#10;Premises and every part thereof (including, without limitation, all Building systems) in good &#13;&#10;condition and repair, damage thereto from ordinary wear and tear excepted, and shall, within ten &#13;&#10;(10) business days after receipt of written notice from Landlord, provide to Landlord any &#13;&#10;maintenance records that Landlord reasonably requests. Without limiting the generality of the &#13;&#10;foregoing, Tenant shall, at Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense, (a) maintain the HVAC in accordance &#13;&#10;with all of the terms, conditions, provisions and agreements set forth in Section 16.9 above, and &#13;&#10;(b) hire (i) a licensed elevator contractor to regularly and periodically (at commercially &#13;&#10;reasonable intervals that comply with industry standard practices and Applicable Laws) inspect &#13;&#10;and perform required maintenance on the elevator(s) serving the Premises, (ii) a licensed fire &#13;&#10;alarm contractor to regularly and periodically (at commercially reasonable intervals that comply &#13;&#10;with industry standard practices and Applicable Laws) inspect and perform required &#13;&#10;maintenance on the fire alarm equipment and systems serving the Premises, (iii) a licensed &#13;&#10;sprinkler inspection contractor to regularly and periodically (at commercially reasonable &#13;&#10;intervals that comply with industry standard practices and Applicable Laws) inspect and perform &#13;&#10;required maintenance on the sprinkler equipment and systems serving the Premises, (iv) a &#13;&#10;backflow inspection contractor to regularly and periodically (at commercially reasonable &#13;&#10;intervals that comply with industry standard practices and Applicable Laws) inspect and perform &#13;&#10;required maintenance on the backflow equipment and systems serving the Premises, (v) a &#13;&#10;licensed BMS contractor to regularly and periodically (at commercially reasonable intervals that &#13;&#10;comply with industry standard practices and Applicable Laws) inspect and perform required &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;34 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;maintenance on the BMS equipment and systems serving the Premises, (vi) a licensed chemical &#13;&#10;water treatment contractor to regularly and periodically (at commercially reasonable intervals &#13;&#10;that comply with industry standard practices and Applicable Laws) inspect and perform required &#13;&#10;maintenance on the chemical water treatment equipment and systems serving the Premises, (vii) &#13;&#10;a licensed pure water treatment contractor to regularly and periodically (at commercially &#13;&#10;reasonable intervals that comply with industry standard practices and Applicable Laws) inspect &#13;&#10;and perform required maintenance on the pure water treatment equipment and systems serving &#13;&#10;the Premises, (viii) an air compressor and vacuum pump contractor to regularly and periodically &#13;&#10;(at commercially reasonable intervals that comply with industry standard practices and &#13;&#10;Applicable Laws) inspect and perform required maintenance on the air compressor and vacuum &#13;&#10;pump equipment and systems serving the Premises, and (ix) a licensed electrical maintenance &#13;&#10;contractor to regularly and periodically (at commercially reasonable intervals that comply with &#13;&#10;industry standard practices and Applicable Laws) inspect and perform required maintenance on &#13;&#10;the electrical equipment and systems serving the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18.3. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, if Tenant shall fail, after twenty (20) &#13;&#10;days&#8217; written notice, to (a) hire the contractors (or cause such contractors to perform the &#13;&#10;inspections and maintenance) required under Section 18.2 above or (b) perform any maintenance &#13;&#10;or to make, or to commence and thereafter to proceed with diligence to make, any repair required &#13;&#10;of it with respect to the Premises pursuant to the terms of the Lease, Landlord, without being &#13;&#10;under any obligation to do so and without thereby waiving such default by Tenant, may hire such &#13;&#10;contractors, perform such maintenance or make such repair and may charge Tenant for the &#13;&#10;reasonable costs thereof. Any expense reasonably incurred by Landlord in connection therewith &#13;&#10;may be billed by Landlord to Tenant monthly or, at Landlord&#8217;s option, immediately, and shall be &#13;&#10;due and payable within thirty (30) days after such billing or, at Landlord&#8217;s option, may be &#13;&#10;deducted from the Security Deposit. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18.4. Tenant shall, upon the expiration or sooner termination of the Term, surrender the &#13;&#10;Premises to Landlord in as good a condition as when received, ordinary wear and tear excepted &#13;&#10;and with the Tenant Improvements in substantially the same condition as existed on the Term &#13;&#10;Commencement Date, ordinary wear and tear excepted; and shall, at Landlord&#8217;s request and &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense, remove all telephone and data systems, wiring and equipment &#13;&#10;from the Premises, and repair any damage to the Premises caused thereby. Landlord shall have &#13;&#10;no obligation to alter, remodel, improve, repair, decorate or paint the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18.5. Landlord shall not be liable for any failure to make any repairs or to perform any &#13;&#10;maintenance that is Landlord&#8217;s obligation pursuant to this Lease unless such failure shall persist &#13;&#10;for an unreasonable time after Tenant provides Landlord with written notice of the need of such &#13;&#10;repairs or maintenance. Tenant waives its rights under Applicable Laws now or hereafter in &#13;&#10;effect to make repairs at Landlord&#8217;s expense. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event that &#13;&#10;Landlord timely fails to make a repair or perform maintenance that is Landlord&#39;s obligation &#13;&#10;pursuant to this Lease, Tenant may notify Landlord of such failure and, if Landlord does not &#13;&#10;make the repair or perform the maintenance within thirty (30) days after Landlord&#39;s receipt of &#13;&#10;such notice (or, if such repair or maintenance cannot reasonably be completed within such &#13;&#10;period, within the period of time reasonably required (so long as Landlord begins the repair or &#13;&#10;maintenance within such period and diligently prosecutes the same to completion)), Tenant may &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;35 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;perform the repair or maintenance and Landlord shall reimburse Tenant for its reasonable out-of- &#13;&#10;pocket costs for performing the same within thirty (30) days after receipt of an invoice from &#13;&#10;Tenant therefor. Notwithstanding anything in this Section to the contrary, before performing any &#13;&#10;such repairs or maintenance, Tenant shall notify Landlord of Tenant&#39;s intent to do so and shall &#13;&#10;reasonably coordinate with Landlord and any other tenants of the Project that may be affected &#13;&#10;the need for such repairs or maintenance. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18.6. If any excavation shall be made upon land adjacent to or under the Building, or &#13;&#10;shall be authorized to be made, Tenant shall afford to the person causing or authorized to cause &#13;&#10;such excavation, license to enter the Premises for the purpose of performing such work as such &#13;&#10;person shall reasonably deem necessary or desirable to preserve and protect the Building from &#13;&#10;injury or damage and to support the same by proper foundations, without any claim for damages &#13;&#10;or liability against Landlord and without reducing or otherwise affecting Tenant&#8217;s obligations &#13;&#10;under this Lease. In connection with the foregoing, Landlord shall work with Tenant to the &#13;&#10;extent commercially reasonable to ensure Tenant&#8217;s quiet enjoyment of the Premises are not &#13;&#10;disrupted during work hours. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18.7. This Article relates to repairs and maintenance arising in the ordinary course of &#13;&#10;operation of the Building and the Project. In the event of a casualty described in Article 24, &#13;&#10;Article 24 shall apply in lieu of this Article. In the event of eminent domain, Article 25 shall &#13;&#10;apply in lieu of this Article. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18.8. Costs incurred by Landlord pursuant to this Article shall constitute Operating &#13;&#10;Expenses to the extent that such costs may properly be included in Operating Expenses under &#13;&#10;Article 9 of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;19. Liens. &#13;&#10;19.1. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Subject to the immediately succeeding sentence, Tenant shall keep the Premises, &#13;&#10;the Building and the Project free from any liens arising out of work or services performed, &#13;&#10;materials furnished to or obligations incurred by Tenant. Tenant further covenants and agrees &#13;&#10;that any mechanic&#8217;s or materialman&#8217;s lien filed against the Premises, the Building or the Project &#13;&#10;for work or services claimed to have been done for, or materials claimed to have been furnished &#13;&#10;to, or obligations incurred by Tenant shall be discharged or bonded by Tenant within twenty (20) &#13;&#10;days after the filing thereof, at Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;19.2. Should Tenant fail to discharge or bond against any lien of the nature described in &#13;&#10;Section 19.1, Landlord may, at Landlord&#8217;s election, pay such claim or post a statutory lien bond &#13;&#10;or otherwise provide security to eliminate the lien as a claim against title, and Tenant shall &#13;&#10;immediately reimburse Landlord for the costs thereof as Additional Rent. Tenant shall &#13;&#10;Indemnify the Landlord Indemnitees from and against any Claims arising from any such liens, &#13;&#10;including any administrative, court or other legal proceedings related to such liens. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;19.3. In the event that Tenant leases or finances the acquisition of office equipment, &#13;&#10;furnishings or other personal property of a removable nature utilized by Tenant in the operation &#13;&#10;of Tenant&#8217;s business, Tenant warrants that any Uniform Commercial Code financing statement &#13;&#10;shall, upon its face or by exhibit thereto, indicate that such financing statement is applicable only &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;36 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10;to removable personal property of Tenant located within the Premises. In no event shall the &#13;&#10;address of the Premises, the Building or the Project be furnished on a financing statement &#13;&#10;without qualifying language as to applicability of the lien only to removable personal property &#13;&#10;located in an identified suite leased by Tenant. Should any holder of a financing statement &#13;&#10;record or place of record a financing statement that appears to constitute a lien against any &#13;&#10;interest of Landlord or against equipment that may be located other than within an identified &#13;&#10;suite leased by Tenant, Tenant shall, within ten (10) days after filing such financing statement, &#13;&#10;cause (a) a copy of the lender security agreement or other documents to which the financing &#13;&#10;statement pertains to be furnished to Landlord to facilitate Landlord&#8217;s ability to demonstrate that &#13;&#10;the lien of such financing statement is not applicable to Landlord&#8217;s interest and (b) Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;lender to amend such financing statement and any other documents of record to clarify that any &#13;&#10;liens imposed thereby are not applicable to any interest of Landlord in the Premises, the Building &#13;&#10;or the Project. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;20. Estoppel Certificate. Tenant shall, within ten (10) business days after receipt of written &#13;&#10;notice from Landlord, execute, acknowledge and deliver a statement in writing substantially in &#13;&#10;the form attached to this Lease as Exhibit I, or on any other form reasonably requested by a &#13;&#10;current or proposed Lender or encumbrancer or proposed purchaser, (a) certifying that this Lease &#13;&#10;is unmodified and in full force and effect (or, if modified, stating the nature of such modification &#13;&#10;and certifying that this Lease as so modified is in full force and effect) and the dates to which &#13;&#10;rental and other charges are paid in advance, if any, (b) acknowledging that there are not, to &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s knowledge, any uncured defaults on the part of Landlord hereunder, or specifying such &#13;&#10;defaults if any are claimed, and (c) setting forth such further information with respect to this &#13;&#10;Lease or the Premises as may be requested thereon. Any such statements may be relied upon by &#13;&#10;any prospective purchaser or encumbrancer of all or any portion of the Property. Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;failure to deliver any such statement within the prescribed time shall, at Landlord&#8217;s option, &#13;&#10;constitute a Default (as defined below) under this Lease (after an additional written notice sent in &#13;&#10;accordance with Section 39 with a copy of such notice e-mailed to the e-mail address set forth in &#13;&#10;Section 2.10, and the expiration of an additional five (5) day cure period), and, in any event, &#13;&#10;shall be binding upon Tenant that the Lease is in full force and effect and without modification &#13;&#10;except as may be represented by Landlord in any certificate prepared by Landlord and delivered &#13;&#10;to Tenant for execution. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21. Hazardous Materials. &#13;&#10;21.1. Tenant shall not cause or permit any Hazardous Materials (as defined below) to &#13;&#10;be brought upon, kept or used in or about the Premises, the Building or the Project in violation of &#13;&#10;Applicable Laws by Tenant or any of its employees, agents, contractors or invitees (collectively &#13;&#10;with Tenant, each a &#8220;Tenant Party&#8221;). If (a) Tenant breaches such obligation, (b) the presence of &#13;&#10;Hazardous Materials as a result of such a breach results in contamination of the Project, any &#13;&#10;portion thereof, or any adjacent property, (c) contamination of the Premises otherwise occurs &#13;&#10;during the Term or any extension or renewal hereof or holding over hereunder (other than if such &#13;&#10;contamination results from (i) migration of Hazardous Materials from outside the Premises not &#13;&#10;caused by a Tenant Party or (ii) to the extent such contamination is caused by Landlord&#39;s gross &#13;&#10;negligence or willful misconduct) or (d) contamination of the Project occurs as a result of &#13;&#10;Hazardous Materials that are placed on or under or are released into the Project by a Tenant &#13;&#10;Party, then Tenant shall Indemnify the Landlord Indemnitees from and against any and all &#13;&#10;37 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>

	&nbsp;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;Claims of any kind or nature, including (w) diminution in value of the Project or any portion &#13;&#10;thereof, (x) damages for the loss or restriction on use of rentable or usable space or of any &#13;&#10;amenity of the Project, (y) damages arising from any adverse impact on marketing of space in &#13;&#10;the Project or any portion thereof and (z) sums paid in settlement of Claims that arise before, &#13;&#10;during or after the Term as a result of such breach or contamination. This Indemnification by &#13;&#10;Tenant includes costs incurred in connection with any investigation of site conditions or any &#13;&#10;clean-up, remedial, removal or restoration work required by any Governmental Authority &#13;&#10;because of Hazardous Materials present in the air, soil or groundwater above, on, under or about &#13;&#10;the Project. Without limiting the foregoing, if the presence of any Hazardous Materials in, on, &#13;&#10;under or about the Project, any portion thereof or any adjacent property caused or permitted by &#13;&#10;any Tenant Party results in any contamination of the Project, any portion thereof or any adjacent &#13;&#10;property, then Tenant shall promptly take all actions at its sole cost and expense as are necessary &#13;&#10;to return the Project, any portion thereof or any adjacent property to its respective condition &#13;&#10;existing prior to the time of such contamination; provided that Landlord&#8217;s written approval of &#13;&#10;such action shall first be obtained, which approval Landlord shall not unreasonably withhold; &#13;&#10;and provided, further, that it shall be reasonable for Landlord to withhold its consent if such &#13;&#10;actions could have a material adverse long-term or short-term effect on the Project, any portion &#13;&#10;thereof or any adjacent property. Tenant&#8217;s obligations under this Section shall not be affected, &#13;&#10;reduced or limited by any limitation on the amount or type of damages, compensation or benefits &#13;&#10;payable by or for Tenant under workers&#8217; compensation acts, disability benefit acts, employee &#13;&#10;benefit acts or similar legislation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Landlord shall (a) indemnify, &#13;&#10;save, defend (at Tenant&#8217;s option and with counsel reasonably acceptable to Tenant) and hold the &#13;&#10;Tenant Parties harmless from and against any and all Claims resulting from the presence of &#13;&#10;Hazardous Materials at the Project in violation of Applicable Laws as of the Execution Date, &#13;&#10;unless placed at the Project by a Tenant Party, and (b) reimburse Tenant for any out-of-pocket &#13;&#10;costs incurred by Tenant (and approved in advance by Landlord) to remediate Hazardous &#13;&#10;Materials at the Project in violation of Applicable Laws as of the Execution Date, unless such &#13;&#10;Hazardous Materials were placed at the Project by a Tenant Party. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21.2. Landlord acknowledges that it is not the intent of this Article to prohibit Tenant &#13;&#10;from operating its business for the Permitted Use. Tenant may operate its business according to &#13;&#10;the custom of Tenant&#8217;s industry so long as the use or presence of Hazardous Materials is strictly &#13;&#10;and properly monitored in accordance with Applicable Laws. As a material inducement to &#13;&#10;Landlord to allow Tenant to use Hazardous Materials in connection with its business, Tenant &#13;&#10;agrees to deliver to Landlord (and any Lender of Landlord) (a) a list identifying each type of &#13;&#10;Hazardous Material to be present at the Premises that is subject to regulation under any &#13;&#10;environmental Applicable Laws in the form of a Tier II form pursuant to Section 312 of the &#13;&#10;Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act of 1986 (or any successor statute) or &#13;&#10;any other form reasonably requested by Landlord, (b) a list of any and all approvals or permits &#13;&#10;from Governmental Authorities required in connection with the presence of such Hazardous &#13;&#10;Material at the Premises and (c) correct and complete copies of (i) notices of violations of &#13;&#10;Applicable Laws related to Hazardous Materials and (ii) plans relating to the installation of any &#13;&#10;storage tanks to be installed in, on, under or about the Project (provided that installation of &#13;&#10;storage tanks shall only be permitted after Landlord has given Tenant its written consent to do &#13;&#10;so, which consent Landlord may withhold in its sole and absolute discretion) and closure plans &#13;&#10;or any other documents required by any and all Governmental Authorities for any storage tanks &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;38 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;installed in, on, under or about the Project for the closure of any such storage tanks (collectively, &#13;&#10;&#8220;Hazardous Materials Documents&#8221;). Tenant shall deliver to Landlord (and any Lender of &#13;&#10;Landlord) updated Hazardous Materials Documents, within fourteen (14) days after receipt of a &#13;&#10;written request therefor from Landlord, not more often than once per year, unless (m) there are &#13;&#10;any changes to the Hazardous Materials Documents or (n) Tenant initiates any Alterations or &#13;&#10;changes its business, in either case in a way that involves any material increase in the types or &#13;&#10;amounts of Hazardous Materials, in which case Tenant shall deliver updated Hazardous &#13;&#10;Materials documents (without Landlord having to request them) before or, if not practicable to &#13;&#10;do so before, as soon as reasonably practicable after the occurrence of the events in Subsection &#13;&#10;21.2(m) or (n). For each type of Hazardous Material listed, the Hazardous Materials Documents &#13;&#10;shall include (t) the chemical name, (u) the material state (e.g., solid, liquid, gas or cryogen), (v) &#13;&#10;the concentration, (w) the storage amount and storage condition (e.g., in cabinets or not in &#13;&#10;cabinets), (x) the use amount and use condition (e.g., open use or closed use), (y) the location &#13;&#10;(e.g., room number or other identification) and (z) if known, the chemical abstract service &#13;&#10;number. Notwithstanding anything in this Section to the contrary, Tenant shall not be required &#13;&#10;to provide Landlord with any documents containing information of a proprietary nature, unless &#13;&#10;such documents contain a reference to Hazardous Materials or activities related to Hazardous &#13;&#10;Materials. Landlord may, at Landlord&#8217;s expense, cause the Hazardous Materials Documents to &#13;&#10;be reviewed by a person or firm qualified to analyze Hazardous Materials to confirm compliance &#13;&#10;with the provisions of this Lease and with Applicable Laws. In the event that a review of the &#13;&#10;Hazardous Materials Documents indicates non-compliance with this Lease or Applicable Laws, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall, at its expense, diligently take steps to bring its storage and use of Hazardous &#13;&#10;Materials into compliance. Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary or Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;review into Tenant&#8217;s Hazardous Materials Documents or use or disposal of hazardous materials, &#13;&#10;however, Landlord shall not have and expressly disclaims any liability related to Tenant&#8217;s or &#13;&#10;other tenants&#8217; use or disposal of Hazardous Materials, it being acknowledged by Tenant that &#13;&#10;Tenant is best suited to evaluate the safety and efficacy of its Hazardous Materials usage and &#13;&#10;procedures. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21.3. Tenant represents and warrants to Landlord that as of the date of this Lease, &#13;&#10;Tenant is not nor has it been, in connection with the use, disposal or storage of Hazardous &#13;&#10;Materials, (a) subject to a material enforcement order issued by any Governmental Authority or &#13;&#10;(b) required to take any remedial action. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21.4. At any time, and from time to time, prior to the expiration of the Term, Landlord &#13;&#10;shall have the right to conduct appropriate tests of the Project or any portion thereof to &#13;&#10;demonstrate that Hazardous Materials are present or that contamination has occurred due to the &#13;&#10;acts or omissions of a Tenant Party. Tenant shall pay all reasonable documented costs of such &#13;&#10;tests if such tests reveal that Hazardous Materials exist at the Project in violation of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21.5. If underground or other storage tanks storing Hazardous Materials installed or &#13;&#10;utilized by Tenant are located on the Premises, or are hereafter placed on the Premises by Tenant &#13;&#10;(or by any other party, if such storage tanks are utilized by Tenant), then Tenant shall monitor &#13;&#10;the storage tanks, maintain appropriate records, implement reporting procedures, properly close &#13;&#10;any underground storage tanks, and take or cause to be taken all other steps required under the &#13;&#10;Applicable Laws. Tenant shall have no responsibility or liability for underground or other &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;39 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage102"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- SLIDE 0043 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN043.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 43" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;storage tanks installed by anyone other than Tenant unless Tenant utilizes such tanks, in which &#13;&#10;case Tenant&#8217;s responsibility for such tanks shall be as set forth in this Section. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21.6. Tenant shall promptly report to Landlord any actual or suspected presence of &#13;&#10;mold or water intrusion at the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21.7. Tenant&#8217;s obligations under this Article shall survive the expiration or earlier &#13;&#10;termination of the Lease. During any period of time needed by Tenant or Landlord after the &#13;&#10;termination of this Lease to complete the removal from the Premises of any such Hazardous &#13;&#10;Materials, Tenant shall be deemed a holdover tenant and subject to the provisions of Article 27. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21.8. As used herein, the term &#8220;Hazardous Material&#8221; means any toxic, explosive, &#13;&#10;corrosive, flammable, infectious, radioactive, carcinogenic, mutagenic or otherwise hazardous &#13;&#10;substance, material or waste that is or becomes regulated by Applicable Laws or any &#13;&#10;Governmental Authority. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21.9. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Lease, Landlord shall have sole &#13;&#10;control over the equitable allocation of fire control areas (as defined in the Uniform Building &#13;&#10;Code as adopted by the city or municipality(ies) in which the Project is located (the &#8220;UBC&#8221;)) &#13;&#10;within the Project for the storage of Hazardous Materials. Notwithstanding anything to the &#13;&#10;contrary in this Lease, the quantity of Hazardous Materials allowed by this Section is specific to &#13;&#10;Tenant and shall not run with the Lease in the event of a Transfer (as defined in Article 29). In &#13;&#10;the event of a Transfer, if the use of Hazardous Materials by such new tenant (&#8220;New Tenant&#8221;) is &#13;&#10;such that New Tenant utilizes fire control areas in the Project in excess of New Tenant&#8217;s Pro &#13;&#10;Rata Share of the Project, then New Tenant shall, at its sole cost and expense and upon &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s written request, establish and maintain a separate area of the Premises classified by &#13;&#10;the UBC as an &#8220;H&#8221; occupancy area for the use and storage of Hazardous Materials, or take such &#13;&#10;other action as is necessary to ensure that its share of the fire control areas of Project is not &#13;&#10;greater than New Tenant&#8217;s Pro Rata Share of the Project. Notwithstanding anything in this &#13;&#10;Lease to the contrary, Landlord shall not have and expressly disclaims any liability related to &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s or other tenants&#8217; use or disposal of fire control areas, it being acknowledged by Tenant &#13;&#10;that Tenant and other tenants are best suited to evaluate the safety and efficacy of its Hazardous &#13;&#10;Materials usage and procedures. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;22. Odors and Exhaust. Tenant acknowledges that Landlord would not enter into this Lease &#13;&#10;with Tenant unless Tenant assured Landlord that under no circumstances will any other &#13;&#10;occupants of the Building or the Project (including persons legally present in any outdoor areas &#13;&#10;of the Project) be subjected to odors or fumes (whether or not noxious), and that the Building &#13;&#10;and the Project will not be damaged by any exhaust, in each case from Tenant&#8217;s operations. &#13;&#10;Landlord and Tenant therefore agree as follows: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;22.1. Tenant shall not cause or permit (or conduct any activities that would cause) any &#13;&#10;release of any odors or fumes of any kind from the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;22.2. If the Building has a ventilation system that, in Landlord&#8217;s judgment, is adequate, &#13;&#10;suitable, and appropriate to vent the Premises in a manner that does not release odors affecting &#13;&#10;any indoor or outdoor part of the Project, Tenant shall vent the Premises through such system. If &#13;&#10;40 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage103"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0044 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN044.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 44" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;Landlord at any time reasonably determines that any existing ventilation system is inadequate, or &#13;&#10;if no ventilation system exists, Tenant shall in compliance with Applicable Laws vent all fumes &#13;&#10;and odors from the Premises (and remove odors from Tenant&#8217;s exhaust stream) as Landlord &#13;&#10;reasonably requires. The placement and configuration of all ventilation exhaust pipes, louvers &#13;&#10;and other equipment shall be subject to Landlord&#8217;s reasonable approval. Tenant acknowledges &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s legitimate desire to maintain the Project (indoor and outdoor areas) in an odor-free &#13;&#10;manner, and Landlord may require Tenant to abate and remove all odors in a manner that goes &#13;&#10;beyond the requirements of Applicable Laws. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;22.3. Tenant shall, at Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense, provide odor eliminators and &#13;&#10;other devices (such as filters, air cleaners, scrubbers and whatever other equipment may in &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s reasonable judgment be necessary or appropriate from time to time) to completely &#13;&#10;remove, eliminate and abate any odors, fumes or other substances in Tenant&#8217;s exhaust stream &#13;&#10;that, in Landlord&#8217;s reasonable judgment, emanate from Tenant&#8217;s Premises. Any work Tenant &#13;&#10;performs under this Section shall constitute Alterations. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;22.4. Tenant&#8217;s responsibility to remove, eliminate and abate odors, fumes and exhaust &#13;&#10;shall continue throughout the Term. Landlord&#8217;s approval of the Tenant Improvements shall not &#13;&#10;preclude Landlord from requiring additional measures to eliminate odors, fumes and other &#13;&#10;adverse impacts of Tenant&#8217;s exhaust stream (as Landlord may designate in Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;reasonable discretion). Tenant shall install additional equipment as Landlord reasonably &#13;&#10;requires from time to time under the preceding sentence. Such installations shall constitute &#13;&#10;Alterations. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;22.5. If Tenant fails to install satisfactory odor control equipment within ten (10) &#13;&#10;business days after Landlord&#8217;s demand made at any time, then Landlord may, without limiting &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s other rights and remedies, require Tenant to cease and suspend any operations in the &#13;&#10;Premises that, in Landlord&#8217;s reasonable determination, cause odors, fumes or exhaust. For &#13;&#10;example, if Landlord determines that Tenant&#8217;s production of a certain type of product causes &#13;&#10;odors, fumes or exhaust, and Tenant does not install satisfactory odor control equipment within &#13;&#10;ten (10) business days after Landlord&#8217;s request, then Landlord may require Tenant to stop &#13;&#10;producing such type of product in the Premises unless and until Tenant has installed odor control &#13;&#10;equipment satisfactory to Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23. Insurance; Waiver of Subrogation. &#13;&#10;23.1. Landlord shall maintain insurance for the Building and the Project in amounts &#13;&#10;equal to full replacement cost (exclusive of the costs of excavation, foundations and footings, &#13;&#10;engineering costs or such other costs to the extent the same are not incurred in the event of a &#13;&#10;rebuild and without reference to depreciation taken by Landlord upon its books or tax returns), &#13;&#10;provided that such coverage shall not be less than the amount of such insurance Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;Lender, if any, requires Landlord to maintain, providing protection against any peril generally &#13;&#10;included within the classification &#8220;Fire and Extended Coverage,&#8221; together with insurance against &#13;&#10;sprinkler damage (if applicable), vandalism and malicious mischief. Landlord, subject to &#13;&#10;availability thereof, shall further insure, if Landlord deems it appropriate, coverage against flood, &#13;&#10;environmental hazard, earthquake, loss or failure of building equipment, rental loss during the &#13;&#10;period of repairs or rebuilding, Workers&#8217; Compensation insurance and fidelity bonds for &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;41 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage104"></A>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;employees employed to perform services. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Landlord may, but &#13;&#10;shall not be deemed required to, provide insurance for any improvements installed by Tenant or &#13;&#10;that are in addition to the standard improvements customarily furnished by Landlord, without &#13;&#10;regard to whether or not such are made a part of or are affixed to the Building. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23.2. In addition, Landlord shall carry Commercial General Liability insurance with &#13;&#10;limits of not less than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence/general aggregate for &#13;&#10;bodily injury (including death), or property damage with respect to the Project. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23.3. Tenant shall, at its own cost and expense, procure and maintain during the Term &#13;&#10;the following insurance for the benefit of Tenant and Landlord (as their interests may appear) &#13;&#10;with insurers financially acceptable and lawfully authorized to do business in the state where the &#13;&#10;Premises are located: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Commercial General Liability insurance on a broad-based occurrence &#13;&#10;coverage form, with coverages including but not limited to bodily injury (including death), &#13;&#10;property damage (including loss of use resulting therefrom), premises/operations, personal &amp; &#13;&#10;advertising injury, and contractual liability with limits of liability of not less than $2,000,000 for &#13;&#10;bodily injury and property damage per occurrence, $2,000,000 general aggregate, which limits &#13;&#10;may be met by use of excess and/or umbrella liability insurance provided that such coverage is at &#13;&#10;least as broad as the primary coverages required herein. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Commercial Automobile Liability insurance covering liability arising from &#13;&#10;the use or operation of any auto, including those owned, hired or otherwise operated or used by or &#13;&#10;on behalf of the Tenant. The coverage shall be on a broad-based occurrence form with combined &#13;&#10;single limits of not less than $1,000,000 per accident for bodily injury and property damage. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) Commercial Property insurance covering property damage to the full &#13;&#10;replacement cost value and business interruption. Covered property shall include all tenant &#13;&#10;improvements in the Premises (to the extent not insured by Landlord pursuant to Section 23.1) &#13;&#10;and Tenant&#8217;s Property including personal property, furniture, fixtures, machinery, equipment, &#13;&#10;stock, inventory and improvements and betterments, which may be owned by Tenant or &#13;&#10;Landlord and required to be insured hereunder, or which may be leased, rented, borrowed or in &#13;&#10;the care custody or control of Tenant, or Tenant&#8217;s agents, employees or subcontractors. Such &#13;&#10;insurance, with respect only to all Tenant Improvements, Alterations or other work performed on &#13;&#10;the Premises by Tenant (collectively, &#8220;Tenant Work&#8221;), shall name Landlord and Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;current and future mortgagees as loss payees as their interests may appear. Such insurance shall &#13;&#10;be written on an &#8220;all risk&#8221; of physical loss or damage basis including the perils of fire, extended &#13;&#10;coverage, electrical injury, mechanical breakdown, windstorm, vandalism, malicious mischief, &#13;&#10;sprinkler leakage, back-up of sewers or drains, flood, earthquake, terrorism and such other risks &#13;&#10;Landlord may from time to time designate, for the full replacement cost value of the covered &#13;&#10;items with an agreed amount endorsement with no co-insurance. Business interruption coverage &#13;&#10;shall have limits sufficient to cover Tenant&#8217;s lost profits and necessary continuing expenses, &#13;&#10;including rents due Landlord under the Lease. The minimum period of indemnity for business &#13;&#10;interruption coverage shall be twelve (12) months plus twelve (12) months&#8217; extended period of &#13;&#10;indemnity. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;42 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;(d) Workers&#8217; Compensation insurance as is required by statute or law, or as &#13;&#10;may be available on a voluntary basis and Employers&#8217; Liability insurance with limits of not less &#13;&#10;than the following: each accident, Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000); disease (each &#13;&#10;employee), Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) Medical malpractice insurance at limits of not less than $1,000,000 each &#13;&#10;claim during such periods, if any, that Tenant engages in the practice of medicine at the &#13;&#10;Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(f) Pollution Legal Liability insurance is required if Tenant stores, handles, &#13;&#10;generates or treats Hazardous Materials, as determined solely by Landlord, on or about the &#13;&#10;Premises. Such coverage shall include bodily injury, sickness, disease, death or mental anguish &#13;&#10;or shock sustained by any person; property damage including physical injury to or destruction of &#13;&#10;tangible property including the resulting loss of use thereof, clean-up costs, and the loss of use of &#13;&#10;tangible property that has not been physically injured or destroyed; and defense costs, charges &#13;&#10;and expenses incurred in the investigation, adjustment or defense of claims for such &#13;&#10;compensatory damages. Coverage shall apply to both sudden and non-sudden pollution &#13;&#10;conditions including the discharge, dispersal, release or escape of smoke, vapors, soot, fumes, &#13;&#10;acids, alkalis, toxic chemicals, liquids or gases, waste materials or other irritants, contaminants &#13;&#10;or pollutants into or upon land, the atmosphere or any watercourse or body of water. Claims- &#13;&#10;made coverage is permitted, provided the policy retroactive date is continuously maintained &#13;&#10;prior to the commencement date of this agreement, and coverage is continuously maintained &#13;&#10;during all periods in which Tenant occupies the Premises. Coverage shall be maintained with &#13;&#10;limits of not less than $1,000,000 per incident with a $2,000,000 policy aggregate and for a &#13;&#10;period of two (2) years thereafter. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(g) During all construction by Tenant at the Premises, with respect to tenant &#13;&#10;improvements being constructed (including the Tenant Improvements and any Alterations), &#13;&#10;insurance required in Exhibit B-1 must be in place. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23.4. The insurance required of Tenant by this Article shall be with companies at all &#13;&#10;times having a current rating of not less than A- and financial category rating of at least Class &#13;&#10;VII in &#8220;A.M. Best&#8217;s Insurance Guide&#8221; current edition. Tenant shall obtain for Landlord from the &#13;&#10;insurance companies/broker or cause the insurance companies/broker to furnish certificates of &#13;&#10;insurance evidencing all coverages required herein to Landlord. Landlord reserves the right to &#13;&#10;require complete, certified copies of all required insurance policies including any endorsements. &#13;&#10;No such policy shall be cancelable or subject to reduction of coverage or other modification or &#13;&#10;cancellation except after twenty (20) days&#8217; prior written notice to Landlord from Tenant or its &#13;&#10;insurers (except in the event of non-payment of premium, in which case ten (10) days&#8217; written &#13;&#10;notice shall be given). Tenant may modify, reduce or change insurance companies/brokers &#13;&#10;without prior written notice to Landlord so long as such changes do not cause Tenant to have a &#13;&#10;lapse in coverage or fail to satisfy Tenant&#8217;s obligations under this Section 23. All such policies &#13;&#10;shall be written as primary policies, not contributing with and not in excess of the coverage that &#13;&#10;Landlord may carry. Tenant&#8217;s required policies shall contain severability of interests clauses &#13;&#10;stating that, except with respect to limits of insurance, coverage shall apply separately to each &#13;&#10;insured or additional insured. Tenant shall, at least five (5) days prior to the expiration of such &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;43 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10;policies, furnish Landlord with renewal certificates of insurance or binders. Tenant agrees that if &#13;&#10;Tenant does not take out and maintain such insurance, Landlord may (but shall not be required &#13;&#10;to) procure such insurance on Tenant&#8217;s behalf and at its cost to be paid by Tenant as Additional &#13;&#10;Rent. Commercial General Liability, Commercial Automobile Liability, Umbrella Liability and &#13;&#10;Pollution Legal Liability insurance as required above shall name Landlord, BioMed Realty, L.P., &#13;&#10;and BRE Edison Parent L.P., and their respective officers, employees, agents, general partners, &#13;&#10;members, subsidiaries, affiliates and Lenders (&#8220;Landlord Parties&#8221;) as additional insureds as &#13;&#10;respects liability arising from work or operations performed by or on behalf of Tenant, Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;use or occupancy of Premises, and ownership, maintenance or use of vehicles by or on behalf of &#13;&#10;Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23.5. In each instance where insurance is to name Landlord Parties as additional &#13;&#10;insureds, Tenant shall, upon Landlord&#8217;s written request, also designate and furnish certificates &#13;&#10;evidencing such Landlord Parties as additional insureds to (a) any Lender of Landlord holding a &#13;&#10;security interest in the Building or the Project, (b) the landlord under any lease whereunder &#13;&#10;Landlord is a tenant of the real property upon which the Building is located if the interest of &#13;&#10;Landlord is or shall become that of a tenant under a ground lease rather than that of a fee owner &#13;&#10;and (c) any management company retained by Landlord to manage the Project. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23.6. Tenant assumes the risk of damage to any fixtures, goods, inventory, &#13;&#10;merchandise, equipment and leasehold improvements, and Landlord shall not be liable for injury &#13;&#10;to Tenant&#8217;s business or any loss of income therefrom, relative to such damage, all as more &#13;&#10;particularly set forth within this Lease. Tenant shall, at Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense, carry &#13;&#10;such insurance as Tenant desires for Tenant&#8217;s protection with respect to personal property of &#13;&#10;Tenant or business interruption. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23.7. Landlord, Tenant and each of their respective insurers hereby waive any and all &#13;&#10;rights of recovery or subrogation against one another or against the officers, employees, agents, &#13;&#10;general partners, members, subsidiaries and affiliates of the other (or against any Lenders of &#13;&#10;Landlord) as respects any loss, damage, claims, suits or demands, howsoever caused, that are &#13;&#10;covered, or should have been covered, by valid and collectible insurance, including any &#13;&#10;deductibles or self-insurance maintained thereunder. If necessary, each party agrees to endorse &#13;&#10;the required insurance policies to permit waivers of subrogation as required hereunder and hold &#13;&#10;harmless and indemnify the other party for any loss or expense incurred as a result of a failure to &#13;&#10;obtain such waivers of subrogation from insurers. Such waivers shall continue so long as their &#13;&#10;respective insurers so permit. Any termination of such a waiver shall be by written notice to the &#13;&#10;other party, containing a description of the circumstances hereinafter set forth in this &#13;&#10;Section 23.7. Landlord and Tenant, upon obtaining the policies of insurance required or &#13;&#10;permitted under this Lease, shall give notice to the insurance carrier or carriers that the foregoing &#13;&#10;mutual waiver of subrogation is contained in this Lease. If such policies shall not be obtainable &#13;&#10;with such waiver or shall be so obtainable only at a premium over that chargeable without such &#13;&#10;waiver, then the party seeking such policy shall notify the other of such conditions, and the party &#13;&#10;so notified shall have ten (10) days thereafter to either (a) procure such insurance with &#13;&#10;companies reasonably satisfactory to the other party or (b) agree to pay such additional premium &#13;&#10;(in Tenant&#39;s case, in the proportion that the area of the Premises bears to the insured area). If the &#13;&#10;parties do not accomplish either (a) or (b), then this Section 23.7 shall have no effect during such &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;44 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

If the release of either Landlord or Tenant, as set forth in the first sentence of &#13;&#10;this Section 23.7, shall contravene Applicable Laws, then the liability of the party in question &#13;&#10;shall be deemed not released but shall be secondary to the other party&#39;s insurer. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23.8. Landlord may require insurance policy limits required under this Lease to be &#13;&#10;raised to conform with requirements of Landlord&#8217;s Lender or to bring coverage limits to levels &#13;&#10;then being required of new tenants within the Project. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23.9. Any costs incurred by Landlord pursuant to this Article shall constitute a portion &#13;&#10;of Operating Expenses to the extent that such costs may properly be included in Operating &#13;&#10;Expenses under Article 9. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;23.10. &#13;&#10;this Lease. &#13;&#10;The provisions of this Article shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24. Damage or Destruction. &#13;&#10;24.1. In the event of a partial destruction of (a) the Premises, (b) the Building, (c) the &#13;&#10;Common Area or (d) the Project ((a)-(d) collectively, the &#8220;Affected Areas&#8221;) by fire or other &#13;&#10;perils covered by extended coverage insurance not exceeding twenty-five percent (25%) of the &#13;&#10;full insurable value thereof, and provided that (w) the damage thereto is such that the Affected &#13;&#10;Areas may be repaired, reconstructed or restored within a period of six (6) months from the date &#13;&#10;of the happening of such casualty, (x) Landlord shall receive insurance proceeds from its insurer &#13;&#10;or Lender sufficient to cover the cost of such repairs, reconstruction and restoration (except for &#13;&#10;any deductible amount provided by Landlord&#8217;s policy, which deductible amount, if paid by &#13;&#10;Landlord, shall constitute an Operating Expense) (y) the repair, reconstruction or restoration of &#13;&#10;the Affected Areas is permitted by all applicable Loan Documents or otherwise consented to by &#13;&#10;any and all Lenders whose consent is required thereunder, and (z) such casualty was not &#13;&#10;intentionally caused by a Tenant Party, then Landlord shall commence and proceed diligently &#13;&#10;with the work of repair, reconstruction and restoration of the Affected Areas and this Lease shall &#13;&#10;continue in full force and effect. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24.2. In the event of any damage to or destruction of the Building or the Project other &#13;&#10;than as described in Section 24.1, Landlord may elect to repair, reconstruct and restore the &#13;&#10;Building or the Project, as applicable, in which case this Lease shall continue in full force and &#13;&#10;effect. If Landlord elects not to repair, reconstruct and restore the Building or the Project, as &#13;&#10;applicable, then this Lease shall terminate as of the date of such damage or destruction. In the &#13;&#10;event of any damage or destruction (regardless of whether such damage is governed by &#13;&#10;Section 24.1 or this Section), if (a) in Landlord&#39;s determination as set forth in the Damage Repair &#13;&#10;Estimate (as defined below), the Affected Areas cannot be repaired, reconstructed or restored &#13;&#10;within twelve (12) months after the date of the Damage Repair Estimate, (b) subject to &#13;&#10;Section 24.6, the Affected Areas are not actually repaired, reconstructed and restored by the later &#13;&#10;of (i) twelve (12) months after the date of the Damage Repair Estimate or (ii) ninety (90) days &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	46 &#13;&#10;after the date set forth in the Damage Repair Estimate for such repairs, reconstruction or &#13;&#10;restoration to be complete, or (c) the damage and destruction occurs within the last twelve (12) &#13;&#10;months of the then-current Term, then Tenant shall have the right to terminate this Lease, &#13;&#10;effective as of the date of such damage or destruction, by delivering to Landlord its written &#13;&#10;notice of termination (a &quot;Termination Notice&quot;) (y) with respect to Subsections 24.2(a) and (c), no &#13;&#10;later than fifteen (15) days after Landlord delivers to Tenant Landlord&#39;s Damage Repair Estimate &#13;&#10;and (z) with respect to Subsection 24.2(b), no later than fifteen (15) days after the later of the &#13;&#10;dates set forth therein (as the same may be extended pursuant to Section 24.6) expires. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24.3. As soon as reasonably practicable, but in any event within sixty (60) days &#13;&#10;following the date of damage or destruction, Landlord shall notify Tenant of Landlord&#39;s good &#13;&#10;faith estimate of the period of time in which the repairs, reconstruction and restoration will be &#13;&#10;completed (the &quot;Damage Repair Estimate&quot;), which estimate shall be based upon the opinion of a &#13;&#10;contractor reasonably selected by Landlord and experienced in comparable repair, reconstruction &#13;&#10;and restoration of similar buildings. Additionally, Landlord shall give written notice to Tenant &#13;&#10;within ninety (90) days following the date of damage or destruction of its election not to repair, &#13;&#10;reconstruct or restore the Building or the Project, as applicable. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24.4. Upon any termination of this Lease under any of the provisions of this Article, the &#13;&#10;parties shall be released thereby without further obligation to the other from the date possession &#13;&#10;of the Premises is surrendered to Landlord, except with regard to (a) items occurring prior to the &#13;&#10;damage or destruction and (b) provisions of this Lease that, by their express terms, survive the &#13;&#10;expiration or earlier termination hereof. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24.5. In the event of repair, reconstruction and restoration as provided in this Article, &#13;&#10;all Rent to be paid by Tenant under this Lease shall be abated proportionately based on the &#13;&#10;extent to which Tenant&#8217;s use of the Premises is impaired commencing as of the date of damage &#13;&#10;and continuing during the period of such repair, reconstruction or restoration, unless Landlord &#13;&#10;provides Tenant with other space during the period of repair, reconstruction and restoration that, &#13;&#10;in Tenant&#8217;s sole opinion, is suitable for the temporary conduct of Tenant&#8217;s business; provided, &#13;&#10;however, that the amount of such abatement shall be reduced by the amount of Rent that is &#13;&#10;received by Tenant as part of the business interruption or loss of rental income with respect to &#13;&#10;the Premises from the proceeds of business interruption or loss of rental income insurance. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24.6. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Article (a) Landlord &#13;&#10;shall not be required to repair, reconstruct or restore any damage or destruction to the extent that &#13;&#10;Landlord is prohibited from doing so by any applicable Loan Document or any Lender whose &#13;&#10;consent is required thereunder withholds its consent, and (b) should Landlord be delayed or &#13;&#10;prevented from completing the repair, reconstruction or restoration of the damage or destruction &#13;&#10;to the Premises after the occurrence of such damage or destruction by Force Majeure or delays &#13;&#10;caused by a Lender or Tenant Party, then the time for Landlord to commence or complete &#13;&#10;repairs, reconstruction and restoration shall be extended on a day-for-day basis; provided, &#13;&#10;however, that, at Landlord&#8217;s election, if such delays total more than ninety (90) days in the &#13;&#10;aggregate, Landlord shall be relieved of its obligation to make such repairs, reconstruction and &#13;&#10;restoration. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<!-- SLIDE 0050 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN050.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 50" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	47 &#13;&#10;24.7. If Landlord is obligated to or elects to repair, reconstruct or restore as herein &#13;&#10;provided, then Landlord shall be obligated to make such repairs, reconstruction or restoration &#13;&#10;only with regard to (a) those portions of the Premises that were originally provided at Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;expense and (b) the Common Area portion of the Affected Areas. The repairs, reconstruction or &#13;&#10;restoration of improvements not originally provided by Landlord or at Landlord&#8217;s expense shall &#13;&#10;be the obligation of Tenant. In the event Tenant has elected to upgrade certain improvements &#13;&#10;from the Building Standard, Landlord shall, upon the need for replacement due to an insured &#13;&#10;loss, provide only the Building Standard, unless Tenant again elects to upgrade such &#13;&#10;improvements and pay any incremental costs related thereto, except to the extent that excess &#13;&#10;insurance proceeds, if received, are adequate to provide such upgrades, in addition to providing &#13;&#10;for basic repairs, reconstruction and restoration of the Premises, the Building and the Project. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24.8. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Article, Landlord shall &#13;&#10;not have any obligation whatsoever to repair, reconstruct or restore the Premises if the damage &#13;&#10;resulting from any casualty covered under this Article occurs during the last twenty-four (24) &#13;&#10;months of the Term or any extension thereof, or to the extent that insurance proceeds are not &#13;&#10;available therefor; provided that in the event Tenant has an unexercised option to extend the &#13;&#10;Term of this Lease, Tenant may elect to exercise such option early, in which case the remaining &#13;&#10;Term will be calculated based on the Term as extended for purposes of this Section. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24.9. Landlord&#8217;s obligation, should it elect or be obligated to repair, reconstruct or &#13;&#10;restore, shall be limited to the Affected Areas, and shall be conditioned upon Landlord receiving &#13;&#10;any permits or authorizations required by Applicable Laws, and in such event Landlord will use &#13;&#10;commercially reasonable efforts to obtain such permits or authorizations. Tenant shall, at its &#13;&#10;expense, replace or fully repair all of Tenant&#8217;s personal property and any Alterations installed by &#13;&#10;Tenant existing at the time of such damage or destruction. If Affected Areas are to be repaired, &#13;&#10;reconstructed or restored in accordance with the foregoing, Landlord shall make available to &#13;&#10;Tenant any portion of insurance proceeds it receives that are allocable to the Alterations &#13;&#10;constructed by Tenant pursuant to this Lease; provided Tenant is not then in Default under this &#13;&#10;Lease, and subject to the requirements of any Lender of Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;24.10. This Article sets forth the terms and conditions upon which this Lease may &#13;&#10;terminate in the event of any damage or destruction. Accordingly, the parties hereby waive the &#13;&#10;provisions of California Civil Code Sections 1932(2) and 1933(4) (and any successor statutes) &#13;&#10;permitting the parties to terminate this Lease as a result of any damage or destruction. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;25. Eminent Domain. &#13;&#10;25.1. In the event (a) the whole of all Affected Areas or (b) such part thereof as shall &#13;&#10;substantially interfere with Tenant&#8217;s use and occupancy of the Premises for the Permitted Use &#13;&#10;shall be taken for any public or quasi-public purpose by any lawful power or authority by &#13;&#10;exercise of the right of appropriation, condemnation or eminent domain, or sold to prevent such &#13;&#10;taking, Tenant or Landlord may terminate this Lease effective as of the date possession is &#13;&#10;required to be surrendered to such authority, except with regard to (y) items occurring prior to &#13;&#10;the taking and (z) provisions of this Lease that, by their express terms, survive the expiration or &#13;&#10;earlier termination hereof. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
