<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	48 &#13;&#10;25.2. In the event of a partial taking of (a) the Building or the Project or (b) drives, &#13;&#10;walkways or parking areas serving the Building or the Project for any public or quasi-public &#13;&#10;purpose by any lawful power or authority by exercise of right of appropriation, condemnation, or &#13;&#10;eminent domain, or sold to prevent such taking, then, without regard to whether any portion of &#13;&#10;the Premises occupied by Tenant was so taken, Landlord may elect to terminate this Lease &#13;&#10;(except with regard to (y) items occurring prior to the taking and (z) provisions of this Lease &#13;&#10;that, by their express terms, survive the expiration or earlier termination hereof) as of such taking &#13;&#10;if such taking is, in Landlord&#8217;s sole opinion, of a material nature such as to make it &#13;&#10;uneconomical to continue use of the unappropriated portion for purposes of renting office or &#13;&#10;laboratory space. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;25.3. To the extent permitted under all applicable Loan Documents or otherwise &#13;&#10;consented to by any and all Lenders whose consent is required thereunder, Tenant shall be &#13;&#10;entitled to any award that is specifically awarded as compensation for (a) the taking of Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;personal property that was installed at Tenant&#8217;s expense, (b) the costs of Tenant moving to a new &#13;&#10;location and (c) loss of Tenant&#8217;s goodwill. Except as set forth in the previous sentence, any &#13;&#10;award for such taking shall be the property of Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;25.4. If, upon any taking of the nature described in this Article, this Lease continues in &#13;&#10;effect, then Landlord shall promptly proceed to restore the Affected Areas to substantially their &#13;&#10;same condition prior to such partial taking. To the extent such restoration is infeasible, as &#13;&#10;determined by Landlord in its sole and absolute discretion, the Rent shall be decreased &#13;&#10;proportionately to reflect the loss of any portion of the Premises no longer available to Tenant. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Article, Landlord shall not be &#13;&#10;required to restore the Affected Areas to the extent that Landlord is prohibited from doing so by &#13;&#10;any applicable Loan Document or any Lender whose consent is required thereunder withholds its &#13;&#10;consent. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;25.5. This Article sets forth the terms and conditions upon which this Lease may &#13;&#10;terminate in the event of any damage or destruction. Accordingly, the parties hereby waive the &#13;&#10;provisions of California Code of Civil Procedure Section 1265.130 (and any successor statutes) &#13;&#10;permitting the parties to terminate this Lease as a result of any damage or destruction. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;26. Surrender. &#13;&#10;26.1. At least fifteen (15) days prior to Tenant&#8217;s surrender of possession of any part of &#13;&#10;the Premises, Tenant shall provide Landlord with a facility decommissioning and Hazardous &#13;&#10;Materials closure plan for the Premises (&#8220;Exit Survey&#8221;) prepared by an independent third party &#13;&#10;state-certified professional with appropriate expertise, which Exit Survey must be reasonably &#13;&#10;acceptable to Landlord. The Exit Survey shall comply with the American National Standards &#13;&#10;Institute&#8217;s Laboratory Decommissioning guidelines (ANSI/AIHA Z9.11-2008) or any successor &#13;&#10;standards published by ANSI or any successor organization (or, if ANSI and its successors no &#13;&#10;longer exist, a similar entity publishing similar standards). In addition, at least ten (10) days &#13;&#10;prior to Tenant&#8217;s surrender of possession of any part of the Premises, Tenant shall (a) provide &#13;&#10;Landlord with (i) written evidence showing Tenant&#8217;s application for all appropriate &#13;&#10;governmental releases and written evidence showing Tenant has passed the required inspections &#13;&#10;necessary for such governmental releases in accordance with Applicable Laws, including laws &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage111"></A>

	&nbsp;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	49 &#13;&#10;pertaining to the surrender of the Premises, if any, and (ii) in the event that Tenant used or stored &#13;&#10;radioactive materials in the Premises, all governmental releases required by Applicable Laws in &#13;&#10;connection with such use or storage (e.g., proof of radioactive materials license closure), (b) &#13;&#10;place Laboratory Equipment Decontamination Forms on all decommissioned equipment to &#13;&#10;assure safe occupancy by future users and (c) conduct a site inspection with Landlord. In &#13;&#10;addition, Tenant agrees to remain responsible after the surrender of the Premises for the &#13;&#10;remediation of any recognized environmental conditions set forth in the Exit Survey and comply &#13;&#10;with any recommendations set forth in the Exit Survey. Tenant&#8217;s obligations under this Section &#13;&#10;shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of the Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;26.2. No surrender of possession of any part of the Premises shall release Tenant from &#13;&#10;any of its obligations hereunder, unless such surrender is accepted in writing by Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;26.3. The voluntary or other surrender of this Lease by Tenant shall not effect a merger &#13;&#10;with Landlord&#8217;s fee title or leasehold interest in the Premises, the Building, the Property or the &#13;&#10;Project, unless Landlord consents in writing, and shall, at Landlord&#8217;s option, operate as an &#13;&#10;assignment to Landlord of any or all subleases. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;26.4. The voluntary or other surrender of any ground or other underlying lease that now &#13;&#10;exists or may hereafter be executed affecting the Building or the Project, or a mutual cancellation &#13;&#10;thereof or of Landlord&#8217;s interest therein by Landlord and its lessor shall not effect a merger with &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s fee title or leasehold interest in the Premises, the Building or the Property and shall, &#13;&#10;at the option of the successor to Landlord&#8217;s interest in the Building or the Project, as applicable, &#13;&#10;operate as an assignment of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;27. Holding Over. &#13;&#10;27.1. If, with Landlord&#8217;s prior written consent, Tenant holds possession of all or any &#13;&#10;part of the Premises after the Term, Tenant shall become a tenant from month to month after the &#13;&#10;expiration or earlier termination of the Term, and in such case Tenant shall continue to pay (a) &#13;&#10;Base Rent in accordance with Article 7, as adjusted in accordance with Article 8, and (b) any &#13;&#10;amounts for which Tenant would otherwise be liable under this Lease if the Lease were still in &#13;&#10;effect, including payments for Tenant&#8217;s Adjusted Share of Operating Expenses. Any such &#13;&#10;month-to-month tenancy shall be subject to every other term, covenant and agreement contained &#13;&#10;herein. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;27.2. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if Tenant remains in possession of the Premises &#13;&#10;after the expiration or earlier termination of the Term without Landlord&#8217;s prior written consent, &#13;&#10;(a) Tenant shall become a tenant at sufferance subject to the terms and conditions of this Lease, &#13;&#10;except that the monthly rent shall be equal to (i) one hundred twenty-five percent (125%) of the &#13;&#10;Rent in effect during the last thirty (30) days of the Term for the first three (3) months of such &#13;&#10;holdover, and (ii) one hundred fifty percent (150%) thereafter, and (b) Tenant shall be liable to &#13;&#10;Landlord for any and all damages suffered by Landlord as a result of such holdover, including &#13;&#10;any lost rent or consequential, special and indirect damages (in each case, regardless of whether &#13;&#10;such damages are foreseeable). &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	50 &#13;&#10;27.3. Acceptance by Landlord of Rent after the expiration or earlier termination of the &#13;&#10;Term shall not result in an extension, renewal or reinstatement of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;27.4. The foregoing provisions of this Article are in addition to and do not affect &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s right of reentry or any other rights of Landlord hereunder or as otherwise provided by &#13;&#10;Applicable Laws. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;27.5. &#13;&#10;this Lease. &#13;&#10;The provisions of this Article shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;28. Indemnification and Exculpation. &#13;&#10;28.1. Except to the extent caused by Landlord&#8217;s negligence or willful misconduct, &#13;&#10;Tenant agrees to Indemnify the Landlord Indemnitees from and against any and all Claims of &#13;&#10;any kind or nature, real or alleged, arising from (a) injury to or death of any person or damage to &#13;&#10;any property occurring within or about the Premises, the Building, the Property or the Project, &#13;&#10;arising directly or indirectly out of (i) the presence at or use or occupancy of the Premises or &#13;&#10;Project by a Tenant Party, (ii) an act or omission on the part of any Tenant Party, (b) a breach or &#13;&#10;default by Tenant in the performance of any of its obligations hereunder (including any Claim &#13;&#10;asserted by any Lender against any Landlord Indemnitees under any Loan Document as a direct &#13;&#10;result of such breach or default by Tenant) or (c) injury to or death of persons or damage to or &#13;&#10;loss of any property, real or alleged, arising from the serving of alcoholic beverages at the &#13;&#10;Premises or Project, including liability under any dram shop law, host liquor law or similar &#13;&#10;Applicable Law. Tenant&#8217;s obligations under this Section shall not be affected, reduced or &#13;&#10;limited by any limitation on the amount or type of damages, compensation or benefits payable by &#13;&#10;or for Tenant under workers&#8217; compensation acts, disability benefit acts, employee benefit acts or &#13;&#10;similar legislation. Subject to Sections 23.6, 23.7, 28.2 and 31.12 and any subrogation provisions &#13;&#10;contained in the Work Letter, Landlord agrees to Indemnify the Tenant Parties from and against &#13;&#10;any and all Claims arising from injury to or death of any person or damage to or loss of any &#13;&#10;physical property occurring within or about the Premises, the Building, the Property or the &#13;&#10;Project to the extent directly arising out of Landlord&#8217;s gross negligence or willful misconduct. &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s and Tenant&#8217;s obligations under this Section shall survive the expiration or earlier &#13;&#10;termination of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;28.2. Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, Landlord shall not be &#13;&#10;liable to Tenant for and Tenant assumes all risk of (a) damage or losses caused by fire, electrical &#13;&#10;malfunction, gas explosion or water damage of any type (including broken water lines, &#13;&#10;malfunctioning fire sprinkler systems, roof leaks or stoppages of lines), unless any such loss is &#13;&#10;due to Landlord&#8217;s willful disregard of written notice by Tenant of need for a repair that Landlord &#13;&#10;is responsible to make for an unreasonable period of time, and (b) damage to personal property &#13;&#10;or scientific research, including loss of records kept by Tenant within the Premises (in each case, &#13;&#10;regardless of whether such damages are foreseeable). Tenant further waives any claim for injury &#13;&#10;to Tenant&#8217;s business or loss of income relating to any such damage or destruction of personal &#13;&#10;property as described in this Section. Notwithstanding anything in the foregoing or this Lease to &#13;&#10;the contrary, except (x) as otherwise provided herein (including Section 27.2) or (y) in the event &#13;&#10;of Tenant&#8217;s breach of Article 21 or Section 26.1, in no event shall Landlord or Tenant be liable &#13;&#10;to the other for any consequential, special or indirect damages arising out of this Lease, &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10;including lost profits (provided that this Subsection 28.2(z) shall not limit Tenant&#8217;s liability for &#13;&#10;Base Rent or Additional Rent pursuant to this Lease). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;28.3. Landlord shall not be liable for any damages arising from any act, omission or &#13;&#10;neglect of any other tenant in the Building or the Project, or of any other third party. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;28.4. Tenant acknowledges that security devices and services, if any, while intended to &#13;&#10;deter crime, may not in given instances prevent theft or other criminal acts. Landlord shall not &#13;&#10;be liable for injuries or losses caused by criminal acts of third parties, and Tenant assumes the &#13;&#10;risk that any security device or service may malfunction or otherwise be circumvented by a &#13;&#10;criminal. If Tenant desires protection against such criminal acts, then Tenant shall, at Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;sole cost and expense, obtain appropriate insurance coverage. Tenant&#8217;s security programs and &#13;&#10;equipment for the Premises shall be coordinated with Landlord and subject to Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;reasonable approval. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;28.5. &#13;&#10;this Lease. &#13;&#10;The provisions of this Article shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;29. Assignment or Subletting. &#13;&#10;29.1. Except as hereinafter expressly permitted, none of the following (each, a &#13;&#10;&#8220;Transfer&#8221;), either voluntarily or by operation of Applicable Laws, shall be directly or indirectly &#13;&#10;performed without Landlord&#8217;s prior written consent: (a) Tenant selling, hypothecating, &#13;&#10;assigning, pledging, encumbering or otherwise transferring this Lease or subletting the Premises &#13;&#10;or (b) a controlling interest in Tenant being sold, assigned or otherwise transferred (other than as &#13;&#10;a result of shares in Tenant being sold on a public stock exchange). For purposes of the &#13;&#10;preceding sentence, &#8220;control&#8221; means (a) owning (directly or indirectly) more than fifty percent &#13;&#10;(50%) of the stock or other equity interests of another person or (b) possessing, directly or &#13;&#10;indirectly, the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of such &#13;&#10;person. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Tenant shall have the right to Transfer, without &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s prior written consent, Tenant&#8217;s interest in this Lease or the Premises or any part &#13;&#10;thereof to any person or entity (i) that as of the date of determination and at all times thereafter &#13;&#10;directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, is controlled by or is under &#13;&#10;common control with Tenant, (ii) into which Tenant is merged or consolidated or (iii) that &#13;&#10;acquires all or substantially all of the assets, stock, or other equity interest of Tenant &#13;&#10;(collectively, a &#8220;Tenant&#8217;s Affiliate&#8221;); provided that Tenant shall notify Landlord in writing at &#13;&#10;least fifteen (15) business days prior to the effectiveness of such Transfer to Tenant&#8217;s Affiliate &#13;&#10;(an &#8220;Exempt Transfer&#8221;) and otherwise comply with the requirements of this Lease regarding &#13;&#10;such Transfer; and provided, further, that the person that will be the tenant under this Lease after &#13;&#10;the Exempt Transfer has a net worth (as of both the day immediately prior to and the day &#13;&#10;immediately after the Exempt Transfer) that is equal to or greater than the net worth (as of both &#13;&#10;the Execution Date and the date of the Exempt Transfer) of the transferring Tenant. For &#13;&#10;purposes of the immediately preceding sentence, &#8220;control&#8221; requires both (a) owning (directly or &#13;&#10;indirectly) more than fifty percent (50%) of the stock or other equity interests of another person &#13;&#10;and (b) possessing, directly or indirectly, the power to direct or cause the direction of the &#13;&#10;management and policies of such person. In no event shall Tenant perform a Transfer to or with &#13;&#10;an entity that is a tenant at the Project or that is in discussions or negotiations with Landlord to &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;51 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10;lease premises at the Project. Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, if (a) &#13;&#10;Tenant or any proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee of Tenant has been required by any &#13;&#10;prior landlord, Lender or Governmental Authority to take material remedial action in connection &#13;&#10;with Hazardous Materials contaminating a property if the contamination resulted from such &#13;&#10;party&#8217;s action or omission or use of the property in question or (b) Tenant or any proposed &#13;&#10;transferee, assignee or sublessee is subject to a material enforcement order issued by any &#13;&#10;Governmental Authority in connection with the use, disposal or storage of Hazardous Materials, &#13;&#10;then Landlord shall have the right to terminate this Lease in Landlord&#8217;s sole and absolute &#13;&#10;discretion (with respect to any such matter involving Tenant), and it shall not be unreasonable &#13;&#10;for Landlord to withhold its consent to any proposed transfer, assignment or subletting (with &#13;&#10;respect to any such matter involving a proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;29.2. In the event Tenant desires to effect a Transfer, then, at least thirty (30) but not &#13;&#10;more than one hundred eighty (180) days prior to the date when Tenant desires the Transfer to &#13;&#10;be effective (the &#8220;Transfer Date&#8221;), Tenant shall provide written notice to Landlord (the &#8220;Transfer &#13;&#10;Notice&#8221;) containing information (including references) concerning the character of the proposed &#13;&#10;transferee, assignee or sublessee; the anticipated Transfer Date; the most recent unconsolidated &#13;&#10;financial statements of Tenant and of the proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee satisfying &#13;&#10;the requirements of Section 40.2 (&#8220;Required Financials&#8221;); any ownership or commercial &#13;&#10;relationship between Tenant and the proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee; copies of &#13;&#10;Hazardous Materials Documents for the proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee; and the &#13;&#10;consideration and all other material terms and conditions of the proposed Transfer, all in such &#13;&#10;detail as Landlord shall reasonably require. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;29.3. Landlord, in determining whether consent should be given to a proposed Transfer, &#13;&#10;may give consideration to (a) the financial strength of Tenant and of such transferee, assignee or &#13;&#10;sublessee (notwithstanding Tenant remaining liable for Tenant&#8217;s performance), (b) any change in &#13;&#10;use that such transferee, assignee or sublessee proposes to make in the use of the Premises and &#13;&#10;(c) Landlord&#8217;s desire to exercise its rights under Section 29.7 to cancel this Lease. In no event &#13;&#10;shall Landlord be deemed to be unreasonable for declining to consent to a Transfer if any &#13;&#10;applicable Loan Document prohibits such assignment or any Lender whose consent is required &#13;&#10;thereunder withholds its consent, or if the Transfer is to a transferee, assignee or sublessee of &#13;&#10;poor reputation, lacking financial qualifications or seeking a change in the Permitted Use, or &#13;&#10;jeopardizing directly or indirectly the status of Landlord or any of Landlord&#8217;s affiliates as a Real &#13;&#10;Estate Investment Trust under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (as the same may be amended &#13;&#10;from time to time, the &#8220;Revenue Code&#8221;). Notwithstanding anything contained in this Lease to &#13;&#10;the contrary, (w) no Transfer shall be consummated on any basis such that the rental or other &#13;&#10;amounts to be paid by the occupant, assignee, manager or other transferee thereunder would be &#13;&#10;based, in whole or in part, on the income or profits derived by the business activities of such &#13;&#10;occupant, assignee, manager or other transferee; (x) Tenant shall not furnish or render any &#13;&#10;services to an occupant, assignee, manager or other transferee with respect to whom transfer &#13;&#10;consideration is required to be paid, or manage or operate the Premises or any capital additions &#13;&#10;so transferred, with respect to which transfer consideration is being paid; (y) Tenant shall not &#13;&#10;consummate a Transfer with any person in which Landlord owns an interest, directly or &#13;&#10;indirectly (by applying constructive ownership rules set forth in Section 856(d)(5) of the &#13;&#10;Revenue Code); and (z) Tenant shall not consummate a Transfer with any person or in any &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;52 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN056.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 56" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;manner that could cause any portion of the amounts received by Landlord pursuant to this Lease &#13;&#10;or any sublease, license or other arrangement for the right to use, occupy or possess any portion &#13;&#10;of the Premises to fail to qualify as &#8220;rents from real property&#8221; within the meaning of Section &#13;&#10;856(d) of the Revenue Code, or any similar or successor provision thereto or which could cause &#13;&#10;any other income of Landlord to fail to qualify as income described in Section 856(c)(2) of the &#13;&#10;Revenue Code. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;29.4. The following are conditions precedent to a Transfer or to Landlord considering a &#13;&#10;request by Tenant to a Transfer: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Tenant shall remain fully liable under this Lease. Tenant agrees that it &#13;&#10;shall not be (and shall not be deemed to be) a guarantor or surety of this Lease, however, and &#13;&#10;waives its right to claim that is it is a guarantor or surety or to raise in any legal proceeding any &#13;&#10;guarantor or surety defenses permitted by this Lease or by Applicable Laws; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) If Tenant or the proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee does not or &#13;&#10;cannot deliver the Required Financials, then Landlord may elect to have either Tenant&#8217;s ultimate &#13;&#10;parent company or the proposed transferee&#8217;s, assignee&#8217;s or sublessee&#8217;s ultimate parent company &#13;&#10;provide a guaranty of the applicable entity&#8217;s obligations under this Lease, in a form acceptable to &#13;&#10;Landlord, which guaranty shall be executed and delivered to Landlord by the applicable &#13;&#10;guarantor prior to the Transfer Date; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) In the case of an Exempt Transfer, Tenant shall provide Landlord with &#13;&#10;evidence reasonably satisfactory to Landlord that the Transfer qualifies as an Exempt Transfer; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) Tenant shall provide Landlord with evidence reasonably satisfactory to &#13;&#10;Landlord that the value of Landlord&#8217;s interest under this Lease shall not be diminished or &#13;&#10;reduced by the proposed Transfer. Such evidence shall include evidence respecting the relevant &#13;&#10;business experience and financial responsibility and status of the proposed transferee, assignee &#13;&#10;or sublessee; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) Tenant shall reimburse Landlord for Landlord&#8217;s actual costs and expenses, &#13;&#10;including reasonable attorneys&#8217; fees, charges and disbursements incurred in connection with the &#13;&#10;review, processing and documentation of such request (collectively, &#8220;Transfer Fees&#8221;); provided, &#13;&#10;however, that Tenant shall not be obligated to reimburse Landlord for any Transfer Fees in &#13;&#10;excess of $2,500.00; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(f) Except with respect to an Exempt Transfer, if Tenant&#8217;s transfer of rights or &#13;&#10;sharing of the Premises provides for the receipt by, on behalf of or on account of Tenant of any &#13;&#10;consideration of any kind whatsoever (including a premium rental for a sublease or lump sum &#13;&#10;payment for an assignment, after deducting Tenant&#8217;s reasonable costs in marketing and &#13;&#10;subleasing the Premises) in excess of the rental and other charges due to Landlord under this &#13;&#10;Lease, Tenant shall pay fifty percent (50%) of all of such excess to Landlord, after making &#13;&#10;deductions for any reasonable marketing expenses, tenant improvement funds expended by &#13;&#10;Tenant, alterations, cash concessions, brokerage commissions, attorneys&#8217; fees and free rent &#13;&#10;actually paid by Tenant. If such consideration consists of cash paid to Tenant, payment to &#13;&#10;Landlord shall be made upon receipt by Tenant of such cash payment; &#13;&#10;53 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;(g) The proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee shall agree that, in the &#13;&#10;event Landlord gives such proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee notice that Tenant is in &#13;&#10;Default under this Lease, such proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee shall thereafter make &#13;&#10;all payments otherwise due Tenant directly to Landlord, which payments shall be received by &#13;&#10;Landlord without any liability being incurred by Landlord, except to credit such payment against &#13;&#10;those due by Tenant under this Lease, and any such proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee &#13;&#10;shall agree to attorn to Landlord or its successors and assigns should this Lease be terminated for &#13;&#10;any reason; provided, however, that in no event shall Landlord or its Lenders, successors or &#13;&#10;assigns be obligated to accept such attornment; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;forms; &#13;&#10;(h) Landlord&#8217;s consent to any such Transfer shall be effected on Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Tenant shall not then be in Default hereunder; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(j) Such proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee&#8217;s use of the Premises &#13;&#10;shall be the same as the Permitted Use; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(k) Landlord shall not be bound by any provision of any agreement pertaining &#13;&#10;to the Transfer, except for Landlord&#8217;s written consent to the same; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(l) Tenant shall pay all transfer and other taxes (including interest and &#13;&#10;penalties) assessed or payable for any Transfer; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(m) Landlord&#8217;s consent (or waiver of its rights) for any Transfer, if applicable, &#13;&#10;shall not waive Landlord&#8217;s right to consent or refuse consent to any later Transfer; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(n) Tenant shall deliver to Landlord one executed copy of any and all written &#13;&#10;instruments evidencing or relating to the Transfer; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(o) Tenant shall deliver to Landlord a list of Hazardous Materials (as defined &#13;&#10;below), certified by the proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee to be true and correct, that the &#13;&#10;proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee intends to use or store in the Premises. Additionally, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall deliver to Landlord, on or before the date any proposed transferee, assignee or &#13;&#10;sublessee takes occupancy of the Premises, all of the items relating to Hazardous Materials of &#13;&#10;such proposed transferee, assignee or sublessee as described in Section 21.2. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;29.5. Any Transfer that is not in compliance with the provisions of this Article or with &#13;&#10;respect to which Tenant does not fulfill its obligations pursuant to this Article shall be void and &#13;&#10;shall, at the option of Landlord, terminate this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;29.6. Notwithstanding any Transfer, Tenant shall remain fully and primarily liable for &#13;&#10;the payment of all Rent and other sums due or to become due hereunder, and for the full &#13;&#10;performance of all other terms, conditions and covenants to be kept and performed by Tenant. &#13;&#10;The acceptance of Rent or any other sum due hereunder, or the acceptance of performance of any &#13;&#10;other term, covenant or condition thereof, from any person or entity other than Tenant shall not &#13;&#10;be deemed a waiver of any of the provisions of this Lease or a consent to any Transfer. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;54 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;29.7. If Tenant delivers to Landlord a Transfer Notice indicating a desire to (i) assign &#13;&#10;this Lease (other than pursuant to an Exempt Transfer) or (ii) enter into a sublease which results &#13;&#10;in more than fifty percent (50%) of the Premises being subject to a sublease for ninety-five &#13;&#10;percent (95%) or more of the remaining Term (other than pursuant to an Exempt Transfer), then &#13;&#10;Landlord shall have the option, exercisable by giving notice to Tenant at any time within thirty &#13;&#10;(30) days after Landlord&#8217;s receipt of such Transfer Notice, to terminate this Lease as of the date &#13;&#10;specified in the Transfer Notice as the Transfer Date, except for those provisions that, by their &#13;&#10;express terms, survive the expiration or earlier termination hereof. If Landlord exercises such &#13;&#10;option, then Tenant shall have the right to withdraw such Transfer Notice by delivering to &#13;&#10;Landlord written notice of such election within five (5) days after Landlord&#8217;s delivery of notice &#13;&#10;electing to exercise Landlord&#8217;s option to terminate this Lease. In the event Tenant withdraws the &#13;&#10;Transfer Notice as provided in this Section, this Lease shall continue in full force and effect. No &#13;&#10;failure of Landlord to exercise its option to terminate this Lease shall be deemed to be &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s consent to a proposed Transfer. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;29.8. If Tenant sublets the Premises or any portion thereof, Tenant hereby immediately &#13;&#10;and irrevocably assigns to Landlord, as security for Tenant&#8217;s obligations under this Lease, all &#13;&#10;rent from any such subletting, and appoints Landlord as assignee and attorney-in-fact for Tenant, &#13;&#10;and Landlord (or a receiver for Tenant appointed on Landlord&#8217;s application) may collect such &#13;&#10;rent and apply it toward Tenant&#8217;s obligations under this Lease; provided that, until the &#13;&#10;occurrence of a Default (as defined below) by Tenant, Tenant shall have the right to collect such &#13;&#10;rent. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;29.9. In the event that Tenant enters into a sublease for the entire Premises in &#13;&#10;accordance with this Article that expires within two (2) days of the Term Expiration Date, the &#13;&#10;term expiration date of such sublease shall, notwithstanding anything in this Lease, the sublease &#13;&#10;or any consent to the sublease to the contrary, be deemed to be the date that is two (2) days prior &#13;&#10;to the Term Expiration Date. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;30. Subordination and Attornment. &#13;&#10;30.1. This Lease shall be subject and subordinate to the lien of any mortgage, deed of &#13;&#10;trust, or lease in which Landlord is tenant now or hereafter in force against the Building or the &#13;&#10;Project and to all advances made or hereafter to be made upon the security thereof without the &#13;&#10;necessity of the execution and delivery of any further instruments on the part of Tenant to &#13;&#10;effectuate such subordination; provided, however, that a condition to such subordination will be &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s receipt of a Subordination, Non-Disturbance and Attornment Agreement in the form &#13;&#10;attached hereto as Exhibit M or on another commercially reasonable form acceptable to &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s lender or lien holder. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;30.2. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Tenant shall execute and deliver upon demand &#13;&#10;such further instrument or instruments evidencing such subordination of this Lease to the lien of &#13;&#10;any such mortgage or mortgages or deeds of trust or lease in which Landlord is tenant as may be &#13;&#10;required by Landlord. If any Lender so elects, however, this Lease shall be deemed prior in lien &#13;&#10;to any such lease, mortgage, or deed of trust upon or including the Premises regardless of date &#13;&#10;and Tenant shall execute a statement in writing to such effect at Landlord&#8217;s request. If Tenant &#13;&#10;fails to execute any document required from Tenant under this Section within ten (10) business &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;55 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	56 &#13;&#10;days after written request therefor, Tenant hereby constitutes and appoints Landlord or its special &#13;&#10;attorney-in-fact to execute and deliver any such document or documents in the name of Tenant. &#13;&#10;Such power is coupled with an interest and is irrevocable. For the avoidance of doubt, &#8220;Lender&#8221; &#13;&#10;shall also include historic tax credit investors and new market tax credit investors. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;30.3. Upon written request of Landlord and opportunity for Tenant to review, Tenant &#13;&#10;agrees to execute any Lease amendments not materially altering the terms of this Lease, if &#13;&#10;required by a Lender incident to the financing of the real property of which the Premises &#13;&#10;constitute a part. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;30.4. In the event any proceedings are brought for foreclosure, or in the event of the &#13;&#10;exercise of the power of sale under any mortgage or deed of trust made by Landlord covering the &#13;&#10;Premises, Tenant shall at the election of the purchaser at such foreclosure or sale attorn to the &#13;&#10;purchaser upon any such foreclosure or sale and recognize such purchaser as Landlord under this &#13;&#10;Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31. Defaults and Remedies. &#13;&#10;31.1. Late payment by Tenant to Landlord of Rent and other sums due shall cause &#13;&#10;Landlord to incur costs not contemplated by this Lease, the exact amount of which shall be &#13;&#10;extremely difficult and impracticable to ascertain. Such costs include processing and accounting &#13;&#10;charges and late charges that may be imposed on Landlord by the terms of any mortgage or trust &#13;&#10;deed covering the Premises. Therefore, if any installment of Rent due from Tenant is not &#13;&#10;received by Landlord within five (5) business days after the date such payment is due, Tenant &#13;&#10;shall pay to Landlord (a) an additional sum of four percent (4%) of the overdue Rent as a late &#13;&#10;charge plus (b) interest at an annual rate (the &#8220;Default Rate&#8221;) equal to the lesser of (a) twelve &#13;&#10;percent (12%) and (b) the highest rate permitted by Applicable Laws. The parties agree that this &#13;&#10;late charge represents a fair and reasonable estimate of the costs that Landlord shall incur by &#13;&#10;reason of late payment by Tenant and shall be payable as Additional Rent to Landlord due with &#13;&#10;the next installment of Rent or within five (5) business days after Landlord&#8217;s demand, whichever &#13;&#10;is earlier. Landlord&#8217;s acceptance of any Additional Rent (including a late charge or any other &#13;&#10;amount hereunder) shall not be deemed an extension of the date that Rent is due or prevent &#13;&#10;Landlord from pursuing any other rights or remedies under this Lease, at law or in equity. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.2. No payment by Tenant or receipt by Landlord of a lesser amount than the Rent &#13;&#10;payment herein stipulated shall be deemed to be other than on account of the Rent, nor shall any &#13;&#10;endorsement or statement on any check or any letter accompanying any check or payment as &#13;&#10;Rent be deemed an accord and satisfaction, and Landlord may accept such check or payment &#13;&#10;without prejudice to Landlord&#8217;s right to recover the balance of such Rent or pursue any other &#13;&#10;remedy provided in this Lease or in equity or at law. If a dispute shall arise as to any amount or &#13;&#10;sum of money to be paid by Tenant to Landlord hereunder, Tenant shall have the right to make &#13;&#10;payment &#8220;under protest,&#8221; such payment shall not be regarded as a voluntary payment, and there &#13;&#10;shall survive the right on the part of Tenant to institute suit for recovery of the payment paid &#13;&#10;under protest. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.3. If Tenant fails to pay any sum of money required to be paid by it hereunder or &#13;&#10;perform any other act on its part to be performed hereunder, in each case within the applicable &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	57 &#13;&#10;cure period (if any) described in Section 31.4, then Landlord may (but shall not be obligated to), &#13;&#10;without waiving or releasing Tenant from any obligations of Tenant, make such payment or &#13;&#10;perform such act; provided that such failure by Tenant unreasonably interfered with the use of &#13;&#10;the Building or the Project by any other tenant or with the efficient operation of the Building or &#13;&#10;the Project, or resulted or could have resulted in a violation of Applicable Laws or the &#13;&#10;cancellation of an insurance policy maintained by Landlord. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in &#13;&#10;the event of an emergency, Landlord shall have the right to enter the Premises and act in &#13;&#10;accordance with its rights as provided elsewhere in this Lease. In addition to the late charge &#13;&#10;described in Section 31.1, Tenant shall pay to Landlord as Additional Rent all sums so paid or &#13;&#10;incurred by Landlord, together with interest at the Default Rate, computed from the date such &#13;&#10;sums were paid or incurred. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.4. The occurrence of any one or more of the following events shall constitute a &#13;&#10;&#8220;Default&#8221; hereunder by Tenant: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Tenant abandons the Premises or vacates without providing a &#13;&#10;commercially reasonable level of security; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Tenant fails to make any payment of Rent, as and when due, or to satisfy &#13;&#10;its obligations under Article 19, where such failure shall continue for a period of five (5) &#13;&#10;business days after written notice thereof from Landlord to Tenant; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) Tenant fails to observe or perform any obligation or covenant contained &#13;&#10;herein (other than described in Sections 31.4(a) and 31.4(b)) to be performed by Tenant, where &#13;&#10;such failure continues for a period of thirty (30) days after written notice thereof from Landlord &#13;&#10;to Tenant; provided that, if the nature of Tenant&#8217;s default is such that it reasonably requires more &#13;&#10;than thirty (30) days to cure, Tenant shall not be deemed to be in Default if Tenant commences &#13;&#10;such cure within such thirty (30) day period and thereafter diligently prosecutes the same to &#13;&#10;completion; and provided, further, that such cure is completed no later than ninety (90) days &#13;&#10;after Tenant&#8217;s receipt of written notice from Landlord (unless Tenant&#8217;s ability to cure is outside &#13;&#10;of Tenant&#8217;s control (provided that financial inability shall not be considered outside of Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;control), in which case the foregoing ninety (90) day period will not apply so long as Tenant &#13;&#10;diligently pursues such cure as soon as it is able); &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) Tenant makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(e) A receiver, trustee or custodian is appointed to or does take title, &#13;&#10;possession or control of all or substantially all of Tenant&#8217;s assets; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(f) Tenant files a voluntary petition under the United States Bankruptcy Code &#13;&#10;or any successor statute (as the same may be amended from time to time, the &#8220;Bankruptcy &#13;&#10;Code&#8221;) or an order for relief is entered against Tenant pursuant to a voluntary or involuntary &#13;&#10;proceeding commenced under any chapter of the Bankruptcy Code; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(g) Any involuntary petition is filed against Tenant under any chapter of the &#13;&#10;Bankruptcy Code and is not dismissed within one hundred twenty (120) days; &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	58 &#13;&#10;(h) Tenant fails to deliver an estoppel certificate in accordance with Article 20 &#13;&#10;after the additional notice and cure period provided in Article 20; or &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) Tenant&#8217;s interest in this Lease is attached, executed upon or otherwise &#13;&#10;judicially seized and such action is not released within one hundred twenty (120) days of the &#13;&#10;action. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Notices given under this Section shall specify the alleged default and shall demand that Tenant &#13;&#10;perform the provisions of this Lease or pay the Rent that is in arrears, as the case may be, within &#13;&#10;the applicable period of time, or quit the Premises. No such notice shall be deemed a forfeiture &#13;&#10;or a termination of this Lease unless Landlord elects otherwise in such notice. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.5. In the event of a Default by Tenant, and at any time thereafter, with or without &#13;&#10;notice or demand and without limiting Landlord in the exercise of any right or remedy that &#13;&#10;Landlord may have, Landlord has the right to do any or all of the following: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Halt any Tenant Improvements and Alterations and order Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;contractors, subcontractors, consultants, designers and material suppliers to stop work; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Terminate Tenant&#8217;s right to possession of the Premises by written notice &#13;&#10;to Tenant or by any lawful means, in which case Tenant shall immediately surrender possession &#13;&#10;of the Premises to Landlord. In such event, Landlord shall have the immediate right to re-enter &#13;&#10;and remove all persons and property, and such property may be removed and stored in a public &#13;&#10;warehouse or elsewhere at the cost and for the account of Tenant, all without service of notice or &#13;&#10;resort to legal process and without being deemed guilty of trespass or becoming liable for any &#13;&#10;loss or damage that may be occasioned thereby; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(c) Terminate this Lease, in which event Tenant shall immediately surrender &#13;&#10;possession of the Premises to Landlord. In such event, Landlord shall have the immediate right &#13;&#10;to re-enter and remove all persons and property, and such property may be removed and stored in &#13;&#10;a public warehouse or elsewhere at the cost and for the account of Tenant, all without service of &#13;&#10;notice or resort to legal process and without being deemed guilty of trespass or becoming liable &#13;&#10;for any loss or damage that may be occasioned thereby. In the event that Landlord shall elect to &#13;&#10;so terminate this Lease, then Landlord shall be entitled to recover from Tenant all damages &#13;&#10;incurred by Landlord by reason of Tenant&#8217;s default, including: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(i) The sum of: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;A. The worth at the time of award of any unpaid Rent that had &#13;&#10;accrued at the time of such termination; plus &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;B. The worth at the time of award of the amount by which the &#13;&#10;unpaid Rent that would have accrued during the period commencing with termination of the &#13;&#10;Lease and ending at the time of award exceeds that portion of the loss of Landlord&#8217;s rental &#13;&#10;income from the Premises that Tenant proves could have been reasonably avoided; plus &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage121"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0062 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN062.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 62" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	59 &#13;&#10;C. The worth at the time of award of the amount by which the &#13;&#10;unpaid Rent for the balance of the Term after the time of award exceeds that portion of the loss &#13;&#10;of Landlord&#8217;s rental income from the Premises that Tenant proves could have been reasonably &#13;&#10;avoided; plus &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;D. Any other amount necessary to compensate Landlord for &#13;&#10;all the detriment caused by Tenant&#8217;s failure to perform its obligations under this Lease or that in &#13;&#10;the ordinary course of things would be likely to result therefrom, including the cost of restoring &#13;&#10;the Premises to the condition required under the terms of this Lease, including any rent payments &#13;&#10;not otherwise chargeable to Tenant (e.g., during any &#8220;free&#8221; rent period or rent holiday); plus &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;E. At Landlord&#8217;s election, such other amounts in addition to &#13;&#10;or in lieu of the foregoing as may be permitted from time to time by Applicable Laws. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;As used in Sections 31.5(c)(i)(A) and (B), &#8220;worth at the time of award&#8221; shall be computed by &#13;&#10;allowing interest at the Default Rate. As used in Section 31.5(c)(i)(C), the &#8220;worth at the time of &#13;&#10;the award&#8221; shall be computed by taking the present value of such amount, using the discount rate &#13;&#10;of the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco at the time of the award plus one percent (1%). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.6. In addition to any other remedies available to Landlord at law or in equity and &#13;&#10;under this Lease, Landlord shall have the remedy described in California Civil Code Section &#13;&#10;and may continue this Lease in effect after Tenant&#8217;s Default or abandonment and recover Rent &#13;&#10;as it becomes due, provided Tenant has the right to sublet or assign, subject only to &#13;&#10;reasonable limitations. In addition, subject to California Civil Code Section 1951.4, Landlord &#13;&#10;shall not be liable in any way whatsoever for its failure or refusal to relet the Premises. For &#13;&#10;purposes of this Section, the following acts by Landlord will not constitute the termination of &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s right to possession of the Premises: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Acts of maintenance or preservation or efforts to relet the Premises, &#13;&#10;including alterations, remodeling, redecorating, repairs, replacements or painting as Landlord &#13;&#10;shall consider advisable for the purpose of reletting the Premises or any part thereof; or &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) The appointment of a receiver upon the initiative of Landlord to protect &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s interest under this Lease or in the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event of a Default by Tenant, Landlord may elect at any &#13;&#10;time to terminate this Lease and to recover damages to which Landlord is entitled. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.7. If Landlord does not elect to terminate this Lease as provided in Section 31.5, &#13;&#10;then Landlord may, from time to time, recover all Rent as it becomes due under this Lease. At &#13;&#10;any time thereafter, Landlord may elect to terminate this Lease and to recover damages to which &#13;&#10;Landlord is entitled. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.8. In the event Landlord elects to terminate this Lease and relet the Premises, &#13;&#10;Landlord may execute any new lease in its own name. Tenant hereunder shall have no right or &#13;&#10;authority whatsoever to collect any Rent from such tenant. The proceeds of any such reletting &#13;&#10;shall be applied as follows: &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	60 &#13;&#10;(a) First, to the payment of any indebtedness other than Rent due hereunder &#13;&#10;from Tenant to Landlord, including storage charges or brokerage commissions owing from &#13;&#10;Tenant to Landlord as the result of such reletting; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Second, to the payment of the costs and expenses of reletting the &#13;&#10;Premises, including (i) alterations and repairs that Landlord deems reasonably necessary and &#13;&#10;advisable and (ii) reasonable attorneys&#8217; fees, charges and disbursements incurred by Landlord in &#13;&#10;connection with the retaking of the Premises and such reletting; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;hereunder; and &#13;&#10;(c) Third, to the payment of Rent and other charges due and unpaid &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(d) Fourth, to the payment of future Rent and other damages payable by &#13;&#10;Tenant under this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.9. All of Landlord&#8217;s rights, options and remedies hereunder shall be construed and &#13;&#10;held to be nonexclusive and cumulative. Landlord shall have the right to pursue any one or all of &#13;&#10;such remedies, or any other remedy or relief that may be provided by Applicable Laws, whether &#13;&#10;or not stated in this Lease. No waiver of any default of Tenant hereunder shall be implied from &#13;&#10;any acceptance by Landlord of any Rent or other payments due hereunder or any omission by &#13;&#10;Landlord to take any action on account of such default if such default persists or is repeated, and &#13;&#10;no express waiver shall affect defaults other than as specified in such waiver. Landlord shall be &#13;&#10;required to mitigate its damages with respect to any default by Tenant to the extent required by &#13;&#10;Applicable Laws. Any such obligation imposed by Applicable Laws upon Landlord to relet the &#13;&#10;Premises after any termination of this Lease shall be subject to the reasonable requirements of &#13;&#10;Landlord to (a) lease to high quality tenants on such terms as Landlord may from time to time &#13;&#10;deem appropriate in its discretion and (b) develop the Project in a harmonious manner with a mix &#13;&#10;of uses, tenants, floor areas, terms of tenancies, etc., as determined by Landlord. Landlord shall &#13;&#10;not be obligated to relet the Premises to (y) any Tenant&#8217;s Affiliate or (z) any party (i) &#13;&#10;unacceptable to a Lender, (ii) that requires Landlord to make improvements to or re-demise the &#13;&#10;Premises, (iii) that desires to change the Permitted Use, (iv) that desires to lease the Premises for &#13;&#10;more or less than the remaining Term or (v) to whom Landlord or an affiliate of Landlord may &#13;&#10;desire to lease other available space in the Project or at another property owned by Landlord or &#13;&#10;an affiliate of Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.10. Landlord&#8217;s termination of (a) this Lease or (b) Tenant&#8217;s right to possession of the &#13;&#10;Premises shall not relieve Tenant of any liability to Landlord that has previously accrued or that &#13;&#10;shall arise based upon events that occurred prior to the later to occur of (y) the date of Lease &#13;&#10;termination and (z) the date Tenant surrenders possession of the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.11. To the extent permitted by Applicable Laws, Tenant waives any and all rights of &#13;&#10;redemption granted by or under any present or future Applicable Laws if Tenant is evicted or &#13;&#10;dispossessed for any cause, or if Landlord obtains possession of the Premises due to Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;default hereunder or otherwise. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;31.12. Landlord shall not be in default or liable for damages under this Lease unless &#13;&#10;Landlord fails to perform obligations required of Landlord within a reasonable time, but in no &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	61 &#13;&#10;event shall such failure continue for more than thirty (30) days after written notice from Tenant &#13;&#10;specifying the nature of Landlord&#8217;s failure; provided, however, that if the nature of Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;obligation is such that more than thirty (30) days are required for its performance, then Landlord &#13;&#10;shall not be in default if Landlord commences performance within such thirty (30) day period &#13;&#10;and thereafter diligently prosecutes the same to completion. 	65 &#13;&#10;40.2. 	66 &#13;&#10;Lease, then the substantially prevailing party shall be reimbursed by the other party for all &#13;&#10;reasonable costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys&#8217; fees and expenses, incurred by &#13;&#10;the substantially prevailing party in such action, proceeding, demand, claim, action, cause of &#13;&#10;action or suit, and in any appeal in connection therewith (regardless of whether the applicable &#13;&#10;action, proceeding, demand, claim, action, cause of action, suit or appeal is voluntarily &#13;&#10;withdrawn or dismissed). In addition, Landlord shall, upon demand, be entitled to all reasonable &#13;&#10;attorneys&#8217; fees and all other reasonable costs incurred in the preparation and service of any &#13;&#10;notice of Default hereunder, regardless of whether a legal action is subsequently commenced, or &#13;&#10;incurred in connection with any contested matter or other proceeding in bankruptcy court &#13;&#10;concerning this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Lease. &#13;&#10;40.8. Time is of the essence with respect to the performance of every provision of this &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.9. Each provision of this Lease performable by Tenant shall be deemed both a &#13;&#10;covenant and a condition. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.10. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Lease, Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;obligations under this Lease are independent and shall not be conditioned upon performance by &#13;&#10;Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.11. Whenever consent or approval of either party is required, that party shall not &#13;&#10;unreasonably withhold, condition or delay such consent or approval, except as may be expressly &#13;&#10;set forth to the contrary. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.12. Any provision of this Lease that shall prove to be invalid, void or illegal shall in &#13;&#10;no way affect, impair or invalidate any other provision hereof, and all other provisions of this &#13;&#10;Lease shall remain in full force and effect and shall be interpreted as if the invalid, void or illegal &#13;&#10;provision did not exist. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.13. Each of the covenants, conditions and agreements herein contained shall inure to &#13;&#10;the benefit of and shall apply to and be binding upon the parties hereto and their respective heirs; &#13;&#10;legatees; devisees; executors; administrators; and permitted successors and assigns. This Lease &#13;&#10;is for the sole benefit of the parties and their respective heirs, legatees, devisees, executors, &#13;&#10;administrators and permitted successors and assigns, and nothing in this Lease shall give or be &#13;&#10;construed to give any other person or entity any legal or equitable rights. Nothing in this Section &#13;&#10;shall in any way alter the provisions of this Lease restricting assignment or subletting. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.14. This Lease shall be governed by, construed and enforced in accordance with the &#13;&#10;laws of the state in which the Premises are located, without regard to such state&#8217;s conflict of law &#13;&#10;principles. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.15. [Intentionally omitted] &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.16. This Lease may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which, when &#13;&#10;taken together, shall constitute one and the same document. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage129"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;

<!-- SLIDE 0070 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN070.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 70" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	67 &#13;&#10;40.17. No provision of this Lease may be modified, amended or supplemented except by &#13;&#10;an agreement in writing signed by Landlord and Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.18. No waiver of any term, covenant or condition of this Lease shall be binding upon &#13;&#10;Landlord unless executed in writing by Landlord. The waiver by Landlord of any breach or &#13;&#10;default of any term, covenant or condition contained in this Lease shall not be deemed to be a &#13;&#10;waiver of any preceding or subsequent breach or default of such term, covenant or condition or &#13;&#10;any other term, covenant or condition of this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.19. To the extent permitted by Applicable Laws, the parties waive trial by jury in any &#13;&#10;action, proceeding or counterclaim brought by the other party hereto related to matters arising &#13;&#10;out of or in any way connected with this Lease; the relationship between Landlord and Tenant; &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s use or occupancy of the Premises; or any claim of injury or damage related to this &#13;&#10;Lease or the Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;40.20. Subject to compliance with Applicable Laws and Landlord&#8217;s prior approval &#13;&#10;(which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld) of all plans and specifications for such &#13;&#10;items (which shall be installed either as an Alteration or as part of the initial Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements), Landlord will permit Tenant to install and operate (a) a kitchen within the &#13;&#10;Premises containing a stove, oven, sink and any other reasonably related fixtures and appliances, &#13;&#10;and (b) a barbecue grill at a location reasonably approved by Landlord, in each case for use by &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s employees and occasional use for company functions of Tenant at the Premises. &#13;&#10;Tenant will be responsible for performing commercially reasonable repair and maintenance with &#13;&#10;respect to the items listed in Subsections (a) and (b) above and will otherwise comply with any &#13;&#10;reasonable requirements of Landlord with respect to the maintenance of such items. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;41. [Intentionally omitted] &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;42. Option to Extend Term. Tenant shall have one (1) option (&#8221;Option&#8221;) to extend the Term &#13;&#10;by five (5) years as to the entire Premises (and no less than the entire Premises) upon the &#13;&#10;following terms and conditions. Any extension of the Term pursuant to the Option shall be on &#13;&#10;all the same terms and conditions as this Lease, except as follows: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;42.1. Base Rent at the commencement of the Option term shall equal the then-current &#13;&#10;fair market value for comparable office and laboratory space in the UTC submarket of &#13;&#10;comparable age, quality, level of finish and proximity to amenities and public transit, and &#13;&#10;containing the systems and improvements present in the Premises as of the date that Tenant gives &#13;&#10;Landlord written notice of Tenant&#8217;s election to exercise the Option (&#8220;FMV&#8221;), and shall be &#13;&#10;further increased on each annual anniversary of the Option term commencement date by three &#13;&#10;percent (3%). Tenant may, no more than fifteen (15) months prior to the date the Term is then &#13;&#10;scheduled to expire, request Landlord&#8217;s estimate of the FMV for the Option term. Landlord &#13;&#10;shall, within fifteen (15) days after receipt of such request, give Tenant a written proposal of &#13;&#10;such FMV. If Tenant gives written notice to exercise the Option, such notice shall specify &#13;&#10;whether Tenant accepts Landlord&#8217;s proposed estimate of FMV. If Tenant does not accept the &#13;&#10;FMV, then the parties shall endeavor to agree upon the FMV, taking into account all relevant &#13;&#10;factors, including (a) the size of the Premises, (b) the length of the Option term, (c) rent in &#13;&#10;comparable buildings in the relevant submarket, including concessions offered to new tenants, &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage130"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0071 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN071.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 71" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	68 &#13;&#10;such as free rent, tenant improvement allowances and moving allowances, (d) Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;creditworthiness and (e) the quality and location of the Building and the Project. In the event &#13;&#10;that the parties are unable to agree upon the FMV within thirty (30) days after Tenant notifies &#13;&#10;Landlord that Tenant is exercising the Option, then either party may request that the same be &#13;&#10;determined as follows: a senior officer of a nationally recognized leasing brokerage firm with &#13;&#10;local knowledge of the UTC laboratory/research and development leasing submarket (the &#13;&#10;&#8220;Baseball Arbitrator&#8221;) shall be selected and paid for jointly by Landlord and Tenant. If Landlord &#13;&#10;and Tenant are unable to agree upon the Baseball Arbitrator, then the same shall be designated &#13;&#10;by the local chapter of the Judicial Arbitration and Mediation Services or any successor &#13;&#10;organization thereto (the &#8220;JAMS&#8221;). The Baseball Arbitrator selected by the parties or designated &#13;&#10;by JAMS shall (y) have at least ten (10) years&#8217; experience in the leasing of laboratory/research &#13;&#10;and development space in the UTC submarket and (z) not have been employed or retained by &#13;&#10;either Landlord or Tenant or any affiliate of either for a period of at least ten (10) years prior to &#13;&#10;appointment pursuant hereto. Each of Landlord and Tenant shall submit to the Baseball &#13;&#10;Arbitrator and to the other party its determination of the FMV. The Baseball Arbitrator shall &#13;&#10;grant to Landlord and Tenant a hearing and the right to submit evidence. The Baseball &#13;&#10;Arbitrator shall determine which of the two (2) FMV determinations more closely represents the &#13;&#10;actual FMV. The arbitrator may not select any other FMV for the Premises other than one &#13;&#10;submitted by Landlord or Tenant. The FMV selected by the Baseball Arbitrator shall be binding &#13;&#10;upon Landlord and Tenant and shall serve as the basis for determination of Base Rent payable &#13;&#10;for the Option term. If, as of the commencement date of the Option term, the amount of Base &#13;&#10;Rent payable during the Option term shall not have been determined, then, pending such &#13;&#10;determination, Tenant shall pay Base Rent equal to the Base Rent payable with respect to the last &#13;&#10;year of the then-current Term. After the final determination of Base Rent payable for the Option &#13;&#10;term, the parties shall promptly execute a written amendment to this Lease specifying the amount &#13;&#10;of Base Rent to be paid during the Option term. Any failure of the parties to execute such &#13;&#10;amendment shall not affect the validity of the FMV determined pursuant to this Section. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;42.2. The Option is not assignable separate and apart from this Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;42.3. The Option is conditional upon Tenant giving Landlord written notice of its &#13;&#10;election to exercise the Option not more than fifteen (15) months and not less than twelve (12) &#13;&#10;months prior to the end of the expiration of the then-current Term. Time shall be of the essence &#13;&#10;as to Tenant&#8217;s exercise of the Option. Tenant assumes full responsibility for maintaining a &#13;&#10;record of the deadlines to exercise the Option. Tenant acknowledges that it would be inequitable &#13;&#10;to require Landlord to accept any exercise of the Option after the date provided for in this &#13;&#10;Section. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;42.4. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Article to the contrary, Tenant shall &#13;&#10;not have the right to exercise the Option: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) During the time commencing from the date Landlord delivers to Tenant a &#13;&#10;written notice that Tenant is in default under any provisions of this Lease and continuing until &#13;&#10;Tenant has cured the specified default to Landlord&#8217;s reasonable satisfaction; or &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) At any time after any Default as described in Article 31 of the Lease and &#13;&#10;continuing until Tenant cures any such Default, if such Default is susceptible to being cured; or &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage131"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN072.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 72" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	69 &#13;&#10;(c) In the event that Landlord has delivered to Tenant notice two (2) or more &#13;&#10;times during the twelve (12)-month period immediately prior to the date that Tenant intends to &#13;&#10;exercise the Option, that Tenant is in monetary or material non-monetary default in the &#13;&#10;performance of its obligations hereunder, whether or not Tenant has cured such defaults. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;42.5. The period of time within which Tenant may exercise the Option shall not be &#13;&#10;extended or enlarged by reason of Tenant&#8217;s inability to exercise such Option because of the &#13;&#10;provisions of Section 42.4. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;42.6. All of Tenant&#8217;s rights under the provisions of the Option shall terminate and be of &#13;&#10;no further force or effect even after Tenant&#8217;s due and timely exercise of the Option if, after such &#13;&#10;exercise, but prior to the commencement date of the new term, (a) Tenant fails to pay to &#13;&#10;Landlord a monetary obligation of Tenant for a period of twenty (20) days after written notice &#13;&#10;from Landlord to Tenant, (b) Tenant fails to commence to cure a default (other than a monetary &#13;&#10;default) within thirty (30) days after the date Landlord gives notice to Tenant of such default or &#13;&#10;(c) Tenant has defaulted under this Lease three (3) or more times and a service or late charge &#13;&#10;under Section 31.1 has become payable for any such default, whether or not Tenant has cured &#13;&#10;such defaults. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;43. Rooftop Access. Landlord hereby grants to Tenant the Rooftop License (as defined in &#13;&#10;Exhibit K) subject to the terms and conditions set forth in Exhibit K attached hereto. Tenant &#13;&#10;acknowledges that the rooftop of the Building is currently subject to a lease (the &#8220;Rooftop &#13;&#10;Lease&#8221;) with Global Tower, LLC (together with its successors, assigns, subtenants and licensees, &#13;&#10;&#8220;Global&#8221;). Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Lease, Tenant acknowledges and &#13;&#10;agrees that Tenant shall, upon prior notice, provide Global with access to the Building &#13;&#10;(including, without limitation, the Building rooftop) at all times to exercise Global&#8217;s rights under &#13;&#10;the Rooftop Lease, including installation of any equipment permitted to be installed pursuant to &#13;&#10;the Rooftop Lease (provided, however, that Tenant shall be permitted to require that a &#13;&#10;representative of Tenant accompany Global during any such access). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;[REMAINDER OF THIS PAGE INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK] &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN078.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 78" WIDTH="1598" HEIGHT="1034">

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	B-1 &#13;&#10;EXHIBIT B &#13;&#10;WORK LETTER &#13;&#10;This Work Letter (this &#8220;Work Letter&#8221;) is made and entered into as of the day of December, &#13;&#10;2016, by and between BMR-AXIOM LP, a Delaware limited partnership (&#8220;Landlord&#8221;), and LA &#13;&#10;JOLLA PHARMACEUTICAL COMPANY, a California corporation (&#8220;Tenant&#8221;), and is attached &#13;&#10;to and made a part of that certain Lease dated as of December , 2016 (as the same may be &#13;&#10;amended, amended and restated, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time, the &#13;&#10;&#8220;Lease&#8221;), by and between Landlord and Tenant for the Premises located at 4550 Towne Centre &#13;&#10;Court, San Diego, California. All capitalized terms used but not otherwise defined herein shall &#13;&#10;have the meanings given them in the Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;1. General Requirements. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;1.1. Authorized Representatives. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Landlord designates, as Landlord&#8217;s authorized representative (&#8220;Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;Authorized Representative&#8221;), (i) Federico Mina as the person authorized to initial plans, &#13;&#10;drawings, approvals and to sign change orders pursuant to this Work Letter and (ii) an officer of &#13;&#10;Landlord as the person authorized to sign any amendments to this Work Letter or the Lease. &#13;&#10;Tenant shall not be obligated to respond to or act upon any such item until such item has been &#13;&#10;initialed or signed (as applicable) by the appropriate Landlord&#8217;s Authorized Representative. &#13;&#10;Landlord may change Landlord&#8217;s Authorized Representative upon one (1) business day&#8217;s prior &#13;&#10;written notice to Tenant. Landlord&#8217;s Authorized Representative and a representative of &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s lender will have access to the Premises at all times during the construction of the &#13;&#10;Tenant Improvements, and if requested by Landlord, Tenant&#8217;s Authorized Representative will be &#13;&#10;present during any site visit at a mutually agreed time. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Tenant designates Niklas Bandak (&#8220;Tenant&#8217;s Authorized Representative&#8221;) &#13;&#10;as the person authorized to initial and sign all plans, drawings, change orders and approvals &#13;&#10;pursuant to this Work Letter. Landlord shall not be obligated to respond to or act upon any such &#13;&#10;item until such item has been initialed or signed (as applicable) by Tenant&#8217;s Authorized &#13;&#10;Representative. Tenant may change Tenant&#8217;s Authorized Representative upon one (1) business &#13;&#10;day&#8217;s prior written notice to Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;1.2. Schedule. The schedule for design and development of the Tenant Improvements, &#13;&#10;including the time periods for preparation and review of construction documents, approvals and &#13;&#10;performance, shall be in accordance with a schedule to be prepared by Tenant (the &#8220;Schedule&#8221;). &#13;&#10;Tenant shall prepare the Schedule so that it is a reasonable schedule for the completion of the &#13;&#10;Tenant Improvements. The Schedule shall clearly identify all activities requiring Landlord &#13;&#10;participation, including specific dates and time periods when Tenant&#8217;s contractor will require &#13;&#10;access to areas of the Project outside of the Premises. As soon as the Schedule is completed, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall deliver the same to Landlord for Landlord&#8217;s approval, which approval shall not be &#13;&#10;unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. Such Schedule shall be approved or disapproved &#13;&#10;by Landlord within ten (10) business days after delivery to Landlord. Landlord&#8217;s failure to &#13;&#10;respond within such ten (10) business day period shall be deemed approval by Landlord. If &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	B-2 &#13;&#10;Landlord disapproves the Schedule, then Landlord shall notify Tenant in writing of its objections &#13;&#10;to such Schedule, and the parties shall confer and negotiate in good faith to reach agreement on &#13;&#10;the Schedule. The Schedule shall be subject to adjustment as mutually agreed upon in writing by &#13;&#10;the parties, or as provided in this Work Letter. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;1.3. Tenant&#8217;s Architects, Contractors and Consultants. The architect, engineering &#13;&#10;consultants, design team, general contractor and subcontractors responsible for the construction &#13;&#10;of the Tenant Improvements shall be selected by Tenant and approved by Landlord in &#13;&#10;accordance with Section 4.7 of the Lease. Landlord may refuse to use any architects, &#13;&#10;consultants, contractors, subcontractors or material suppliers that Landlord reasonably believes &#13;&#10;could cause labor disharmony or may not have sufficient experience, in Landlord&#8217;s reasonable &#13;&#10;opinion, to perform work in an occupied Class &#8220;A&#8221; laboratory research building and in lab areas. &#13;&#10;All Tenant contracts related to the Tenant Improvements shall provide that Tenant may assign &#13;&#10;such contracts and any warranties with respect to the Tenant Improvements to Landlord at any &#13;&#10;time and a copy of all such contracts will be provided to Landlord (including any contracts &#13;&#10;between the general contractor and any subcontractors performing work in excess of $100,000). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;2. Tenant Improvements. All Tenant Improvements shall be performed by Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;contractor, at Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense (subject to Landlord&#8217;s obligations with respect to &#13;&#10;payment of the Base TI Allowance and, if properly requested by Tenant pursuant to the terms of &#13;&#10;the Lease, the Additional TI Allowance) and in accordance with the Approved Plans (as defined &#13;&#10;below), the Lease and this Work Letter. To the extent that the total projected cost of the Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements (as projected by Landlord) exceeds the TI Allowance (such excess, the &#8220;Excess &#13;&#10;TI Costs&#8221;), Tenant shall pay the costs of the Tenant Improvements on a pari passu basis with &#13;&#10;Landlord as such costs become due, in the proportion of Excess TI Costs payable by Tenant to &#13;&#10;the Base TI Allowance (and, if properly requested by Tenant pursuant to the Lease, the &#13;&#10;Additional TI Allowance). If the cost of the Tenant Improvements (as projected by Landlord) &#13;&#10;increases over Landlord&#8217;s initial projection, then Landlord may notify Tenant and Tenant shall &#13;&#10;pay any additional Excess TI Costs in the same way that Tenant paid the initial Excess TI Costs. &#13;&#10;If Tenant fails to pay, or is late in paying, any sum due to Landlord under this Work Letter, then &#13;&#10;after notice and the expiration of a ten (10) business day cure period, Landlord shall have all of &#13;&#10;the rights and remedies set forth in the Lease for nonpayment of Rent (including the right to &#13;&#10;interest and the right to assess a late charge), and for purposes of any litigation instituted with &#13;&#10;regard to such amounts the same shall be considered Rent. All material and equipment furnished &#13;&#10;by Tenant or its contractors as the Tenant Improvements shall be new or &#8220;like new;&#8221; the Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements shall be performed in a first-class, workmanlike manner; and the quality of the &#13;&#10;Tenant Improvements shall be of a nature and character not less than the Building Standard. &#13;&#10;Tenant shall take, and shall require its contractors to take, commercially reasonable steps to &#13;&#10;protect the Premises during the performance of any Tenant Improvements, including covering or &#13;&#10;temporarily removing any window coverings so as to guard against dust, debris or damage. All &#13;&#10;Tenant Improvements shall be performed in accordance with Article 17 of the Lease; provided &#13;&#10;that, notwithstanding anything in the Lease or this Work Letter to the contrary, in the event of a &#13;&#10;conflict between this Work Letter and Article 17 of the Lease, the terms of this Work Letter shall &#13;&#10;govern. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
