<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	B-3 &#13;&#10;2.1. Work Plans. Tenant shall prepare and submit to Landlord for approval &#13;&#10;schematics covering the Tenant Improvements prepared in conformity with the applicable &#13;&#10;provisions of this Work Letter (the &#8220;Draft Schematic Plans&#8221;). The Draft Schematic Plans shall &#13;&#10;contain sufficient information and detail to accurately describe the proposed design to Landlord &#13;&#10;and such other information as Landlord may reasonably request. Landlord shall notify Tenant in &#13;&#10;writing within five (5) business days after receipt of the Draft Schematic Plans whether Landlord &#13;&#10;approves or objects to the Draft Schematic Plans and of the manner, if any, in which the Draft &#13;&#10;Schematic Plans are unacceptable. Landlord&#8217;s failure to respond within such five (5) business &#13;&#10;day period shall be deemed approval by Landlord. If Landlord reasonably objects to the Draft &#13;&#10;Schematic Plans, then Tenant shall revise the Draft Schematic Plans and cause Landlord&#8217;s &#13;&#10;objections to be remedied in the revised Draft Schematic Plans. Tenant shall then resubmit the &#13;&#10;revised Draft Schematic Plans to Landlord for approval, such approval not to be unreasonably &#13;&#10;withheld, conditioned or delayed. Landlord&#8217;s approval of or objection to revised Draft &#13;&#10;Schematic Plans and Tenant&#8217;s correction of the same shall be in accordance with this Section &#13;&#10;until Landlord has approved the Draft Schematic Plans in writing or been deemed to have &#13;&#10;approved them. The iteration of the Draft Schematic Plans that is approved or deemed approved &#13;&#10;by Landlord without objection shall be referred to herein as the &#8220;Approved Schematic Plans.&#8221; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;2.2. Construction Plans. Tenant shall prepare final plans and specifications for the &#13;&#10;Tenant Improvements that (a) are consistent with and are logical evolutions of the Approved &#13;&#10;Schematic Plans and (b) incorporate any other Tenant-requested (and Landlord-approved) &#13;&#10;Changes (as defined below). As soon as such final plans and specifications (&#8220;Construction &#13;&#10;Plans&#8221;) are completed, Tenant shall deliver the same to Landlord for Landlord&#8217;s approval, which &#13;&#10;approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. All such Construction &#13;&#10;Plans shall be submitted by Tenant to Landlord in electronic .pdf, CADD and full-size hard copy &#13;&#10;formats, and shall be approved or disapproved by Landlord within ten (10) business days after &#13;&#10;delivery to Landlord. Landlord&#8217;s failure to respond within such ten (10) business day period &#13;&#10;shall be deemed approval by Landlord. If the Construction Plans are disapproved by Landlord &#13;&#10;(which disapproval shall be limited to items which are different from, or which are not logical &#13;&#10;evolutions of the Approved Schematic Plans), then Landlord shall notify Tenant in writing of its &#13;&#10;objections to such Construction Plans, and the parties shall confer and negotiate in good faith to &#13;&#10;reach agreement on the Construction Plans. At the same time as Tenant&#8217;s architect submits the &#13;&#10;Construction Plans to the City for approval, Tenant will submit two (2) copies of such &#13;&#10;Construction Plans to Landlord. In the event Landlord has any changes to the Construction &#13;&#10;Plans (as permitted under this Section), Tenant will cause the Construction Plans submitted to &#13;&#10;the City to be revised and resubmitted as required to incorporate such changes into the final &#13;&#10;Construction Plans. The Construction Plans so approved, and all change orders specifically &#13;&#10;permitted by this Work Letter, are referred to herein as the &#8220;Approved Plans.&#8221; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;2.3. Changes to the Tenant Improvements. Any changes to the Approved Plans (each, &#13;&#10;a &#8220;Change&#8221;) shall be requested and instituted in accordance with the provisions of this Article 2 &#13;&#10;and shall be subject to the written approval of the non-requesting party in accordance with this &#13;&#10;Work Letter. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(a) Change Request. Either Landlord or Tenant may request Changes after &#13;&#10;Landlord approves the Approved Plans by notifying the other party thereof in writing in &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	B-4 &#13;&#10;substantially the same form as the AIA standard change order form (a &#8220;Change Request&#8221;), which &#13;&#10;Change Request shall detail the nature and extent of any requested Changes, including (a) the &#13;&#10;Change, (b) the party required to perform the Change and (c) any modification of the Approved &#13;&#10;Plans and the Schedule, as applicable, necessitated by the Change. If the nature of a Change &#13;&#10;requires revisions to the Approved Plans, then the requesting party shall be solely responsible for &#13;&#10;the cost and expense of such revisions and any increases in the cost of the Tenant Improvements &#13;&#10;as a result of such Change. Change Requests shall be signed by the requesting party&#8217;s &#13;&#10;Authorized Representative. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(b) Approval of Changes. All Change Requests shall be subject to the other &#13;&#10;party&#8217;s prior written approval, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned &#13;&#10;or delayed. The non-requesting party shall have five (5) business days after receipt of a Change &#13;&#10;Request to notify the requesting party in writing of the non-requesting party&#8217;s decision either to &#13;&#10;approve or object to the Change Request. The non-requesting party&#8217;s failure to respond within &#13;&#10;such five (5) business day period shall be deemed approval by the non-requesting party. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;2.4. Preparation of Estimates. Tenant shall, before proceeding with any Change, using &#13;&#10;its best efforts, prepare as soon as is reasonably practicable (but in no event more than five (5) &#13;&#10;business days after delivering a Change Request to Landlord or receipt of a Change Request) an &#13;&#10;estimate of the increased costs or savings that would result from such Change, as well as an &#13;&#10;estimate of such Change&#8217;s effects on the Schedule. Landlord shall have five (5) business days &#13;&#10;after receipt of such information from Tenant to (a) in the case of a Tenant-initiated Change &#13;&#10;Request, approve or reject such Change Request in writing, or (b) in the case of a Landlord- &#13;&#10;initiated Change Request, notify Tenant in writing of Landlord&#8217;s decision either to proceed with &#13;&#10;or abandon the Landlord-initiated Change Request. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;2.5. Quality Control Program; Coordination. Tenant shall provide Landlord with &#13;&#10;information regarding the following (together, the &#8220;QCP&#8221;): (a) Tenant&#8217;s general contractor&#8217;s &#13;&#10;quality control program and (b) evidence of subsequent monitoring and action plans. The QCP &#13;&#10;shall be subject to Landlord&#8217;s reasonable review and approval and shall specifically address the &#13;&#10;Tenant Improvements. Tenant shall ensure that the QCP is regularly implemented on a &#13;&#10;scheduled basis and shall provide Landlord with reasonable prior notice and access to attend all &#13;&#10;inspections and meetings between Tenant and its general contractor. At the conclusion of the &#13;&#10;Tenant Improvements, Tenant shall deliver the quality control log to Landlord, which shall &#13;&#10;include all records of quality control meetings and testing and of inspections held in the field, &#13;&#10;including inspections relating to concrete, steel roofing, piping pressure testing and system &#13;&#10;commissioning. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3. Completion of Tenant Improvements. Tenant, at its sole cost and expense (except for the &#13;&#10;Base TI Allowance and, if properly requested by Tenant pursuant to the terms of the Lease, the &#13;&#10;Additional TI Allowance), shall perform and complete the Tenant Improvements in all respects &#13;&#10;(a) in substantial conformance with the Approved Plans, (b) otherwise in compliance with &#13;&#10;provisions of the Lease and this Work Letter and (c) in accordance with Applicable Laws, the &#13;&#10;requirements of Tenant&#8217;s insurance carriers, the requirements of Landlord&#8217;s insurance carriers &#13;&#10;(to the extent Landlord provides its insurance carriers&#8217; requirements to Tenant) and the board of &#13;&#10;fire underwriters having jurisdiction over the Premises. The Tenant Improvements shall be &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	B-5 &#13;&#10;deemed completed at such time as Tenant shall furnish to Landlord (t) evidence satisfactory to &#13;&#10;Landlord that (i) all Tenant Improvements have been completed and paid for in full (which shall &#13;&#10;be evidenced by the architect&#8217;s certificate of completion and the general contractor&#8217;s and each &#13;&#10;subcontractor&#8217;s and material supplier&#8217;s final unconditional waivers and releases of liens, each in &#13;&#10;a form acceptable to Landlord and complying with Applicable Laws, and a Certificate of &#13;&#10;Substantial Completion in the form of the American Institute of Architects document G704, &#13;&#10;executed by the project architect and the general contractor, together with a statutory notice of &#13;&#10;substantial completion from the general contractor), (ii) all Tenant Improvements have been &#13;&#10;accepted by Landlord, (iii) any and all liens related to the Tenant Improvements have either been &#13;&#10;discharged of record (by payment, bond, order of a court of competent jurisdiction or otherwise) &#13;&#10;or waived by the party filing such lien and (iv) no security interests relating to the Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements are outstanding, (u) all certifications and approvals with respect to the Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements that may be required from any Governmental Authority and any board of fire &#13;&#10;underwriters or similar body for the use and occupancy of the Premises (including a certificate of &#13;&#10;occupancy (or its substantial equivalent) for the Premises for the Permitted Use), (v) certificates &#13;&#10;of insurance required by the Lease to be purchased and maintained by Tenant, (w) an affidavit &#13;&#10;from Tenant&#8217;s architect certifying that all work performed in, on or about the Premises is in &#13;&#10;accordance with the Approved Plans, (x) complete &#8220;as built&#8221; drawing print sets, project &#13;&#10;specifications and shop drawings and electronic CADD files on disc (showing the Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements as an overlay on the Building &#8220;as built&#8221; plans (provided that Landlord provides &#13;&#10;the Building &#8220;as-built&#8221; plans provided to Tenant) of all contract documents for work performed &#13;&#10;by their architect and engineers in relation to the Tenant Improvements, (y) a commissioning &#13;&#10;report prepared by a licensed, qualified commissioning agent hired by Tenant and approved by &#13;&#10;Landlord for all new or affected mechanical, electrical and plumbing systems (which report &#13;&#10;Landlord may hire a licensed, qualified commissioning agent to peer review, and whose &#13;&#10;reasonable recommendations Tenant&#8217;s commissioning agent shall perform and incorporate into a &#13;&#10;revised report) and (z) such other &#8220;close out&#8221; materials as Landlord reasonably requests &#13;&#10;consistent with Landlord&#8217;s own requirements for its contractors or which are required by &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s lender, such as copies of manufacturers&#8217; warranties, operation and maintenance &#13;&#10;manuals and the like. In connection with Tenant&#8217;s performance of the Tenant Improvements, &#13;&#10;Tenant will keep a log for all of the following categories in connection with the Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements: change orders, requests for information and lien releases, and will keep and &#13;&#10;maintain a copy of the minutes from weekly construction meetings, a list of all subcontractors &#13;&#10;(including contract amounts) working on the Tenant Improvements, as well as an up to date &#13;&#10;Schedule and Approved Budget (as defined below) and will make the foregoing items available &#13;&#10;to Landlord as part of each Fund Request or as otherwise requested by Landlord. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4. Insurance. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4.1. Property Insurance. At all times during the period beginning with &#13;&#10;commencement of construction of the Tenant Improvements and ending with final completion of &#13;&#10;the Tenant Improvements, Tenant shall maintain, or cause to be maintained (in addition to the &#13;&#10;insurance required of Tenant pursuant to the Lease), property insurance naming Landlord and the &#13;&#10;Landlord Parties as additional insureds. Such policy shall, on a completed values basis for the &#13;&#10;full insurable value at all times, insure against loss or damage by fire, vandalism and malicious &#13;&#10;mischief and other such risks as are customarily covered by the so-called &#8220;broad form extended &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

</DIV>

<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN084.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 84" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	B-6 &#13;&#10;coverage endorsement&#8221; upon all Tenant Improvements and the general contractor&#8217;s and any &#13;&#10;subcontractors&#8217; machinery, tools and equipment, all while each forms a part of, or is contained &#13;&#10;in, the Tenant Improvements or any temporary structures on the Premises, or is adjacent thereto; &#13;&#10;provided that, for the avoidance of doubt, insurance coverage with respect to the general &#13;&#10;contractor&#8217;s and any subcontractors&#8217; machinery, tools and equipment shall be carried on a &#13;&#10;primary basis by such general contractor or the applicable subcontractor(s). Tenant agrees to &#13;&#10;pay any deductible, and Landlord is not responsible for any deductible, for a claim under such &#13;&#10;insurance. Such property insurance shall contain an express waiver of any right of subrogation &#13;&#10;by the insurer against Landlord and the Landlord Parties, and shall name Landlord and its &#13;&#10;affiliates as loss payees as their interests may appear. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4.2. Workers&#8217; Compensation Insurance. At all times during the period of construction &#13;&#10;of the Tenant Improvements, Tenant shall, or shall cause its contractors or subcontractors to, &#13;&#10;maintain statutory workers&#8217; compensation insurance as required by Applicable Laws. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;5. Liability. Tenant assumes sole responsibility and liability for any and all injuries or the &#13;&#10;death of any persons, including Tenant&#8217;s contractors and subcontractors and their respective &#13;&#10;employees, agents and invitees, and for any and all damages to property caused by, resulting &#13;&#10;from or arising out of any act or omission on the part of Tenant, Tenant&#8217;s contractors or &#13;&#10;subcontractors, or their respective employees, agents and invitees in the prosecution of the &#13;&#10;Tenant Improvements. Tenant agrees to Indemnify the Landlord Indemnitees from and against &#13;&#10;all Claims due to, because of or arising out of any and all such injuries, death or damage, &#13;&#10;whether real or alleged, and Tenant and Tenant&#8217;s contractors and subcontractors shall assume &#13;&#10;and defend at their sole cost and expense all such Claims; provided, however, that nothing &#13;&#10;contained in this Work Letter shall be deemed to Indemnify Landlord from or against liability &#13;&#10;caused by Landlord&#8217;s negligence or willful misconduct. Any deficiency in design or &#13;&#10;construction of the Tenant Improvements shall be solely the responsibility of Tenant, &#13;&#10;notwithstanding the fact that Landlord may have approved of the same in writing. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6. TI Allowance. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6.1. Application of TI Allowance. Landlord shall contribute, in the following order, &#13;&#10;the Base TI Allowance and, if properly requested by Tenant pursuant to the terms of the Lease, &#13;&#10;the Additional TI Allowance toward the costs and expenses incurred in connection with the &#13;&#10;performance of the Tenant Improvements, in accordance with Article 4 of the Lease. If the &#13;&#10;entire TI Allowance is not applied toward or reserved for the costs of the Tenant Improvements, &#13;&#10;then Tenant shall not be entitled to a credit of such unused portion of the TI Allowance. Tenant &#13;&#10;may apply the Base TI Allowance and, if properly requested by Tenant pursuant to the terms of &#13;&#10;the Lease, the Additional TI Allowance for the payment of construction and other costs in &#13;&#10;accordance with the terms and provisions of the Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6.2. Approval of Budget for the Tenant Improvements. Notwithstanding anything to &#13;&#10;the contrary set forth elsewhere in this Work Letter or the Lease, Landlord shall not have any &#13;&#10;obligation to expend any portion of the TI Allowance until Landlord and Tenant shall have &#13;&#10;approved in writing the budget for the Tenant Improvements (the &#8220;Approved Budget&#8221;). Prior to &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s approval of the Approved Budget, Tenant shall pay all of the costs and expenses &#13;&#10;incurred in connection with the Tenant Improvements as they become due. Landlord shall not be &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	B-7 &#13;&#10;obligated to reimburse Tenant for costs or expenses relating to the Tenant Improvements that &#13;&#10;exceed the amount of the TI Allowance. Landlord shall not unreasonably withhold, condition or &#13;&#10;delay its approval of any budget for Tenant Improvements that is proposed by Tenant. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6.3. Fund Requests. Upon submission by Tenant to Landlord (which submittals must &#13;&#10;be provided on or before the first (1st) day of each month starting in the first month that Tenant is &#13;&#10;eligible to request payment of the TI Allowance) of (a) a statement (a &#8220;Fund Request&#8221;) setting &#13;&#10;forth the total amount of the TI Allowance requested, (b) a summary of the Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements performed using AIA standard form Application for Payment (G 702) executed &#13;&#10;by the general contractor and by the architect, (c) invoices from the general contractor, the &#13;&#10;architect, and any subcontractors, material suppliers and other parties requesting payment with &#13;&#10;respect to the amount of the TI Allowance then being requested, (d) unconditional lien releases &#13;&#10;from the general contractor and each subcontractor and material supplier with respect to previous &#13;&#10;payments made by either Landlord or Tenant for the Tenant Improvements in a form acceptable &#13;&#10;to Landlord and complying with Applicable Laws, (e) conditional lien releases from the general &#13;&#10;contractor and each subcontractor and material supplier with respect to the Tenant Improvements &#13;&#10;performed that correspond to the Fund Request each in a form acceptable to Landlord and &#13;&#10;complying with Applicable Laws, (f) all information required by the last sentence of Section 3 &#13;&#10;above, (g) copies of all change orders issued in the applicable payment period, and (h) any other &#13;&#10;documentation required by Landlord&#8217;s lender as a condition to funding of loan proceeds, then &#13;&#10;Landlord shall, within thirty (30) days following receipt by Landlord of a Fund Request and the &#13;&#10;accompanying materials required by this Section, pay to (as elected by Landlord) the applicable &#13;&#10;contractors, subcontractors and material suppliers or Tenant (for reimbursement for payments &#13;&#10;made by Tenant to such contractors, subcontractors or material suppliers either prior to &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s approval of the Approved TI Budget or as a result of Tenant&#8217;s decision to pay for the &#13;&#10;Tenant Improvements itself and later seek reimbursement from Landlord in the form of one lump &#13;&#10;sum payment in accordance with the Lease and this Work Letter), the amount of Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvement costs set forth in such Fund Request; provided, however, that Landlord shall not be &#13;&#10;obligated to make any payments under this Section until the budget for the Tenant Improvements &#13;&#10;is approved in accordance with Section 6.2, and any Fund Request under this Section shall be &#13;&#10;subject to the payment limits set forth in Section 6.2 above and Article 4 of the Lease. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding anything in this Section to the contrary, Tenant shall not submit a Fund Request &#13;&#10;more often than every thirty (30) days and may not submit a Fund Request until the Clinical &#13;&#10;Trial Termination Option has expired or is void and of no further effect. Any additional Fund &#13;&#10;Requests submitted by Tenant shall be void and of no force or effect. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6.4. Accrual Information. In addition to the other requirements of this Section 6, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall, no later than the third (3rd) business day of each month until the Tenant &#13;&#10;Improvements are complete, provide Landlord with an estimate of (a) the percentage of design &#13;&#10;and other soft cost work that has been completed, (b) design and other soft costs spent through &#13;&#10;the end of the previous month, both from commencement of the Tenant Improvements and solely &#13;&#10;for the previous month, (c) the percentage of construction and other hard cost work that has been &#13;&#10;completed, (d) construction and other hard costs spent through the end of the previous month, &#13;&#10;both from commencement of the Tenant Improvements and solely for the previous month, and &#13;&#10;(e) the date of Substantial Completion of the Tenant Improvements. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	B-1-1 &#13;&#10;EXHIBIT B-1 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;TENANT WORK INSURANCE SCHEDULE &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Tenant shall be responsible for requiring all of Tenant contractors doing construction or &#13;&#10;renovation work to purchase and maintain such insurance as shall protect it from the claims set &#13;&#10;forth below which may arise out of or result from any Tenant Work whether such Tenant Work &#13;&#10;is completed by Tenant or by any Tenant contractors or by any person directly or indirectly &#13;&#10;employed by Tenant or any Tenant contractors, or by any person for whose acts Tenant or any &#13;&#10;Tenant contractors may be liable: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;1. Claims for damages because of bodily injury or death of any person or property damage &#13;&#10;arising out of the ownership, maintenance or use of any motor vehicle. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Tenant contractors&#8217; Commercial General Liability Insurance shall include &#13;&#10;premises/operations (including explosion, collapse and underground coverage if such Tenant &#13;&#10;Work involves any underground work), elevators, independent contractors, products and &#13;&#10;completed operations, and blanket contractual liability on all written contracts, all including &#13;&#10;broad form property damage coverage. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Tenant contractors&#8217; Commercial General, Automobile, Employers and Umbrella Liability &#13;&#10;Insurance shall be written for not less than limits of liability as follows: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;a. Commercial General Liability: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Bodily Injury and Property &#13;&#10;Damage &#13;&#10;Commercially reasonable amounts, but &#13;&#10;in any event no less than $1,000,000 per &#13;&#10;occurrence and $2,000,000 general &#13;&#10;aggregate, with $2,000,000 products and &#13;&#10;completed operations aggregate. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

Coverage for completed operations must be maintained for the lesser of ten (10) years &#13;&#10;and the applicable statue of repose following completion of the Tenant Work, and certificates &#13;&#10;evidencing this coverage must be provided to Landlord. The minimum A.M. Best&#8217;s rating of &#13;&#10;each insurer shall be A- VII. Landlord and its mortgagees shall be named as an additional &#13;&#10;insureds under Tenant contractors&#8217; Commercial General Liability, Commercial Automobile &#13;&#10;Liability and Umbrella Liability Insurance policies as respects liability arising from work or &#13;&#10;operations performed, or ownership, maintenance or use of autos, by or on behalf of such &#13;&#10;contractors. Each contractor and its insurers shall provide waivers of subrogation with respect to &#13;&#10;any claims covered or that should have been covered by valid and collectible insurance, &#13;&#10;including any deductibles or self-insurance maintained thereunder. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;If any contractor&#8217;s work involves the handling or removal of asbestos (as determined by &#13;&#10;Landlord in its sole and absolute discretion), such contractor shall also carry Pollution Legal &#13;&#10;Liability insurance. Such coverage shall include bodily injury, sickness, disease, death or mental &#13;&#10;anguish or shock sustained by any person; property damage, including physical injury to or &#13;&#10;destruction of tangible property (including the resulting loss of use thereof), clean-up costs and &#13;&#10;the loss of use of tangible property that has not been physically injured or destroyed; and defense &#13;&#10;costs, charges and expenses incurred in the investigation, adjustment or defense of claims for &#13;&#10;such damages. Coverage shall apply to both sudden and non-sudden pollution conditions &#13;&#10;including the discharge, dispersal, release or escape of smoke, vapors, soot, fumes, acids, alkalis, &#13;&#10;toxic chemicals, liquids or gases, waste materials or other irritants, contaminants or pollutants &#13;&#10;into or upon land, the atmosphere or any watercourse or body of water. Claims-made coverage &#13;&#10;is permitted, provided the policy retroactive date is continuously maintained prior to the Term &#13;&#10;Commencement Date, and coverage is continuously maintained during all periods in which &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

AS USED &#13;&#10;HEREIN, THE TERM &#8220;BUSINESS DAY&#8221; MEANS ANY DAY OTHER THAN A &#13;&#10;SATURDAY, SUNDAY, OR A DAY ON WHICH BANKS IN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS &#13;&#10;ARE AUTHORIZED OR REQUIRED TO BE CLOSED, AND A DAY ON WHICH &#13;&#10;PAYMENTS CAN BE EFFECTED ON THE FEDWIRE SYSTEM. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;LA JOLLA PHARMACEUTICAL-PREVET-JLM-2016 11-1688-CLEAN COPY &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	E-2 &#13;&#10;WE AUTHORIZE THE BENEFICIARY TO DRAW ON US FOR THE ACCOUNT OF &#13;&#10;[INSERT APPLICANT NAME], LOCATED AT: [INSERT APPLICANT ADDRESS] (THE &#13;&#10;&#8220;ACCOUNT PARTY&#8221;), UNDER THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THIS L/C. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;FUNDS UNDER THIS L/C ARE AVAILABLE BY PRESENTING THE FOLLOWING &#13;&#10;DOCUMENTATION (THE &#8220;DRAWING DOCUMENTATION&#8221;): (A) THE ORIGINAL L/C; &#13;&#10;AND (B) A SIGHT DRAFT COMPLETED IN THE FORM OF ATTACHMENT 1 TO THIS &#13;&#10;L/C, WITH BLANKS FILLED IN AND BRACKETED ITEMS PROVIDED AS &#13;&#10;APPROPRIATE. NO OTHER EVIDENCE OF AUTHORITY, CERTIFICATE, OR &#13;&#10;DOCUMENTATION IS REQUIRED. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;DRAWING DOCUMENTATION MUST BE PRESENTED AT THE ISSUING &#13;&#10;BANK&#8217;S OFFICE AT: 131 SOUTH DEARBORN, 5TH FLOOR, MAIL CODE: IL1-0236, &#13;&#10;CHICAGO, ILLINOIS, 60603-5506, ATTENTION: STANDBY LETTER OF CREDIT UNIT &#13;&#10;ON OR BEFORE THE EXPIRATION DATE BY CERTIFIED MAIL, PERSONAL &#13;&#10;PRESENTATION, COURIER OR MESSENGER SERVICE. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING HEREIN TO THE CONTRARY, DRAWINGS &#13;&#10;PRESENTED BY TELECOPY (&quot;FAX&quot;) TO FAX NUMBER 312-233- , OR &#13;&#10;ALTERNATELY TO FAX NUMBER 312-233- ARE ACCEPTABLE, UNDER &#13;&#10;TELEPHONE PRE-ADVICE TO 312-385- , OR ALTERNATELY TO 1-800-634-1969, &#13;&#10;PROVIDED THAT SUCH FAX PRESENTATION IS RECEIVED ON OR BEFORE THE &#13;&#10;EXPIRATION DATE ON THIS L/C IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS AND &#13;&#10;CONDITIONS OF THIS L/C, IT BEING UNDERSTOOD THAT ANY SUCH FAX &#13;&#10;PRESENTATION SHALL BE CONSIDERED THE SOLE OPERATIVE INSTRUMENT OF &#13;&#10;DRAWING. IN THE EVENT OF PRESENTATION BY FAX, THE ORIGINAL &#13;&#10;DOCUMENTS SHOULD NOT ALSO BE PRESENTED. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;WE ENGAGE WITH YOU THAT DOCUMENTS PRESENTED UNDER AND IN &#13;&#10;COMPLIANCE WITH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THIS L/C WILL BE DULY &#13;&#10;HONORED ON PRESENTATION IF PRESENTED AT THE OFFICES OF THE ISSUING &#13;&#10;BANK LOCATED AT: 131 SOUTH DEARBORN, 5TH FLOOR, MAIL CODE IL1-0236, &#13;&#10;CHICAGO, ILLINOIS 60603-5506, ATTENTION: STANDBY LETTER OF CREDIT UNIT, &#13;&#10;ON OR BEFORE THE EXPIRATION DATE OF THIS L/C. ALL PAYMENTS DUE &#13;&#10;HEREUNDER SHALL BE MADE BY WIRE TRANSFER TO THE BENEFICIARY&#8217;S &#13;&#10;ACCOUNT PER THEIR INSTRUCTIONS. ALL DOCUMENTS PRESENTED MUST BE IN &#13;&#10;ENGLISH. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;IF BENEFICIARY PRESENTS PROPER DRAWING DOCUMENTATION TO US ON &#13;&#10;OR BEFORE THE EXPIRATION DATE, THEN WE SHALL PAY UNDER THIS L/C AT OR &#13;&#10;BEFORE THE FOLLOWING TIME (THE &#8220;PAYMENT DEADLINE&#8221;): (A) IF &#13;&#10;PRESENTMENT IS MADE AT OR BEFORE 12.00 NOON (CHICAGO TIME) ON ANY &#13;&#10;BUSINESS DAY, THEN PAYMENT SHALL BE MADE ON THE 3RD (THIRD) BUSINESS &#13;&#10;DAY; AND (B) IF PRESENTMENT IS MADE AFTER 12.00 NOON (CHICAGO TIME) ON &#13;&#10;ANY BUSINESS DAY, THEN PAYMENT SHALL BE MADE ON THE 4TH (FOURTH) &#13;&#10;BUSINESS DAY. IF WE DETERMINE THAT DRAWING DOCUMENTATION DOES NOT &#13;&#10;CONFIRM TO THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE L/C, WE SHALL SEND THE &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	E-3 &#13;&#10;BENEFICIARY NOTICE IN WRITING, THAT THE DEMAND FOR PAYMENT WAS NOT &#13;&#10;EFFECTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS OF THE L/C, STATING THE &#13;&#10;REASONS THEREFOR AND THAT WE SHALL RETURN THE DRAWING &#13;&#10;DOCUMENTATION TO THE BENEFICIARY. UPON BEING NOTIFIED THAT THE &#13;&#10;DEMAND FOR PAYMENT WAS NOT EFFECTED IN CONFORMITY WITH THIS L/C, &#13;&#10;THE BENEFICIARY MAY ATTEMPT TO CORRECT ANY SUCH NON-CONFORMING &#13;&#10;DEMAND FOR PAYMENT TO THE EXTENT THAT THE BENEFICIARY IS ENTITLED &#13;&#10;TO DO SO AND WITHIN THE THEN CURRENT EXPIRATION DATE OF THIS L/C. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;PARTIAL DRAWINGS ARE PERMITTED. EXCEPT WHEN THE AMOUNT OF THE &#13;&#10;DRAWING FULLY UTILIZES THIS LETTER OF CREDIT, WE UNDERTAKE TO RETURN &#13;&#10;THE ORIGINAL L/C TO YOU WITH THE AMOUNT OF THE PAYMENT ENDORSED &#13;&#10;THEREON. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;IT IS A CONDITION OF THIS L/C THAT THE EXPIRATION DATE SHALL BE &#13;&#10;AUTOMATICALLY EXTENDED WITHOUT AMENDMENT FOR 1 (ONE) YEAR FROM &#13;&#10;THE EXPIRATION DATE HEREOF OR ANY FUTURE EXPIRATION DATE UNLESS AT &#13;&#10;LEAST 90 (NINETY) DAYS PRIOR TO SUCH EXPIRATION DATE WE SEND NOTICE &#13;&#10;TO YOU BY CERTIFIED MAIL OR HAND DELIVERED COURIER, AT THE ADDRESS &#13;&#10;STATED ABOVE, THAT WE ELECT NOT TO EXTEND THIS L/C FOR ANY SUCH &#13;&#10;ADDITIONAL PERIOD. HOWEVER IN NO EVENT SHALL THIS L/C BE &#13;&#10;AUTOMATICALLY EXTENDED BEYOND [INSERT FINAL EXPIRATION DATE] (THE &#13;&#10;&#8220;FINAL EXPIRATION DATE&#8221;). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;THIS L/C IS TRANSFERABLE, BUT ONLY IN ITS ENTIRETY, AND MAY BE &#13;&#10;SUCCESSIVELY TRANSFERRED. TRANSFER OF THIS L/C SHALL BE EFFECTED BY &#13;&#10;US UPON YOUR SUBMISSION OF THIS ORIGINAL LETTER OF CREDIT, INCLUDING &#13;&#10;ALL AMENDMENTS, IF ANY, ACCOMPANIED BY OUR TRANSFER REQUEST FORM &#13;&#10;DULY COMPLETED AND SIGNED, WITH THE SIGNATURE THEREON &#13;&#10;AUTHENTICATED BY YOUR BANK. CHARGES AND FEES RELATED TO THE &#13;&#10;TRANSFER OF THIS L/C WILL BE FOR THE ACCOUNT OF THE APPLICANT. IF YOU &#13;&#10;WISH TO TRANSFER THE L/C, PLEASE CONTACT US FOR THE FORM WHICH WE &#13;&#10;SHALL PROVIDE TO YOU UPON YOUR REQUEST. IN ANY EVENT, THIS L/C MAY &#13;&#10;NOT BE TRANSFERRED TO ANY PERSON OR ENTITY LISTED IN OR OTHERWISE &#13;&#10;SUBJECT TO, ANY SANCTION OR EMBARGO UNDER ANY APPLICABLE &#13;&#10;RESTRICTIONS. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;ALL AMENDMENTS UNDER THIS LETTER OF CREDIT ARE SUBJECT TO THE &#13;&#10;BENEFICIARY&#39;S AGREEMENT. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;THIS L/C IS GOVERNED BY, AND CONSTRUED IN ACCORDANCE WITH &#13;&#10;THE LAWS OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, AND, EXCEPT AS OTHERWISE &#13;&#10;EXPRESSLY STATED HEREIN, TO THE INTERNATIONAL STANDBY PRACTICES, &#13;&#10;ICC PUBLICATION NO. 590 (THE &#8220;ISP98&#8221;), AND IN THE EVENT OF ANY &#13;&#10;CONFLICT, THE LAWS OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK WILL CONTROL, &#13;&#10;WITHOUT REGARD TO PRINCIPLES OF CONFLICT OF LAWS. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN100.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 100" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;EXHIBIT F &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;RULES AND REGULATIONS &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;NOTHING IN THESE RULES AND REGULATIONS (&#8220;RULES AND &#13;&#10;REGULATIONS&#8221;) SHALL SUPPLANT ANY PROVISION OF THE LEASE. IN THE &#13;&#10;EVENT OF A CONFLICT OR INCONSISTENCY BETWEEN THESE RULES AND &#13;&#10;REGULATIONS AND THE LEASE, THE LEASE SHALL PREVAIL. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;1. No Tenant Party shall encumber or obstruct the common entrances, lobbies, elevators, &#13;&#10;sidewalks and stairways of the Project or use them for any purposes other than ingress or egress &#13;&#10;to and from the Building(s) or the Project. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;2. Except as specifically provided in the Lease, no sign, placard, picture, advertisement, &#13;&#10;name or notice shall be installed or displayed on any part of the outside of the Building(s) &#13;&#10;without Landlord&#8217;s prior written consent. Landlord shall have the right to remove, at Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;sole cost and expense and without notice, any sign installed or displayed in violation of this rule. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3. If Landlord objects in writing to any curtains, blinds, shades, screens, hanging plants or &#13;&#10;other similar objects attached to or used in connection with any window or door of the Premises &#13;&#10;or placed on any windowsill, and (a) such window, door or windowsill is visible from the &#13;&#10;exterior of the Premises and (b) such curtain, blind, shade, screen, hanging plant or other object &#13;&#10;is not included in plans approved by Landlord, then Tenant shall promptly remove such curtains, &#13;&#10;blinds, shades, screens, hanging plants or other similar objects at its sole cost and expense. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4. Tenant shall not place a load upon any floor of the Premises that exceeds the load per &#13;&#10;square foot that (a) such floor was designed to carry or (b) is allowed by Applicable Laws. &#13;&#10;Fixtures and equipment that cause noises or vibrations that may be transmitted to the structure of &#13;&#10;the Building(s) to such a degree as to be objectionable to other tenants shall be placed and &#13;&#10;maintained by Tenant, at Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense, on vibration eliminators or other &#13;&#10;devices sufficient to eliminate such noises and vibrations to levels reasonably acceptable to &#13;&#10;Landlord and the affected tenants of the Project. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;5. Tenant shall not install any radio, television or other antennae; cell or other &#13;&#10;communications equipment; or other devices on the roof or exterior walls of the Premises except &#13;&#10;in accordance with the Lease. Tenant shall not interfere with radio, television or other digital or &#13;&#10;electronic communications at the Project or elsewhere. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6. Canvassing, peddling, soliciting and distributing handbills or any other written material &#13;&#10;within, on or around the Project (other than within the Premises) are prohibited. Tenant shall &#13;&#10;cooperate with Landlord to prevent such activities by any Tenant Party. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;7. Tenant shall store all of its trash, garbage and Hazardous Materials in receptacles within &#13;&#10;its Premises or in receptacles designated by Landlord outside of the Premises. Tenant shall not &#13;&#10;place in any such receptacle any material that cannot be disposed of in the ordinary and &#13;&#10;customary manner of trash, garbage and Hazardous Materials disposal. Any Hazardous &#13;&#10;Materials transported through Common Area shall be held in secondary containment devices. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;F-1 &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage160"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0101 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN101.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 101" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	F-2 &#13;&#10;Tenant shall be responsible, at its sole cost and expense, for Tenant&#8217;s removal of its trash, &#13;&#10;garbage and Hazardous Materials. Tenant is encouraged to participate in the waste removal and &#13;&#10;recycling program in place at the Project. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;8. The Premises shall not be used for lodging or for any improper, immoral or objectionable &#13;&#10;purpose. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;9. Tenant shall not, without Landlord&#8217;s prior written consent, use the name of the Project, if &#13;&#10;any, in connection with or in promoting or advertising Tenant&#8217;s business except as Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;address. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;10. Tenant shall comply with all safety, fire protection and evacuation procedures and &#13;&#10;regulations established by Landlord or any Governmental Authority. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;11. Tenant assumes any and all responsibility for protecting the Premises from theft, robbery &#13;&#10;and pilferage, which responsibility includes keeping doors locked and other means of entry to &#13;&#10;the Premises closed. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;12. Tenant shall not modify any locks to the Premises without Landlord&#8217;s prior written &#13;&#10;consent, which consent Landlord shall not unreasonably withhold, condition or delay. Tenant &#13;&#10;shall furnish Landlord with copies of keys, pass cards or similar devices for locks to the &#13;&#10;Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;13. Tenant shall cooperate and participate in all reasonable security programs affecting the &#13;&#10;Premises. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;14. Tenant shall not permit any animals in the Project, other than for service animals or for &#13;&#10;use in laboratory experiments. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;15. The water and wash closets and other plumbing fixtures shall not be used for any &#13;&#10;purposes other than those for which they were constructed, and no sweepings, rubbish, rags or &#13;&#10;other substances shall be deposited therein. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;16. Discharge of industrial sewage shall only be permitted if Tenant, at its sole expense, first &#13;&#10;obtains all necessary permits and licenses therefor from all applicable Governmental Authorities. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;17. Smoking is prohibited inside the Building, except in designated outdoor areas of the &#13;&#10;Project (if any). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;18. The Project&#8217;s hours of operation are currently 24 hours a day seven days a week. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;19. Tenant shall comply with all orders, requirements and conditions now or hereafter &#13;&#10;imposed by Applicable Laws or Landlord (&#8220;Waste Regulations&#8221;) regarding the collection, &#13;&#10;sorting, separation and recycling of waste products, garbage, refuse and trash generated by &#13;&#10;Tenant (collectively, &#8220;Waste Products&#8221;), including (without limitation) the separation of Waste &#13;&#10;Products into receptacles reasonably approved by Landlord and the removal of such receptacles &#13;&#10;in accordance with any collection schedules prescribed by Waste Regulations. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage161"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;

<!-- SLIDE 0102 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN102.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 102" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	F-3 &#13;&#10;20. Tenant, at Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense, shall cause the Premises to be exterminated on &#13;&#10;a monthly basis to Landlord&#8217;s reasonable satisfaction and shall cause all portions of the Premises &#13;&#10;used for the storage, preparation, service or consumption of food or beverages to be cleaned &#13;&#10;daily in a manner reasonably satisfactory to Landlord, and to be treated against infestation by &#13;&#10;insects, rodents and other vermin and pests whenever there is evidence of any infestation. &#13;&#10;Tenant shall not permit any person to enter the Premises or the Project for the purpose of &#13;&#10;providing such extermination services, unless such persons have been approved by Landlord. If &#13;&#10;requested by Landlord, Tenant shall, at Tenant&#8217;s sole cost and expense, store any refuse &#13;&#10;generated in the Premises by the consumption of food or beverages in a cold box or similar &#13;&#10;facility. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;21. If Tenant desires to use any portion of the Common Area for a Tenant-related event, &#13;&#10;Tenant must notify Landlord in writing at least thirty (30) days prior to such event on the form &#13;&#10;attached as Attachment 1 to this Exhibit, which use shall be subject to Landlord&#8217;s prior written &#13;&#10;consent, not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. Notwithstanding anything in &#13;&#10;this Lease or the completed and executed Attachment to the contrary, Tenant shall be solely &#13;&#10;responsible for setting up and taking down any equipment or other materials required for the &#13;&#10;event, and shall promptly pick up any litter and report any property damage to Landlord related &#13;&#10;to the event. Any use of the Common Area pursuant to this Section shall be subject to the &#13;&#10;provisions of Article 28 of the Lease. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Landlord may waive any one or more of these Rules and Regulations for the benefit of &#13;&#10;Tenant or any other tenant, but no such waiver by Landlord shall be construed as a waiver of &#13;&#10;such Rules and Regulations in favor of Tenant or any other tenant, nor prevent Landlord from &#13;&#10;thereafter enforcing any such Rules and Regulations against any or all of the tenants of the &#13;&#10;Project, including Tenant. These Rules and Regulations are in addition to, and shall not be &#13;&#10;construed to in any way modify or amend, in whole or in part, the terms covenants, agreements &#13;&#10;and conditions of the Lease. Landlord reserves the right to make such other and reasonable &#13;&#10;additional rules and regulations as, in its judgment, may from time to time be needed for safety &#13;&#10;and security, the care and cleanliness of the Project, or the preservation of good order therein; &#13;&#10;provided, however, that Tenant shall not be obligated to adhere to such additional rules or &#13;&#10;regulations until Landlord has provided Tenant with written notice thereof. Tenant agrees to &#13;&#10;abide by these Rules and Regulations and any such additional rules and regulations issued or &#13;&#10;adopted by Landlord. Tenant shall be responsible for the observance of these Rules and &#13;&#10;Regulations by all Tenant Parties. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

	K-1- &#13;&#10;EXHIBIT K &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;ROOFTOP LICENSE &#13;&#10;Landlord hereby grants to Tenant a license (&#8220;Rooftop License&#8221;), which Rooftop License &#13;&#10;shall be at no additional cost of expense to Tenant, to use portions of the rooftop of the Building &#13;&#10;identified by Landlord from time to time as &#8220;Rooftop Installation Area&#8221; (the &#8220;Rooftop &#13;&#10;Installation Area&#8221;) solely to operate, maintain, repair and replace rooftop antennae, mechanical &#13;&#10;equipment, communications antennas and other equipment installed by Tenant in the Rooftop &#13;&#10;Installation Area in accordance with this Article (&#8220;Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment&#8221;). Tenant&#8217;s &#13;&#10;Rooftop Equipment shall be only for Tenant&#8217;s use of the Premises for the Permitted Use. &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, Tenant&#8217;s rights under this Exhibit K shall be subject &#13;&#10;and subordinate to the rights granted to Global in the Rooftop Lease. All capitalized terms used &#13;&#10;herein and not otherwise defined shall have the meanings ascribed to them in the Lease to which &#13;&#10;this Exhibit K is attached. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Tenant shall install Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment at its sole cost and expense, at such &#13;&#10;times and in such manner as Landlord may reasonably designate, and in accordance with this &#13;&#10;Exhibit and the applicable provisions of the Lease regarding Alterations. Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop &#13;&#10;Equipment and the installation thereof shall be subject to Landlord&#8217;s prior written approval, &#13;&#10;which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld. Among other reasons, Landlord may &#13;&#10;withhold approval if the installation or operation of Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment could &#13;&#10;reasonably be expected to damage the structural integrity of the Building or to transmit &#13;&#10;vibrations or noise or cause other adverse effects beyond the Premises to an extent not customary &#13;&#10;in first class laboratory buildings, unless Tenant implements measures that are acceptable to &#13;&#10;Landlord in its reasonable discretion to avoid any such damage or transmission. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Tenant shall comply with any roof or roof-related warranties. Tenant shall obtain a letter &#13;&#10;from Landlord&#8217;s roofing contractor within thirty (30) days after completion of any Tenant work &#13;&#10;on the rooftop stating that such work did not affect any such warranties. Tenant, at its sole cost &#13;&#10;and expense, shall inspect the Rooftop Installation Area at least annually, and correct any loose &#13;&#10;bolts, fittings or other appurtenances and repair any damage to the roof caused by the installation &#13;&#10;or operation of Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment. Tenant shall not permit the installation, &#13;&#10;maintenance or operation of Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment to violate any Applicable Laws or &#13;&#10;constitute a nuisance. Tenant shall pay Landlord within thirty (30) days after demand (a) all &#13;&#10;applicable taxes, charges, fees or impositions imposed on Landlord by governmental authorities &#13;&#10;as the result of Tenant&#8217;s use of the Rooftop Installation Areas in excess of those for which &#13;&#10;Landlord would otherwise be responsible for the use or installation of Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop &#13;&#10;Equipment and (b) the amount of any increase in Landlord&#8217;s insurance premiums as a result of &#13;&#10;the installation of Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment. Upon Tenant&#8217;s written request to Landlord, &#13;&#10;Landlord shall use commercially reasonable efforts to cause other tenants to remedy any &#13;&#10;interference in the operation of Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment caused by any such tenants&#8217; &#13;&#10;equipment installed after the applicable piece of Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment; provided, &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	K-2- &#13;&#10;however, that Landlord shall not be required to request that such tenants waive their rights under &#13;&#10;their respective leases. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;If Tenant&#8217;s Equipment (a) causes physical damage to the structural integrity of the &#13;&#10;Building, (b) interferes with any telecommunications, mechanical or other systems located at or &#13;&#10;near or servicing the Building or the Project that were installed prior to the installation of &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment, (c) interferes with any other service provided to other tenants in &#13;&#10;the Building or the Project by rooftop or penthouse installations that were installed prior to the &#13;&#10;installation of Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment or (d) interferes with any other tenants&#8217; business, in &#13;&#10;each case in excess of that permissible under Federal Communications Commission regulations, &#13;&#10;then Tenant shall cooperate with Landlord to determine the source of the damage or interference &#13;&#10;and promptly repair such damage and eliminate such interference, in each case at Tenant&#8217;s sole &#13;&#10;cost and expense, within ten (10) business days after receipt of notice (which notice may be oral; &#13;&#10;provided that Landlord also delivers to Tenant written notice of such damage or interference &#13;&#10;within twenty-four (24) hours after providing oral notice) of such damage or interference, or &#13;&#10;within a reasonable time if such cannot be accomplished within ten (10) business days so long as &#13;&#10;Tenant diligently and continuously prosecutes such cure to completion. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Landlord reserves the right to cause Tenant to relocate Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment to &#13;&#10;comparably functional space on the roof or in the penthouse of the Building by giving Tenant &#13;&#10;prior written notice thereof. Landlord agrees to pay the reasonable costs thereof. Tenant shall &#13;&#10;arrange for the relocation of Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment within sixty (60) days after receipt of &#13;&#10;Landlord&#8217;s notification of such relocation. In the event Tenant fails to arrange for relocation &#13;&#10;within such sixty (60)-day period, Landlord shall have the right to arrange for the relocation of &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s Rooftop Equipment in a manner that does not unnecessarily interrupt or interfere with &#13;&#10;Tenant&#8217;s use of the Premises for the Permitted Use. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Exhibit, Tenant shall, prior to &#13;&#10;commencing any work on the rooftop of the Building, give Landlord at least thirty days (30) &#13;&#10;days&#8217; prior written notice. &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;EXHIBIT M &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;FORM SUBORDINATION, NON-DISTURBANCE AND ATTORNMENT AGREEMENT &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;RECORDING REQUESTED BY &#13;&#10;AND WHEN RECORDED MAIL TO: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Eric F. Allendorf, Esq. &#13;&#10;Paul Hastings LLP &#13;&#10;200 Park Avenue &#13;&#10;New York, New York 10166 &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;(Space Above For Recorder&#8217;s Use) &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;SUBORDINATION AGREEMENT, ACKNOWLEDGMENT OF LEASE ASSIGNMENT, ATTORNMENT &#13;&#10;AND NON-DISTURBANCE AGREEMENT &#13;&#10;(Lease to Security Instrument) &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;NOTICE: THIS SUBORDINATION AGREEMENT RESULTS IN YOUR SECURITY INTEREST IN &#13;&#10;THE PROPERTY BECOMING SUBJECT TO AND OF LOWER PRIORITY THAN THE &#13;&#10;LIEN OF SOME OTHER OR LATER SECURITY INSTRUMENT. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;THIS SUBORDINATION AGREEMENT, ACKNOWLEDGMENT OF LEASE ASSIGNMENT, ATTORNMENT &#13;&#10;AND NON-DISTURBANCE AGREEMENT (&#8220;Agreement&#8221;) is made this day of , 2016 by and among &#13;&#10;BMR-Axiom LP, a Delaware limited partnership, owner of the real property hereinafter described (&#8220;Mortgagor&#8221;), &#13;&#10;La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company, a California corporation (&#8220;Tenant&#8221;), AB Commercial Real Estate Debt &#8211; B2 &#13;&#10;S.&#193;.R.L., a Luxembourg private company with limited liability, as administrative agent for certain lenders party to &#13;&#10;the Loan Agreement (defined below), and their respective successors and assigns (&#8220;Lender&#8221;). &#13;&#10;R E C I T A L S &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;1. Pursuant to the terms and provisions of the unrecorded lease dated December , 2016 (&#8220;Lease&#8221;), Tenant &#13;&#10;holds a leasehold estate in and to a portion of the property described in the Lease (which property, together &#13;&#10;with all improvements now or hereafter located on the property, is defined as the &#8220;Property&#8221;, as more &#13;&#10;particularly described on Exhibit A attached hereto). &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;2. Mortgagor has executed that certain Loan Agreement, dated as of the date hereof, by and among &#13;&#10;Mortgagor, Lender and certain other parties thereto (as the same may be amended, restated and/or replaced &#13;&#10;from time to time, the &#8220;Loan Agreement&#8221;) and that certain Security Instrument (as defined in the Loan &#13;&#10;Agreement) encumbering the Property and otherwise securing, among other things, those certain Notes (as &#13;&#10;defined in the Loan Agreement) in favor of the Lender (&#8220;Loan&#8221;). The Security Instrument is being &#13;&#10;recorded in the real property records where the Property is located. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3. As a condition to Lender making the Loan secured by the Security Instrument, Lender requires that the &#13;&#10;Security Instrument be unconditionally and at all times remain a lien on the Property, prior and superior to &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage173"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0114 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN114.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 114" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;all the rights of Tenant under the Lease and that the Tenant specifically and unconditionally subordinate &#13;&#10;the Lease to the lien of the Security Instrument. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4. Mortgagor and Tenant have agreed to the subordination, attornment and other agreements herein in favor &#13;&#10;of Lender. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;NOW THEREFORE, for valuable consideration and to induce Lender to make the Loan, Mortgagor and Tenant &#13;&#10;hereby agree for the benefit of Lender as follows: &#13;&#10;1. SUBORDINATION. Mortgagor and Tenant hereby agree that: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;a) Prior Lien. The Security Instrument securing the Note in favor of Lender and any modifications, &#13;&#10;renewals or extensions thereof (including, without limitation, any modifications, renewals or &#13;&#10;extensions with respect to any additional advances made subject to the Security Instrument), shall &#13;&#10;unconditionally be and at all times remain a lien on the Property prior and superior to the Lease &#13;&#10;(including, without limitation, any amendments, modifications, renewals or extensions thereof); &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;b) Whole Agreement. This Agreement shall be the whole agreement and only agreement with &#13;&#10;regard to the subordination of the Lease to the lien of the Security Instrument and shall supersede &#13;&#10;and cancel, but only insofar as would affect the priority between the Security Instrument and the &#13;&#10;Lease, any prior agreements as to such subordination, including, without limitation, those &#13;&#10;provisions, if any, contained in the Lease which provide for the subordination of the Lease to a &#13;&#10;deed or deeds of trust or to a mortgage or mortgages. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;AND FURTHER, Tenant individually declares, agrees and acknowledges for the benefit of Lender that: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;c) Use of Proceeds. Lender, in making disbursements pursuant to the Note, the Security Instrument &#13;&#10;or any loan agreements with respect to the Property, is under no obligation or duty to, nor has &#13;&#10;Lender represented that it will, see to the application of such proceeds by the person or persons to &#13;&#10;whom Lender disburses such proceeds, and any application or use of such proceeds for purposes &#13;&#10;other than those provided for in such agreement or agreements shall not defeat this agreement to &#13;&#10;subordinate in whole or in part; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;d) Subordination. Tenant intentionally and unconditionally waives, relinquishes and subordinates &#13;&#10;all of Tenant&#8217;s right, title and interest in and to the Property to the lien of the Security Instrument &#13;&#10;and understands that in reliance upon, and in consideration of, this subordination, specific loans &#13;&#10;and advances are being and will be made by Lender and, as part and parcel thereof, specific &#13;&#10;monetary and other obligations are being and will be entered into which would not be made or &#13;&#10;entered into but for said reliance upon this waiver, relinquishment and subordination. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;2. ASSIGNMENT. Tenant acknowledges and consents to the assignment of the Lease by Mortgagor in &#13;&#10;favor of Lender. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;3. ADDITIONAL AGREEMENTS. Tenant covenants and agrees that, during all such times as the Loan is &#13;&#10;outstanding: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;a) Notice of Default. Tenant will notify Lender in writing concurrently with any notice given to &#13;&#10;Mortgagor of any default by Mortgagor under the Lease, and Tenant agrees that Lender has the &#13;&#10;right (but not the obligation) to cure any breach or default specified in such notice within the time &#13;&#10;periods set forth below and Tenant will not declare a default of the Lease, as to Lender, or &#13;&#10;terminate the Lease if Lender cures such default within thirty (30) days from and after the &#13;&#10;expiration of the time period provided in the Lease for the cure thereof by Mortgagor; provided, &#13;&#10;however, that if such default cannot with diligence be cured by Lender within such thirty (30) day &#13;&#10;period, the commencement of action by Lender within such thirty (30) day period to remedy the &#13;&#10;same shall be deemed sufficient so long as Lender pursues such cure with diligence. Further, &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage174"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0115 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN115.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 115" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;Tenant shall not terminate the Lease on the basis of any default by Landlord which is incurable by &#13;&#10;Lender (such as, for example, the bankruptcy of Landlord or breach of any representation by &#13;&#10;Landlord), provided Lender is proceeding with due diligence to commence an action to appoint a &#13;&#10;receiver or to obtain title to the Property by foreclosure, deed in lieu of foreclosure, or otherwise &#13;&#10;(collectively, &#8220;Foreclosure&#8221;). Tenant hereby agrees that no action taken by Lender to enforce &#13;&#10;any rights under the Security Instrument or related security documents, by reason of any default &#13;&#10;thereunder (including, without limitation, the appointment of a receiver, any Foreclosure or any &#13;&#10;demand for rent under any assignment of rents or leases) shall give rise to any right of Tenant to &#13;&#10;terminate the Lease, nor shall such action invalidate or constitute a breach of any of the terms of &#13;&#10;the Lease; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;b) No Advance Rents. Other than the payment of a security deposit as required under the Lease, &#13;&#10;Tenant will make no payments or prepayments of rent more than one (1) month in advance of the &#13;&#10;time when the same become due under the Lease; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;c) Assignment of Rents. Upon receipt by Tenant of written notice directing the payment of rents by &#13;&#10;Tenant to Lender, Tenant shall comply with such direction to pay such rents (including, without &#13;&#10;limitation, any termination fees or other similar payments, including, without limitation, the &#13;&#10;Clinical Trial Termination Fee (as defined in the Lease) and the Acquisition Termination Fee (as &#13;&#10;defined in the Lease)) to Lender, and Mortgagor hereby acknowledges that Tenant shall be &#13;&#10;entitled to rely upon any such direction received from Lender. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;d) Notice with Respect to Hazardous Materials. Tenant will deliver to Lender any notice or other &#13;&#10;deliverable given to Mortgagor pursuant to the terms and provisions of Section 21.2 of the Lease &#13;&#10;concurrently with the delivery of the same to Mortgagor. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;4. ATTORNMENT. In the event of a foreclosure under the Security Instrument, Tenant agrees for the &#13;&#10;benefit of Lender (including any transferee of Lender or any transferee of Mortgagor&#8217;s title in and to the &#13;&#10;Property by Lender or the Lender&#8217;s exercise of the remedy of sale by foreclosure under the Security &#13;&#10;Instrument (in each case, a &#8220;Successor Owner&#8221;) as follows: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;a) Payment of Rent. Tenant shall pay to Lender all rental payments required to be made by Tenant &#13;&#10;pursuant to the terms of the Lease for the duration of the term of the Lease; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;b) Continuation of Performance. Tenant shall be bound to Lender in accordance with all of the &#13;&#10;provisions of the Lease for the balance of the term thereof, and Tenant hereby attorns to Lender as &#13;&#10;its landlord, such attornment to be effective and self-operative without the execution of any &#13;&#10;further instrument immediately upon Lender succeeding to Mortgagor&#8217;s interest in the Lease and &#13;&#10;giving written notice thereof to Tenant; and &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;c) No Offset. Lender shall not be liable, nor subject to any offsets or defenses which Tenant may &#13;&#10;have by reason of any act or omission of Mortgagor under the Lease, nor for the return of any &#13;&#10;sums which Tenant may have paid to Mortgagor under the Lease as and for security deposits, &#13;&#10;advance rentals or otherwise, except to the extent that such sums are actually delivered by &#13;&#10;Mortgagor to Lender. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;d) Landlord Liability. Nothing in this Agreement shall impose upon Lender any liability for the &#13;&#10;obligations of Landlord under the Lease unless and until Lender takes title to the Property; &#13;&#10;provided, however, the foregoing shall not limit Successor Owner&#8217;s obligations under the Lease to &#13;&#10;correct any conditions of a continuing nature that (i) existed as of the date of Successor Owner &#13;&#10;shall become owner of the Property and (ii) violate Successor Owner&#8217;s obligations as landlord &#13;&#10;under the Lease; provided that Successor Owner shall have received written notice of such &#13;&#10;omissions, conditions or violations from Tenant and has had a reasonable opportunity to cure the &#13;&#10;same. Anything herein or in the Lease to the contrary notwithstanding, in the event that a &#13;&#10;Successor Owner shall acquire title to the Property or the portion thereof containing the Premises, &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P>
<A NAME="eolPage175"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SLIDE 0116 -->
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-TOP:2EM;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0000920465-17-000025_EXHIBIT1015LEASEAGREEMEN116.JPG" TITLE="PAGE 116" WIDTH="799" HEIGHT="1034">
<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10;Successor Owner shall have no obligation, nor incur any liability, beyond Successor Owner&#8217;s then &#13;&#10;interest, if any, in the Property, and Tenant shall look exclusively to such interest, if any, of &#13;&#10;Successor Owner in the Property for the payment and discharge of any obligations imposed upon &#13;&#10;Successor Owner hereunder or under the Lease, and Successor Owner is hereby released or &#13;&#10;relieved of any other liability hereunder and under the Lease. Tenant agrees that, with respect to &#13;&#10;any money judgment which may be obtained or secured by Tenant against Successor Owner, &#13;&#10;Tenant shall look solely to the estate or interest owned by Successor Owner in the Property, and &#13;&#10;Tenant will not collect or attempt to collect any such judgment out of any other assets of &#13;&#10;Successor Owner. Except as specifically provided in this Agreement, Lender shall not, by virtue &#13;&#10;of this Agreement, the Security Instrument or any other instrument to which Lender may be party, &#13;&#10;be or become subject to any liability or obligation to Tenant under the Lease or otherwise. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;5. NOTICE OF SECURITY INSTRUMENT. To the extent that the Lease shall entitle Tenant to notice of &#13;&#10;the existence of any Security Instrument and the identity of any mortgagee or any ground lessor, this &#13;&#10;Agreement shall constitute such notice to Tenant with respect to the Security Instrument and Lender. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;6. NON-DISTURBANCE. In the event of a foreclosure under the Security Instrument, so long as there shall &#13;&#10;then exist no Default (as such term is defined in the Lease) on the part of Tenant under the Lease, Lender &#13;&#10;agrees for itself and its successors and assigns that the leasehold interest of Tenant under the Lease shall &#13;&#10;not be extinguished or terminated by reason of such foreclosure, but rather the Lease shall continue in full &#13;&#10;force and effect and Lender shall recognize and accept Tenant as tenant under the Lease subject to the &#13;&#10;terms and provisions of the Lease except as modified by this Agreement. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;7. MISCELLANEOUS. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;a) NOTICES. All notices, demands, or other communications under this Agreement and the other &#13;&#10;Loan Documents shall be in writing and shall be delivered to the appropriate party at the address &#13;&#10;set forth below (subject to change from time to time by written notice to all other parties to this &#13;&#10;Agreement). All notices, demands or other communications shall be considered as properly given &#13;&#10;if delivered personally or sent by first class United States Postal Service mail, postage prepaid, or &#13;&#10;by Overnight Express Mail or by overnight commercial courier service, charges prepaid, except &#13;&#10;that notice of Default may be sent by certified mail, return receipt requested, charges prepaid. &#13;&#10;Notices so sent shall be effective three (3) days after mailing, if mailed by first class mail, and &#13;&#10;otherwise upon delivery or refusal; provided, however, that non-receipt of any communication as &#13;&#10;the result of any change of address of which the sending party was not notified or as the result of a &#13;&#10;refusal to accept delivery shall be deemed receipt of such communication. For purposes of notice, &#13;&#10;the address of the parties shall be: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Mortgagor: BMR-Axiom LP c/o &#13;&#10;BioMed Realty, L.P. &#13;&#10;17190 Bernardo Center Drive &#13;&#10;San Diego, California 92128 &#13;&#10;Attention: Real Estate Legal Department &#13;&#10;With copies to: Simpson Thacher &amp; Bartlett LLP &#13;&#10;425 Lexington Avenue &#13;&#10;New York, New York 10017 &#13;&#10;Attention: Krista Miniutti, Esq. &#13;&#10;Tenant: La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company &#13;&#10;10182 Telesis Court, Suite 600 &#13;&#10;San Diego, California 92121 &#13;&#10;Attention: Legal Department &#13;&#10;With copies to: Gibson, Dunn &amp; Crutcher LLP &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;COLOR:WHITE">
	&#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; 333 South Grand Avenue &#13;&#10;Los Angeles, California 90071 &#13;&#10;Attention: Mark S. Pecheck &#13;&#10;Lender: AB Commercial Real Estate Debt &#8211; B2 S.&#193;.R.L., &#13;&#10;c/o AllianceBernstein, L.P. &#13;&#10;1345 Avenue of the Americas &#13;&#10;New York, New York 10105 &#13;&#10;With copies to: Paul Hasting LLP &#13;&#10;200 Park Avenue &#13;&#10;New York, New York 10166 &#13;&#10;Attention: Eric F. Allendorf, Esq. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;Any party shall have the right to change its address for notice hereunder to any other location within the continental &#13;&#10;United States by the giving notice to the other parties in the manner set forth hereinabove. &#13;&#10;b) REMEDIES CUMULATIVE. All rights of Lender herein to collect rents on behalf of &#13;&#10;Mortgagor under the Lease are cumulative and shall be in addition to any and all other rights and &#13;&#10;remedies provided by law and by other agreements between Lender and Mortgagor or others. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;c) HEIRS, SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS. Except as otherwise expressly provided under the &#13;&#10;terms and conditions herein, the terms of this Agreement shall bind and inure to the benefit of the &#13;&#10;heirs, executors, administrators, nominees, successors and assigns of the parties hereto. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;d) HEADINGS. All article, section or other headings appearing in this Agreement are for &#13;&#10;convenience of reference only and shall be disregarded in construing this Agreement. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;e) COUNTERPARTS. To facilitate execution, this document may be executed in as many &#13;&#10;counterparts as may be convenient or required. It shall not be necessary that the signature of, or &#13;&#10;on behalf of, each party, or that the signature of all persons required to bind any party, appear on &#13;&#10;each counterpart. All counterparts shall collectively constitute a single document. It shall not be &#13;&#10;necessary in making proof of this document to produce or account for more than a single &#13;&#10;counterpart containing the respective signatures of, or on behalf of, each of the parties hereto. &#13;&#10;Any signature page to any counterpart may be detached from such counterpart without impairing &#13;&#10;the legal effect of the signatures thereon and thereafter attached to another counterpart identical &#13;&#10;thereto except having attached to it additional signature pages. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;f) EXHIBITS, SCHEDULES AND RIDERS. All exhibits, schedules, riders and other items &#13;&#10;attached hereto are hereby incorporated into this Agreement for all purposes. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;g) WAIVER OF TRIAL BY JURY. EACH OF TENANT, LENDER AND LANDLORD &#13;&#10;HEREBY IRREVOCABLY WAIVES ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY &#13;&#10;ACTION, PROCEEDING OR COUNTERCLAIM ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO &#13;&#10;THIS AGREEMENT. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;h) ENTIRE AGREEMENT. This Agreement contains the entire agreement between the parties &#13;&#10;and no modifications shall be binding upon any party hereto unless set forth in a document duly &#13;&#10;executed by or on behalf of such party. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;[No further text on this page] &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

	&#13;&#10;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Agreement as of the day and year first &#13;&#10;above written. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;NOTICE: THIS SUBORDINATION AGREEMENT CONTAINS A PROVISION WHICH ALLOWS &#13;&#10;THE PERSON OBLIGATED ON YOUR REAL PROPERTY SECURITY TO OBTAIN A &#13;&#10;LOAN, A PORTION OF WHICH MAY BE EXPENDED FOR PURPOSES OTHER THAN &#13;&#10;IMPROVEMENT OF THE LAND. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT, PRIOR TO THE EXECUTION OF THIS AGREEMENT, &#13;&#10;THE PARTIES CONSULT WITH THEIR ATTORNEYS WITH RESPECT HERETO. &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;&#8220;TENANT&#8221; &#13;&#10;LA JOLLA PHARMACEUTICAL COMPANY, &#13;&#10;a California corporation &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;By: &#13;&#10;Name: &#13;&#10;Title: &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10; &#13;&#10;[ACKNOWLEDGMENT ON THE FOLLOWING PAGE] &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	SECTION 302 CERTIFICATION
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	I, George F. Tidmarsh, certify that:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	I have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	3.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

	The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</DIV>

	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
